loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 47 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Arlyn has a rice milling business in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new equipment and gasoline.

Arlyn has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and gasoline

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария – из Виноградово. Она - замужем, у нее 3 детей. Мария работает на частном предприятии на должности контролёра. Работает уже 3 года. 
Мария необходима сумма в 11 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в ванной комнате, а именно сделать облицовку стен и пола керамической плиткой, установить газовую колонку, сделать монтаж водного насоса и труб, а также приобрести и установить смеситель в ванной. Так как ванна находится в плохом санитарном состоянии, Мария надеется за счет полученных средств улучшить эти условия.
texts.en: Mariya lives in Vinogradovo, she is married and has three children.  Mariya works for a private company as an inspector.  She has been working in this position for three years.  Mariya needs 11,000 hryvni to remodel her bathroom, specifically, to tile the floor and walls, to install a gas heater, to repair the water pump and pipes, and to purchase and install a faucet.  Since her bathroom is currently in a bad state, Mariya is hoping to use the loan to improve this condition.

loans.use: to remodel her bathroom

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Esperanza is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Esperanza has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 35 years old and lives in the town of Makidye in the Kampala, south region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 8 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, and salt. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items, such as sugar and water, for the shop to sell. It will help Christine generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a larger retail shop. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as sugar and water, for the shop to sell.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cherry has a Nito weaving business in the Philippines. Cherry requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her Nito weaving.

Cherry has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her Nito (native palm) weaving.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 39 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest port (Freeport) and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  She is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 18 years old.  Her children are in school and live at home. 

Since 1999 Patricia has been selling charcoal in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband.  She spends nine hours each day on her business and she is good at managing it.  Patricia is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  Her plan is to build a house for her children.  She appreciates the support of BRAC and promises to payback her loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 48 years old and is married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Eva has a nito-weaving business in the Philippines. Eva requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her nito-weaving.

Eva has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nito-weaving.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 33 years old and married with two children.

Candelaria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell to customers.

Candelaria has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Candelaria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 50 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Free-port, and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.

She is married with 7 children between 12 to 20, who attend school and  live at home. She has been selling under clothes in the local market for the past 2 years now. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her husband. 

Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more under clothes for her business. In the future, she wants to build house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more under clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 40 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala, south region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Sam has been working hard to manage his timber business, which sells timber. 

To help expand his business, Sam has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber to sell, which will help Sam generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Sam hopes that in the future, he will be able to open up another branch of the same business. 

Sam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Sam, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to sell.

loans.name: Pascol

texts.en:
Pascol is 30 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala, south region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 8 years, Pascol has been working hard to manage his bar shop, which sells drinks, such as soda, beer. 

To help expand his business, Pascol has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drinks, such as soda and beer, to sell, which will help Pascol generate greater profits, and pay school fees for his children. Pascol hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business into a whole sell shop. 

Pascol is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Pascol who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, such as soda and beer, to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and lives in Congo Town.  She is married with six children between the ages of 2 and 18.  Five of her children are in school and all of them live at home. 

For the past eight years Ruth has been selling slippers.  She started this business with money given to her by her brother.  Her favorite part about her business is that she makes a profit.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business.  In the future she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 34 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Arlyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Arlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Arlyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en: Janjay is 35 years old and lives at Congo town in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children who are 7 and 13 years old. They live at home and attend school. For the past years, she has been selling used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business makes her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Mbalu is 40 years old and is from the Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone.  She is married with four children ages 11 to  20 years old.  Three of her children are currently attending school.  

Mbalu runs a food stand within her community and sells rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.  She has been running this business since 1985.  She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day.  She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network within her operating area. 

Mbalu has requested a loan in order to buy, rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning for resale.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family.  In the future, she plans to expand her business.  She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 42 years old and married with six children between the ages of 2 years and 21 years. She runs a clothing business in the northern area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for five years and sells wax cotton and baby clothes. She says that the main challenge to her business is slow purchasing power during the rainy season.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more wax cotton and jeans for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her children and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton and jeans for resale.

loans.name: Ramatta

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Ramatta from Lunsar, Northern area. She is married with four children between the ages of 1 year and 15 years. She began this business to create a source of income.   

Ramatta runs a food stock business at her house; she sells palm oil, rice and pepper. She has been running this business for the past 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week. Ramatta says that her major problem is the poor road network.

Ramatta has requested a loan in order to buy more palm oil, rice and pepper. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and   become an international businesswoman. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice and pepper.

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en: Janjay is 30 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which is has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between 7 and 14 years old. Her children are in school and live at home. She has been selling rice, oil, pepper, etc for the past six years. She started this business with money from her susu (daily saving account). She learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the profit she makes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Nenia

texts.en:
Nenia is 42 years old and married with one kid.

Nenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from clothing sales.

Nenia aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fea

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Fea from Lunsar, Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 years and 13 years. Two of her children are currently attending school.  

Fea runs a business selling building material within her community. She sells cement, paint and zinc. She has been running this business since she was a young age. She works at the business every day, 12 hours per day. She says that her business is doing well. 

Fea has requested a loan in order to buy cement, paint and zinc to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy cement, paint and zinc to sell.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en: Ophelia is 32 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with a three-year-old who attends school and lives at home. She has been selling coal for the past six years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business,

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Aminata from Lunsar from the Northern area. She is married with seven children between the ages of 5 years and 25 years. She did not go to school and she got married at an early age.   

Aminata runs a business selling cosmetic items within a busy market area. She sells cream, earrings, chains and bracelets. She has been running this business for the past ten years. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Aminata says that at present her business is doing well.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy cream, earrings, chains and bracelets. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, she plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cream, earrings, chains and bracelets.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is 46 years old and married with four children.

Maria Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maria Lourdes has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Maria Lourdes aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mamadie

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mamadie from Port Loko, Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children. Two of her children are currently attending school.  She started this business to improve herself and her family.

Mamadie runs a business selling spare parts within her community. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that her business is doing well. 

Mamadie has requested a loan in order to buy radiators, brake oil, chains and engines. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she would like to see her business grow rapidly. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy radiators, brake oil, chains and engines.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Maxima está separada, no tiene hijos dependientes y vive en una casa donde cancela un alquiler mensual. La casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel primaria. Ella es empleada del sector area verde del municipio de El Alto pero en sus ratos libres se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de mantas
El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital para poder comprar por cantidad (lana de diferentes marcas y colores) y asi tener a disposicion para poder cumplir con el requerimiento.
El sueño de Maxima es  tener una tienda donde puedan exponerse sus diferentes trabajos a nivel nacional y asi tener mejor calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Maxima is separated, has no dependent children, and lives in a house where she pays a monthly rent.  Her house is located in the Rio Seco zone in the city of El Alto.  She only ever attended elementary school.  Maxima is a park employee for the city of El Alto but in her free time she makes and sells blankets.  She needs a loan to increase her capital so she can buy bulk amounts of wool in various styles and colors to have on hand so she can fill requirements.  Maxima’s dream is to have a shop where she can display her work nationally, which would enable her to have a higher quality of life.  This is the second time Maxima has requested a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wool in various colors and styles for her small business making blankets

loans.name: Moine

texts.en: Moine is 28 years old, and live in the Montserrado County which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 3 and 10 years old, who live at home and attends school. She is a tenth grade drop-out. She described herself as very hard working woman. For the past ten years she has been operating a business where she sells cow skins at the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband who is a local businessman. She enjoys her business because it gives her more money.  She sells for six days in a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses a bus to get her goods to the table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cow skins for the business. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cow skin for her business.

loans.name: Sundayway

texts.en: This is Sundayway again.  She is now 42 years of age and still lives in the Congo Town community. She is married with three children between the ages of 11 and 16. They live at home with their mother; only two of the children are attending school. She stopped her education in the 5th grade, and her husband is a contractor. She has been very hardworking and determined with her business for the past seven years. She sells (imported) ladies' slippers, handbags, blouses, and head ties. Because of the quality materials that she sells, she makes a profit every day. She sells for 12 hours a day. She purchases her goods from wholesale dealers, and transports them by a commercial vehicle. She is requesting her fifth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more (imported) ladies' slippers, handbags, and blouses for the business. She is grateful to all the lenders for the support they have given her in her business. Her dream is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more (imported) ladies' slippers, handbags, and blouses for the business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel es un buen estudiante que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo pretende terminar este año la carrera de Ciencias Jurídicas y su meta como todo estudiante de Derecho es hacer que se cumpla la justicia, con este rol llegar a una buena o mejor situación económica, y también poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas de la universidad y así poder seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Joel is a good student who plans to finish his law degree this year through much sacrifice and effort.  His goal, like any other law student is to make sure justice is done.  He also wants to improve his economic situation and help his family.

He is requesting a loan to pay for university costs so he can continue studying until he reaches his goal.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Nieves works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Nieves is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.  Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Nema 2 Group

texts.fr: LE BANC VILLAGEOIS DE NEMA 2 A ÉTÉ INAUGURE LE 24 MARS 2001. LA REPRÉSENTE MADAME CÉCILE, DIVORCEE ET MÈRE DE 4 ENFANTS EST MEMBRE DU GROUPE DE SOLIDARITÉ NOMME NGHATAMANE QUI SIGNIFIE S'ENTRE AIDER, TRAVAILLER POUR RÉUSSIR. ET LES MEMBRES DE CE GROUPE ONT CETTE MÊME VOCATION RÉUSSIR DANS LEURS ACTIVITÉS ET ELLES REMBOURSENT LEURS PRÊTS SANS DIFFICULTÉS. MADAME CÉCILE EST AGE DE 57 ANS ET ELLE S'EXERCE COMME ACTIVITÉ PRINCIPALE LE COMMERCE DES LÉGUMES COMME VENTE DE CAROTTES , CHOUX, TOMATE... ELLE S'APPROVISIONNE A DAKAR ET ELLE MENÉ CETTE ACTIVITÉ DEPUIS PLUS DE 13 ANS. SES BÉNÉFICES LUI SERVENT LE PAIEMENT DE SA LOCATION, L'EAU, ÉLECTRICITÉ, LA NOURRITURE ETC... MAIS ELLE A ÉGALEMENT OUVERT UN COMPTE POUR DE L’ÉPARGNE.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" Nema 2 was founded on 24th March 2001.  Madame Cécile is the representative for the Nghatamane Group.  The group's name means 'to help one another, to work for success'.  

Madame Cécile is 57 years old, a divorcée and mother to 4 children.  All the members of the Nghatamane group have the same aim, to be successful with their businesses.  They have always repaid their loans without any problems.  Madame Cécile's principal business is the sale of vegetables such as carrots, cabbages and tomatoes.  She buys her stocks in Dakar and she has operated this business for more than 13 years.  Her earnings pay for her rent, water, electricity, food, etc.  She also has a savings account.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Isatu from Port Loko. She is married with 6 children. She began her food market because she was trained in this business.

Isatu sells various items from a room in her house; she sells cigarettes, milk, pure water and other drinks. She has been running this business since 2000. Because the business is located in her home, she works all day, everyday.  Isatu says that at present her business is doing fine.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water, bagged milk and various drinks. The extra income produced from this loan will allow her to expand her business and take care of her family's needs. In the future, she plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water, bagged milk and drinks to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 21 years old, and lives in the Montserrado County which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with a five-year-old old child who is in school and lives at home. She has completed the 12th grade and has had a business for the past 3 years selling used clothes in the local market to make some money. She  started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend, who is a local businessman. She enjoys her business because it give her more money.  She sells for six days in a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she catches the bus to get her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and own a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Minever M.

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Minever M. from Liberia. She operates a shop selling charcoal in the Congo Town area of Liberia.  It is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  The area boasts one of the best standards of living in the county with affordable living, good roads, access to water and lots of transportation options. Minever M. is married with two children aged 14 and 20 years old. She is a high school graduate. For the past two years she has been selling charcoal in the local market.  She started the business with money given to her by her mother.  She enjoys her business because it gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7am to 6pm, and most of the time she uses a shared-taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business,

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Fanta from Port Loko. She is married with 3 children. Two of her children are currently attending school. she was a housewife but she began her shoe business because she wanted to contribute to paying the household expenses.  

Fanta runs a shoe shop where she sells shoes and slippers. She has been running this business since 1999. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that her business is doing well. 

Fanta has requested a loan in order to buy shoes and slippers to sell. The extra income that this loan will generate will allow her to pay to educate her children and expand her business. In the future, she would like to see her business grow rapidly. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes and slippers to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 49 years old, and lives in Montserrado County. She is married with a one year old child. She is a high school graduate and for the past 5 years she has been selling used clothes at the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Victoria is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to sell, and in the future her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 33 years old, and lives in Montserrado County. She is  married and has three children aged between 2 and 10,  only the two oldest children are in school and they all live at home. She has not completed the 5th grade, but she manages her business well. For the past five years, she has been selling slippers and body-cream at the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, she enjoys interacting with her customers. She works six days a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses the bus to get her stock to her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and body-cream for her business. Her plans are to build a house and pay for education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and body-cream for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 30 packets of locks of hair, 60 boxes of cream and three dozen ringlets.

loans.name: Gnambossou Gbeta 3 Group

texts.fr: GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 3 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Ivette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 41 ans. Ivette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Ivette est mariée à un certain Idris. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Ivette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Afin de répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Ivette vend des vivres ( riz et pâtes alimentaires) et divers produits à son domicile et par la méthode de distribution depuis dix ans. Ivette s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ivette s’associe aux autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 3 pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Gnambossou Gbeta 3 is a group composed of three people who live in the same neighbourhood. The leader of the group who is called Ivette (with her hand raised in the photo) is 41 years old. Ivette did not go to school. She is married to a man named Idris. They have three children, some of whom attend school at their expense. Ivette lives with her husband and their children. They share the family expenses. In order to provide for her family, Ivette has been selling food (rice, pasta) and various products from home and by delivery for ten years. Ivette buys her stock at the market in Benin. Hoping to reinforce her business, Ivette joins the other members of Gnambossou Gbeta 3 to request a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To buy food (rice, pasta) and various products.

loans.name: Baasneere Group

texts.fr:
Mr  SOULEYMANE est le responsable du groupe BAASNEERE. Marié, il est  père de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mr est gérant de boutique depuis 03ans.  Il s’approvisionne dans un grand  marché de la place. Ses clients sont les voisins.
Il veut s’acheter 02sacs de riz et 03bidons de d’huile de 20l pour revendre.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir sa boutique. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr Souleymane is the representative of the Baasneere Group.  He is married and has 2 children.  The oldest child is 7 years old, and the youngest is 4 years old.  One of the children goes to school and Souleymane is financially responsible for 3 people.  

Souleymane has run a shop for 3 years.  He buys his supplies in a large, local market.  His customers are his neighbours.  Souleymane will use this loan to buy 2 sacks of rice and 3 20-litre-barrels of oil for resale.  His earnings will be used to increase the size of his shop.  

In the future, he would like to be able to afford to send both his children to school.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice and 3 20-litre-barrels of oil for resale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un campesino de 38 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos. Desde muy joven aprendió todas las labores del campo y, hace 6 años es propietario de cultivos de café, ganado bovino y porcino, para lo cual posee muy buena infraestructura en una pequeña finca donde vive con su familia. Se caracteriza por su pujanza y su gran amor al trabajo, que desarrolla durante todos los días de la semana desde las primeras horas de la mañana, pues de esa manera genera los recursos económicos con los que ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de 9 salas de gestación para las cerdas, lo que le permitirá ampliar su ciclo productivo, lo que permitirá que su producción aumente y así satisfacer la demanda de lechones que se incrementa en la temporada navideña que se aproxima. Todo esto se reflejará en los buenos resultados de su negocio y afectará positivamente la economía de la familia, lo que ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar.
texts.en:
Juan is a 38-year-old farmer who is married and has three children.  He learned about farming when he was very young and six years ago he began growing coffee and raising sheep cattle and pigs.  He has a very good infrastructure set up on his small farm where he lives with his family.  He is known for his strength and love of work which he does every day of the week from the early morning hours.  This allows him to generate enough economic resources to support his family.

Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy nine gestation pens for his pigs so he can increase production and meet the demand for suckling pigs for the Christmas season.  This will make his business more profitable, having a positive effect on the family economy and lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy nine pig gestation pens to increase production.

loans.name: Gnambossou-Gbeta 2 Group

texts.fr: GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 2 est un groupe composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Koudiratou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Koudiratou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Koudiratou est mariée à un certain Gibril. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Koudiratou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Afin de répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Koudiratou vend depuis vingt ans des chaussures, des tissus et des mèches par la méthode de distribution. Koudiratou s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Koudiratou s’associe aux autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 2 pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gnambossou-Gbeta 2 is a group which is made up of 2 people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Koudiratou (the one with her hand raised in the picture) is 42 years old. Koudiratou did not go to school. She is married to Gibril. The couple have 3 dependent children who all attend school. Koudiratou lives with her husband and their children. The couple both cover the family's various expenses.

In order to be able to fulfill her family's needs, Koudiratou has been selling shoes, fabrics and hair extensions for 20 years, via the distribution channel. Koudiratou gets her supplies at markets in Benin and Togo. Koudiratou joins the other member of the Gnambossou-Gbeta 2 group in requesting a 4th loan from ALIDé, with the aim of strengthening her business. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy shoes, fabrics and hair extensions.

loans.name: Annick's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Annick (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans. Annick n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Annick est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Annick  vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Annick et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. C'est pour cette raison que dame, Annick vend depuis dix ans du maïs et divers produits (savons, sucre, biscuits)à son domicile. Annick s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Annick s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people, who all live in the same neighbourhood.  The group representative is Annick (with her hand raised in the photo), who is 29 years old.  Annick did not go to school.  She is married to Pierre, and they have three children who all attend school.  Annick and her  husband are financially responsible for their children, and they all live together.  Between them, Annick and Pierre pay for all the expenses of their household.  This is why Annick has been selling maize and various other products (soap, sugar, biscuits, etc) from her home for 10 years now.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.  

In order to strengthen her business, Annick has joined with the other members of her group to request this first loan from the field partner Alidé .

loans.use: to buy maize and other products (such as soap, sugar and biscuits).

loans.name: Afepeb 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AFEPEB 2 est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Blandine Léonie(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 61 ans. Blandine Léonie a très peu fréquenté. Blandine Léonie est veuve avec deux enfants, tous scolarisés et un reste à sa charge. Blandine Léonie vit avec ses enfants . Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Blandine Léonie. Dans le but, d'assumer ses responsabilités Blandine Léonie vend depuis trente cinq ans de la nourriture( riz accompagné de sauce et de poisson)dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Blandine Léonie vend des tissus par la méthode de distribution. Blandine Léonie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Blandine Léonie s’associe aux autres membres du groupe AFEPEB 2 pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Afepeb 2 is a group made up of 2 people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Blandine Léonie (the one with her hand raised in the picture) is 61 years old. Blandine Léonie did not get much schooling. She is a widow with 2 children, both of whom have attended school and one of whom remains in her care. Blandine Léonie lives with her child and covers the family's various expenses.

In order to be able to assume her responsibilities, Blandine Léonie has been selling prepared food (rice with fish and sauce) for 35 years in her region. She also sells fabrics via the distribution channel. Blandine Léonie gets her supplies at a market in Benin. Blandine Léonie joins the other member of the Afepeb 2 group in requesting a 4th loan from ALIDé, with the aim of strengthening her business. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy food items (rice, condiments and vegetable oil) and fabrics.

loans.name: Erika Alejandra

texts.es: Erika es una joven emprendedora de 23 años de edad que se dedica a la confección desde el año 2011. Aprendió la labor por medio de la observación y vio en esta actividad una oportunidad de negocio rentable, por lo que inició su propio taller con la ayuda de su esposo que se desempeña como docente. Con el apoyo de un crédito anterior compró su primera máquina con la que comenzó a desarrollar su actividad y poco a poco, gracias a su trabajo diario, fue mejorando su técnica y su destreza. Actualmente solicita su segundo ciclo crediticio con el que desea comprar una máquina fileteadora e insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, resortes), con esto podrá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y disminuirá el tiempo de producción aumentando su eficiencia, lo que se reflejará en más ventas y mejores ingresos, con los que podrá continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y además avanzará para cumplir el sueño de hacer crecer su negocio hasta convertirse en una mayorista de telas y confección. Erika es consciente que para lograr sus objetivos debe trabajar con mucha disciplina, dedicación y empeño, sólo así podrá tener la calidad de vida que desea disfrutar al lado de su pareja.
texts.en:
Erika, 23, is a young entrepreneur who has been in the sewing business since 2011.  She learned her trade through observation and thought it would be a good opportunity for a profitable business.  She set up her own sewing shop with the help of her husband who works as a teacher.  With a previous loan she was able to buy her first sewing machine and started her activity little by little.  Thanks to her daily efforts she has been able to improve her technique and skill.

She is currently requesting her second loan to buy an overlock sewing machine and wholesale supplies (fabrics, threads, buttons, snaps) so she can improve her work conditions and cut back on production time.  This will increase her efficiency, sales volume and income so she can continue contributing to the household economy and strive toward her goal of expanding busines and becoming a fabric and dressmaking wholesale dealer.   Erika is conscious that in order to meet her goals she must work with discipline, dedication and drive because it is the only way she and her husband will have a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine and wholesale supplies (fabrics, threads, buttons, snaps).

loans.name: Gnambossou Gbeta 5 Group

texts.fr: GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 5 est un groupe composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Dossi Jeanne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 61 ans. Dossi Jeanne a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Dossi Jeanne est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Gustave. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Dossi Jeanne vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour ce faire, Dossi Jeanne vend depuis trente ans du maïs, du haricot et du gari (farine de manioc)à son domicile. Dossi Jeanne s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Dossi Jeanne s’associe aux autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU GBETA 5 pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Gnambossou Gbeta 5 is a group made up of 2 people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Dossi Jeanne (the one with her hand raised in the picture), is 61 years old. Dossi Jeanne left school at secondary level. She is married to a retailer called Gustave. The couple have 5 children, all of whom attend/have attended school and 3 of whom are still in their care. Dossi Jeanne lives with her husband and their children. The couple both cover the family's various expenses. In order to be able to do this, Dossi Jeanne has been selling maize, beans and gari (cassava flour) from her home for 30 years. Dossi Jeanne gets her supplies at a market in Benin. Dossi Jeanne joins the other member of the Gnambossou Gbeta 5 group in requesting a 4th loan from ALIDé, with the aim of strengthening her business. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and gari (cassava flour).

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María, a sus 57 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos. Desde hace más de 30 años aprendió el oficio de la confección en un curso de capacitación que realizó y luego inició su propio negocio donde prestaba el servicio de modistería a diferentes personas del sector donde residía. Desde 1990, luego de haber ampliado sus conocimientos de y haber mejorado sus técnicas ella comenzó a confeccionar para terceros y, actualmente su mayor cliente es una reconocida tienda de deportes de la ciudad. Su taller está ubicado en su casa, allí está muy bien estructurado y a la vez puede alternar su trabajo con las labores del hogar. La cliente es una mujer dedicada, luchadora y muy organizada, con el apoyo de 7 créditos anteriores ha logrado fortalecer su negocio, por esta razón se motiva a solicitar un crédito más para comprar insumos al por mayor (lona y espuma) con lo que podrá sacar una gran producción que tiene pendiente y podrá mejorar sus ventas, atrayendo más clientes, lo que se reflejará en mejores ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. María desea seguir trabajando arduamente para que en un futuro su negocio le permita sacar una línea propia de artículos y uniformes deportivos, y que le permita disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de las personas que ama.
texts.en:
María, 57, is married and has three children.  Over 30 years ago she took a sewing course and then decided to open her own business offering sewing services to people in her neighborhood.  In 1990, after having increased her knowledge and improved her techniques she began working for third parties so now her best client is a well-known sportswear store in the city.  She works from home, which is well equipped, so she can alternate her work with the household activities.

The borrower is a delicate, hard-working, organized woman who has used her seven previous loans to strengthen her business.  She is motivated to request another loan to buy wholesale supplies (canvas and styrofoam) so she can produce pending orders.  This will increase her sales and attract more clients, giving her more income for household necessities.

María wants to continue working hard so that in the future she can launch her own line of sports uniforms and accessories.  This will give her and the people she loves a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy wholesale supplies (canvas and styrofoam)

loans.name: José Fernando

texts.es: José es un joven dinámico y emprendedor, que a sus 21 años de edad se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que adquirió hace un año, cuando los padres de un amigo eran propietarios de este negocio y pusieron la casa en arriendo porque se iban del país, por lo que José convenció a sus padres para tomar esta casa y así él podría continuar con la tienda, de esta forma ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios universitarios. Trabaja muy juicioso todos los días de la semana desde las 8:00 am hasta las 9:30 pm, pero en los horarios que tiene clases, su madre o su hermano menor le colaboran atendiendo a los clientes. Él ve en esta actividad una gran fuente de ingresos y un negocio muy rentable, pues es consciente de que los productos de la canasta familiar se venden a diario. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para realizar mejoras locativas (arreglar carpa exterior y una banca) y para comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, lácteos, huevos, granos, galletería, productos de aseo, entre otros), de esta forma su negocio tendrá una mejor imagen y además podrá abastecerse de productos de diferentes marcas para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, mejorando notablemente sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas. José con su espíritu de superación, desea seguir trabajando arduamente para sacar adelante su negocio, fortalecerlo y hacerlo crecer hasta convertirlo en un minimercado, que sea más rentable y que le permita ejercer sus profesión en su negocio; de esta manera desea mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia y terminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
José, 21, is a dynamic young entrepreneur who has his own business, a grocery store, which he started a year ago.  His parents were friends of the owners who rented out the property because they were leaving the country.  José convinced his parents to rent the house so he could set up a store and earn enough income to support the household economy and pay for university studies.  He works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 9:30 p.m.  During class time his mother or younger brother help at the store attending to customers.  

José believes this business is a good source of income and very profitable because families need to buy things on a daily basis.  He is requesting a loan to improve the store (fixing the outdoor awning and a bench) and to buy wholesale merchandise (cakes, dairy products, eggs, grains, cookies, personal hygiene products, etc.).  This will give his business a better image and allow him to have on hand different brands of products to satisfy customer demand.   Sales and income will improve considerably.  

José's determination to get ahead and continue working hard to strengthen his business and make it grow will allow him to turn it into a profitable mini-market where he can use his professsional knowledge.  He wants to improve his family's lifestyle and finish his university degree.

loans.use: To make store improvements (fix outdoor awning and a bench) and to buy goods wholesale (cakes, dairy products, eggs, grains, cookies, personal hygiene products, etc.)

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru: Лариса разведена. Живет сама. Она торгует на рынке овощами и фруктами. Вот уже много лет, как ее квартира требует ремонта. Необходимо заменить старый туалет, трубы в ванной комнате, отремонтировать нагреватель для горячей воды, а также положить кафель в ваной комнате. Для всего этого Ларисе нужны средства в размере 5,000 гривен. Лариса обращается с просьбой помочь отремонтировать свою квартиру и улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en: Larisa is divorced. She lives alone. She sells vegetables and fruit at the market. Her apartment has been in need of repair for many years now. It is necessary to replace her old toilet and the pipes in her washroom. She also needs to repair her hot water heater and lay tiling in the bathroom. For these repairs, Larisa needs 5,000 hryvnia. Larisa is making a request to help her repair her apartment and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина - вдова. У нее есть трое взрослых детей. Галина торгует детской и подростковой одеждой на рынке. В этом году Галина попала в больницу - были проблемы с желчным пузырем. Несмотря на трудности со здоровьем, она смогла преодолеть их и опять выйти на рынок торговать. Бизнес Галины - единственный источник ее дохода.

С целью привлечение большего числа покупателей Галине нужно расширить свой ассортимент. Галина хочет закупить теплые кофты и джинсы. Осень - время покупки теплой одежды и Галина надеется, что сможет увеличить товарооборот и соответственно свою прибыль.

Галина просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 5,000 гривен на закупку товара.
texts.en:
Galina is a widow. She has three grown-up children. Galina sells clothes for children and teenagers at the market. This year, Galina was in the hospital with gall-bladder problems. Despite the problems with her health, she was able to overcome them and start selling on the market again. Galina's business is her only source of income.

To attract more customers, Galina needs to expand her selection of clothes. Galina wants to buy warm jackets and jeans. Autumn is the time of year to buy warm clothes and Galina hopes that she can increase her sales turnover and thus, her profit. 

Galina is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia to buy products for retail.

loans.use: to purchase jeans and jackets for retail sale.

loans.name: Jeanne Ablawa's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Jeanne Ablawa (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 46 ans. Jeanne Ablawa a très peu fréquenté l'école. Jeanne Ablawa est mariée à un certain Christophe. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeanne Ablawa et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. C'est pour cette raison que dame, Jeanne Ablawa vend depuis quinze ans des tissus, des glacières, des chaussures et des bijoux par la méthode de distribution. Jeanne Ablawa s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Jeanne Ablawa s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is made up of two people who live in the same neighbourhood.  The group representative is Jeanne Ablawa (with her hand raised in the photo), who is 46 years old.  Jeanne Ablawa did not attend much school.  She is married to Christophe, and they have two children who are their financial responsibility, and who both attend school.  Jeanne Ablawa and Christophe are responsible for all the expenses of their household.  This is why she has distributed fabric, coolers, shoes and jewellery for 15 years.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.  In order to strengthen her business, Jeanne Ablawa has joined with the other member of her group to request this first loan from the field partner Alidé.

loans.use: to buy fabric, coolers, shoes and jewellery.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна – молодой предприниматель из Запорожья. Она торгует на одном из самых крупных рынков города – Анголенко. Она торгует польскими детскими товарами: верхней одеждой, бельем, шапочками и конвертами. Этот товар Анна считает самым качественным из доступных по цене большинству населения города. 

В этом году Анна нашла производителей своего товара в Польше и теперь работает с ними напрямую. Благодаря КИВА кредитам, Анна может передавать деньги поставщикам авансом (электронным платежем) и получать товар по более низкой цене. На данный момент кредит в 5,000 гривен Анне необходим для закупки зимних детских шапок.
texts.en:
Anna is a young entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells goods at Angolenko market, one of the biggest markets in the city. She sells Polish children's products: outerwear, underwear, hats and jackets. Anna considers her products to be the highest quality goods which are affordable to the residents of the city.

This year, Anna found the manufacturer of her products in Poland and now she works with them directly. Thanks to Kiva loans, Anna can transfer money to her suppliers as an advance (through electronic payments) and receive her products at a lower price. Anna currently needs 5,000 hryvnia to buy warm children's hats for winter.

loans.use: to purchase children's hats for retail sale.

loans.name: Cyntha

texts.en: Cynthia, age 48, is a university graduate. She lives in the community of Congo Town called Chugbor. She is a widow and the mother of two children who are ages 10 and 16, and who are currently in school. Cynthia started her business with the initial capital of 8,000 LRD, which she received from her brother. She has sold salt, pepper, onion, palm oil, vita, rice and black pepper for the past 15 years. She likes this type of business because she makes a profit. With the profit she buys more goods and attends to the needs of her children. Cynthia is requesting her fourth loan to purchase more rice, vita, onion, pepper and cooking oil for the business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, vita, onion, pepper and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 29 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is living together with her spouse and 2-year-old child. She stopped her education in the seventh grade but she sells pig feet through a business she manages well. Beatrice has sold these goods for the past eight years without encountering any problems. Her mother assisted with some funds, which she used to start her business. Beatrice is asking for a loan to buy more pig feet for her business in order to have some sustainable future plan.

loans.use: to buy more pig feet for her business.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна - предприниматель из Запорожья. Она продает женскую обувь. Благодаря предыдущему КИВА кредиту Татьяна увеличила товарооборот и получила дополнительную прибыль. 

Татьяна - вдова, живет вместе с сыном. В этом году они продали часть дома, где они жили и переехали в квартиру. За квартирой нужно меньше ухода, чем за домом, поэтому Татьяне теперь легче и остатется больше времени для бизнеса и для сына.

Татьяна участвовала в обувной выставке со своим товаром. Это помогло ей увидеть современные тренды и принимать правильные решения при закупке обуви. Татьяна просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 21,000 гривен для покупки женской зимней обуви. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и продолжать помогать сыну оплачивать колледж, где он учится.
texts.en:
Tatyana is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She sells women's shoes. Thanks to her previous Kiva loan, Tatyana increased her sales turnover and received additional profits.

Tatyana is a widow who lives with her son. This year, they sold the part of their house where they lived and moved into an apartment. An apartment requires less upkeep than a house, so its now easier for Tatyana and she has more time for her business and her son. 

Tatyana took part in a shoe exposition with her products. This helped her to find out the latest trends and make correct decisions when purchasing shoes. Tatyana is asking for a loan in the amount of 21,000 hryvnia to buy women's winter shoes. She hopes to receive additional profits and continue to help her son pay for college, where he is currently studying.

loans.use: to purchase women's winter shoes for retail sale.

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es: Jorge, a sus 37 años de edad, es casado y padre de tres hijos. Durante 15 años se ha dedicado a trabajar como maestro de obras de construcción, prestando sus servicios en diferentes municipios de la región antioqueña. Esta actividad la aprendió de su familia y ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos con los que ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y esposa. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, pujante y activo, sus ganas de progresar lo impulsan a buscar opciones para seguir avanzando, por ello solicita el crédito, con el que comprará activos y herramientas de trabajo (máquina cortadora, pulidora, motosierra y herramientas de mano), con lo que podrá mejorar sus trabajos y atraer nuevos clientes, además podrá disminuir los costos de producción, pues tendrá la maquinaria necesaria para realizar las labores y no tendrá que recurrir al alquiler de equipos y herramientas. Todo esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ingresos, con los que podrá brindar un mejor bienestar a su familia y disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida en compañía de sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
37-year-old Jorge is married and has three children. He has worked for fifteen years as a foreman in different construction sites around the region of Antioquia. He learned this activity from his family and it has been his main source of income, helping him to support his children and wife.

Jorge is known to be a hardworking, persistent and energetic man. His will to get ahead makes him look for more opportunities to progress and this is why he is requesting a loan. He will buy tools (a cutting machine, a sanding machine, a chain saw and manual tools) that will help him to improve the quality of his works and attract new clients. He will also reduce his costs, since he will have the machines he requires without needing to rent them from someone else. All this will result in an increase in his income, well-being for his family and the possibility to enjoy better living conditions together with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy tools such as a cutting machine, a sanding machine, a chainsaw and manual tools.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel, con 46 años de edad, es padre soltero de un hijo adolescente y cabeza de hogar. Por dificultades económicas y por falta de oportunidades laborales, decidió iniciar su propio negocio y comenzó a vender frutas en una carreta, se ubica a las afueras de una de las estaciones del tren de la ciudad y de esta forma ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para sacar a su hijo adelante y para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Su empuje, empeño y dedicación le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos, especialmente económicos, sin embargo esto no lo detiene para seguir luchando y lograr sus objetivos. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en el pago del saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente y para comprar surtido al por mayor (frutas en cosecha), de esta forma podrá disminuir costos y así mejorar el margen de ganancias que obtiene por las ventas de estas frutas. Miguel sueña con seguir trabajando arduamente y ahorrar para que en un futuro cercano pueda montar otro puesto de venta de frutas y así poder brindar oportunidad de empleo a un familiar, así mejorará no sólo su calidad de vida, sino también la de su núcleo familiar, además tendrá la posibilidad de dar a su hijo una mejor educación.
texts.en: Miguel is 46 years old. He is a single father of a teenage son and a head of household. Due to financial difficulties and a lack of work opportunities, he decided to start his own business and began to sell fruit from a cart. It is located outside of one of the city train stations and this generated enough income    to get his son ahead and pay for the basic household expenses. His drive, hard work and dedication have allowed him to get ahead, overcoming different obstacles, especially financial ones. They haven't stopped him from continuing to fight to achieve his goals. Right now, he is asking for the loan to invest in paying off an existing loan that he has and to buy merchandise wholesale (fruit in season). This way, he can lower costs and improve his profit margin from selling the fruit. Miguel dreams of continuing to work hard and save so that in the near future he can open another fruit sales locale an offer a job opportunity to a relative. This way, not only will he improve his own quality of life, but that of his family as well. He will also have the possibility of giving his son a better education.

loans.use: to pay off an existing loan that he has and to buy merchandise wholesale (fruit in season).

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy is 36 years old and has 4 children - 3 daughters aged 7, 11, and 3, and a son aged 4. She lives in Jemaga village in Galona, Kenya. Jemaga village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from an unprotected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Nancy and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Nancy works as a peasant farmer, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Nancy and other promoters in her community - Everlyne, Paulo and Solomon, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Nancy will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. She wants to be a promoter because she believes the program will help prevent waterborne diseases. Nancy believes that the dispenser will help her community prevent sickness and access safe water.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits.  Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Nancy’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence of Museywa village in Jipchekwen, Kenya, has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. 42 year old Florence has some primary school education. She lives in house with mud walls, a dirt floor, and an iron roof with her husband and 7 children. 

Museywa village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink.

Florence and the 14 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a chlorine dispenser at the water sources. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Jimin, Damaris, Phanice and Mary. 

Florence has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. She volunteered to be the promoter because she is well-liked and is reliable. She believes the chlorine dispenser will ensure the community has good health.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Florence’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en: Tanneh is a 36-year-old woman and lives at the West point area which has the most populated market in the Montserrado County. She is married, and has 3 children aged between 10 and 15 years.  Only one is  in school and two of her children live at home. She described herself as a hardworking woman.  For the past three years she has been running a market-table where she sells rice, oil, pepper, onion etc in the local market.  She sells six days a week from 7am to 6pm.  She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by husband. She used a shard-taxi every time to get her goods at her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, onion etc for her business, she plans is to build a house for her children.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, onion etc for her business,

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Finda is 32 years old and lives in the West point area which has the most populated market in the Montserrado County. She is single and was unable to go to school. She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past four years, she has been selling soft drinks in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7am to 5pm. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her.  She started this business with money given to her by mother.  She uses a shared-taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Benjamin's Group

texts.en:
In Kipsigor village in Givogi, Kenya, Benjamin  has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Benjamin has 5 children, and is a friendly, goal oriented, hardworking, reliable and trustworthy, well liked member of the community. Benjamin lives in a house with mud walls, a dirt floor, and an iron roof with his wife and children. 

Kipsigor village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a river. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Benjamin and the 10 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Benjamin has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. He volunteered to be the promoter because he values health and wants to help the community be healthy. He believes the dispenser will help kill bacteria and prevent diseases. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Lucy, Francis, Hezron and Jane.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Benjamin’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
36 year old Catherine has lived in Chepturei village in Kipchekwen sub-location, Kenya for 19 years with her husband and 6 children.

The community of Chepturei village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Chepturei’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from re-contamination. In Chepturei, 25 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water.

Catherine has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. Catherine volunteered to be the promoter because she believes that the dispenser will prevent waterborne diseases. Chepturei village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Isack,Phanice, Risper and Shem.   

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Catherine’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
In Kapsogoro village in Kipchekwen, Kenya, Rose, a widow, has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Rose is a hardworking and trustworthy member of the community with 4 children. Unfortunately 76 year old Rose does not remember the ages of her children but can tell those of her grandchildren. Rose lives alone in house with mud walls, a dirt floor, and an iron roof.

Kapsogoro village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Rose and the 21 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Rose has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. She volunteered to be the promoter because the community will be able to access safe water through the chlorine dispenser. The dispenser will prevent waterborne diseases. There are three other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Ezina, Josphine, and Jane.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Rose’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers.

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 57 years old and has 3 children. She lives in Gimarakwa B village in Kenya. Gimarakwa B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected dug well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Gladys and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Gladys is a retired nurse, and is involved in farming activities. She has volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Gladys and other promoters in her community - Ali, Cliffe and Catherine need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Gladys will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. She wants to be a promoter because she has been a nurse and has also been volunteering to help people. She wants to help to encourage people to continuously use chlorine because of her knowledge in health matters. Gladys believes that the chlorine in the dispenser will kill germs to make water safe for community to use.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Gladys’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers.

Kitambazi A village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a river. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Ruth and the 30 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Two other promoters from the neighboring villages, Eric and Joseph, are part of this group loan.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink.
