loans.name: Resitala

texts.en: Resitala is a 27-year-old lady with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, dripping oil and plastic bags. In the future, Resitala hopes to improve her business, upgrade her family standards of living and help her child's education. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, dripping oil and plastic bags.

loans.name: Meleane

texts.en: Meleane is a 66-year-old widow with 4 children. She makes and sells pancakes, rice and curry in Vailuutai Primary School and in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Meleane needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, baking soda, boxes of chicken, bags of rice, curry powder and a kerosene oven. She plans to use her profits to save for family needs. Meleane has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, dripping oil, baking soda, boxes of chicken, bags of rice, curry powder and a kerosene oven.

loans.name: Gulguncha

texts.ru: Гулгунча родилась в 1970 года. Она замужем и воспитывает 4 детей. Она хранительница очага своего дома. Гулгунча всегда хотела, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование и стали высококвалифицированными специалистами. Она работает в государственном учреждении. Гулгунча полученную зарплату старается тратить целенаправленно и без лишних затрат, но ее зарплата маленькая и не хватает для оплаты учебного договора своих детей, которые учатся в школе и в университете. Ее старший ребенок учится в Национальном Университете Таджикистана, и она должна оплатить за учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4700 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulguncha was born in 1970. She is married and is raising 4 children. She is a homemaker and manages the household. Gulguncha always wanted her children to receive a higher education and become highly qualified specialists. She works in a government agency. Gulguncha does her best to spend her salary purposefully and without wasteful spending, but her salary is small and not enough to pay for the children's tuitions, who study at school and at university. Her oldest child studies at the National University of Tajikistan and she needs to pay for his tuition. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,700 somoni. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for education of her child at the university

loans.name: Fred's Group

texts.en:
Fred, a reliable member of the community, has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser in Givvigoi village in Ivola, Kenya. Fred is married with 6  children, the eldest being 34 years and the youngest 10 years.

Givvigoi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. 

Fred and the 9 households using the protected spring need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a chlorine dispenser. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Joseph, Janet, James and Victor.

Fred has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. He volunteered to be the promoter because he lives nearest to the waterpoint. He wants to make sure his community is protected from waterborne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Fred’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en:
53-year-old Jacob lives in Gimariani A village in Mwembe, Kenya with his wife and 5 children. The community of Gimariani A village collects their drinking water from an unprotected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of rural Kenya. loans.name: William

texts.es: William es un hombre de 41 años de edad, padre de cuatro hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Durante 13 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en su propio negocio, una venta de crispetas, sus ventas las realiza en una moto que adecuó para llevar su producto por uno de los corregimientos de la ciudad; de esta forma ha podido generar los recursos necesarios para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. El cliente es un hombre pujante y activo, se esmera por sacar adelante a sus hijos y su esposa y, siempre busca opciones que le permitan seguir avanzando. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en los arreglos del vehículo donde vende sus productos (cambiar llantas y arreglar motor), de esta forma mejorará las condiciones de trabajo y podrá continuar con su labor, generando los recursos que requiere para sostener a su familia y con los que podrá ahorrar para en un futuro poder adquirir una casa propia, donde pueda disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar al lado de las personas que ama.
texts.en: William is a 41 year old man and the father of four children and lives with his partner. For 13 years he has worked at his own business selling popcorn. He sells from a motorcycle that he adapted to take his product through city neighborhoods. In this way, he has been able to generate enough resources to support his home. He is a driven and active man who works hard to get his children and wife ahead. He is always seeking opportunities that will allow him to keep advancing. He is asking for the loan to invest in repairing the vehicle he sells his products from (changing the tires and fixing the motor). In this way, he will improve his work conditions and be able to continue with his work, generating resources he needs to support his family and save so that in the future he can acquire his own home and enjoy a better quality of life and well being for the ones he loves.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on the vehicle where he sells his products (to change the tires and fix the motor).

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives close to Cherengani, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

James works as a farmer, and is cultivating maize and beans on his farm. He has been farming for 10 years. He is married, and has four children. James is very excited about becoming a beekeeper, as he believes it is a good project with good returns.

James plans on using the income generated by his beehives to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha lives on a farm outside of Kitale town, in Kitale county. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Elisha is married, and has six children. His wife works as a teacher, while he farms their land. He has been farming for over 18 years, and cultivates maize, beans, vegetables, and bananas, and he has many trees on his farm. 

Eilsha sees Honey Care’s partnership with Kiva as a great way to start beekeeping, which he believes is a business that will enable him to educate his children. Elisha is one of the founding members of the community based organization that many individuals in his region have joined, and his hope for the future is to continue to find projects and programs that will benefit the members and achieve the objectives of his group.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives and works in the Cherengani region, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

David is married, and has seven children. Both he and his wife farm their land, and he has been farming for 20 years. He is currently growing maize, beans and horticulture products, as well as practicing dairy farming.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne lives in the Cherengani region, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Anne is married, and has seven children. Both she and her husband are farmers; they plant maize, beans, and bananas and practice dairy farming. They have done this for a period of 15 years. Anne is excited to become a beekeeper, as this will help her achieve the objectives of the community group she has joined. 

Anne’s hope for the future is to diversity her revenue stream from her farm. She says farmers in the area have over-relied on maize and in the past three years production of maize has not been so good due to drastically changing weather as well as fungal diseases that are destroying their maize crop entirely. Bee keeping will be an alternative source of income for her and the entire community, and will help provide for their needs.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

Alice is married, and she has five children. She teaches young children, while her husband works as a social service officer. Alice also farms her land: she cultivates maize, vegetables, beans, and bananas, and she has an orchard with various fruit plants. She also does livestock rearing.

Alice is happy that she will get hives for the production of honey, as she loves honey and hopes to enjoy the income as well.

This is Alice’s first loan, and she plans to use much of this money coming from the sale of honey for her children’s education.

She thanks Kiva lenders for this initiative.  She believes that it will reduce the level of poverty in her area.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is married, and has three children. She works as a teacher, while her husband is in the agriculture sector. When asked about why she is interested in beekeeping, Dorcas said that she can’t express her happiness at being part of honey production. She originally came from Marakwet, a region in the northeast part of Kenya, before her family was settled near Kitale, and when she was younger her neighbors did bee keeping. Dorcas “can’t forget those days as a young girl enjoying honey.” Although she was the last member of her group to show up to the meeting, and had to walk a long distance to register for this program, she remained enthusiastic, and said that she “lacks adjectives to describe her happiness and gratitude to KIVA.”

Dorcas lives in the Cherengani region, near Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900's, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Daniel is married and has two children. Both he and his wife are farmers, and they have been farming for five years. They are currently growing maize, bananas and beans on their land as well as maintaining natural forests. This natural forest cover will be very beneficial to his beehives as it will allow his bees almost constant access to the flowers they need to make honey. 

This is Daniel’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to educate his children and “improve farming in general.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka lives near Cherengani, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Luka is married, and has six children. Both him and his wife are farmers, and have been farming for ten years. They are currently growing beans, maize, bananas and millet on their land, as well as tending to livestock and cultivating a trees.

This is Luka’s first loan, and he is very excited to become a beekeeper, as it will complement his farming activities and does not require much space on his farm. He hopes to use the income from his beehives to pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives near Cherengani, close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Joseph is married, and has two children. Both he and his wife are relatively new farmers, having farmed for five years, but they have a variety of farming projects going, including maize, beans, bananas, a tree nursery and a livestock pen. 

This is Joseph’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to save for his young children’s education.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives and works close to Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Jonathan is married, and has one child. He works as a teacher, while his wife stays at home and takes care of the house. He and his wife have been farming for three years, and are currently growing maize, beans and vegetables. 

Jonathan is excited to start beekeeping, as he sees it as a profitable activity that requires little work to keep up. This is Jonathan’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income for family use as well as investment in his farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives and works close to Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Peter is married, and has five children. Both he and his wife are experienced farmers, having owned their plot for 28 years, and are currently growing maize, vegetables, beans and sunflowers as well as raising livestock and tending to natural forest on their land. 

This is Peter’s first loan with Kiva, and he is excited for the chance “to improve my farming practices” through beekeeping. Peter plans to use the income generated by his beehives to help his family.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives and works close to Cherengani, in the Kitale region. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Peter is married, and has eight children. He and his wife have been farming for twenty years, and are currently growing beans and maize on their land, tending to a fruit orchard, rearing livestock and tending to eucalyptus tree plantations. The eucalyptus trees will be a treat for his bees: the trees sprout many small flowers that are excellent for bee colonies, and they produce unusually clear and light honey with a clean and sweet taste. 

This is Peter’s first loan with Kiva, and he is very happy that he and his group had the chance to participate in the program. He plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Lynda

texts.en:
Lynda, who is originally from New York City, has lived in Boston since 1990.

She has been working on home remodeling and painting since 1997 as an individual contractor. Since May of 2005, Lynda is the founder and sole operator of Narman Construction Inc., a fully insured and licensed general contractor corporation which specializes in roofing, kitchen design, bathroom remodeling and painting, and other auxiliary services. Her business is accredited A+ by the Better Business Bureau.

Narman Construction Inc. was originally founded and owned by Lynda and her ex-husband in 2005, but once they separated and, eventually divorced, she became the sole owner and operator. Determined to not give up on her business and her entrepreneur goals, she has continued to expand and grow the business through tough economic times. "When I decided to embark on becoming one of very few general contractors in the state, I never dreamed there would be so many opportunities for women in the trade," she says. Despite various setbacks, Lynda has persevered.

One of the difficulties that Lynda has run into is securing working capital to cover labor, materials, and the needed equipment to complete jobs. Lynda’s success to date derives from her outstanding customer service, as she provides estimates and consultations to better understand the needs of her potential clients and, of course, timely and accurate completion of the projects. Her clients include homeowners, commercial property managers, and some projects from the state of MA.

Help Lynda continue to build her dream with a loan.

loans.use: to obtain Xactimate training and continuing education as required by the state.

loans.name: Rubi

texts.en:
Rubi, who hails from the Dominican Republic, started Total Green Cleaning two and a half years ago. His business offers a wide variety of services to numerous clients in the Central Florida region, from corporate establishments to residential homes. 

Rubi lives at home with his daughter and hopes to continue building his business in order to someday pass it on to her. One of the most challenging aspects of owning his own business is not having the necessary cash flow. Rubi says, "It's hard when I don't have the money upfront to pay my employees. Finding a loan has been close to impossible... all I want is to establish a stable business."

Total Green Cleaning is committed to the environment and all products used are eco-friendly. One of the most requested services is carpet cleaning; this service includes pre-spray application, deep steam cleaning and carpet deodorizer. Rubi also does painting, remodeling and renovation, drywall repair, flooring installation, new bathrooms/kitchens, and general renovations. 

Rubi needs additional working capital to buy a new computer and an updated version of QuickBooks. Help him achieve his dreams with a loan!

loans.use: To purchase a new computer and an updated version of Quickbooks.

loans.name: Delton

texts.en:
“If you build it, they will come.” This was the quote which inspired Delton to start his own auto detailing and cleaning business. Delton watched others and learned from their example how to run his business.  Little by little, his determination to get the job done and his ability to connect with his customers built him a steady base of clients.

Since the early 90s, Delton has woken up early every morning, ended later than scheduled, and worked on the weekends in order to make sure that he provides the most convenient service to his clientele. He has also shifted his business to focus on the use of green products that protect the paint coat on the vehicles he services.  His hard work has paid off--Delton has become very well known in the community for providing quality service.

Now, Delton has reached a point where he needs to hire additional help to ensure the quality of customer service with which he built the foundation of his business. With this loan, Delton will hire an employee to keep up with the demand. Delton is excited to be able to share with this employee his own experience and teach them about being a business owner. 

Help Delton hire an additional employee for his business, ensuring the future of his business!

loans.use: To expand his business by hiring an independent contractor.

loans.name: Naimah

texts.en:
In 1982, Naimah was a homeless single mother with three children and one skill--she could type. It was shortly thereafter that Naimah discovered that two of her children had learning disabilities. In an effort to help them, she spent two summers in New York City learning the Spalding Reading method in order to teach her children how to read. She realized she had a knack for teaching and began teaching both children and adults how to read, meeting them in their homes and at local fast food establishments.

Through hard work and dedication, Naimah obtained an AS in Small Business Management and was pursuing a BA in General Business. However, Naimah endured another setback when she was diagnosed with carpal tunnel and fibromyalgia. "The doctor suggested I change my lifestyle, so I did. I quit a high-paying job at a utility company and started my life all over again," she says. It was after this setback that Naimah returned to teaching. She obtained her Masters in elementary curriculums, certificate in graduate studies in early childhood, and a Master's in adult learning. It was after this that she launched Babbling Brook Family Tutoring Services (BBFTS).

BBFTS will offer after-school programs as well as general services for those who want to improve their grammar and conversational skills. Clients will be students age 14 and up and the Spanish speaking population in the East Boston area, where the business is located. Lessons will be offered in group classes, as well as one on one consultation. Naimah has two partners in her business--a woman who speaks Spanish and a her youngest daughter who serves as her accountant and bookkeeper. 

Naimah is looking for capital to cover the lease for her learning center and to purchase advertising in order to promote her business.

Help Naimah help others with your loan.

loans.use: To cover the lease for her learning center and advertising to build a client base.

loans.name: Iliui

texts.en: Iliui is a 54-year-old married woman with 12 children. She makes and sells curry and rice in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Iliui needs a loan to buy a bag of rice, boxes of chicken, salt, garlic, onions, flour and cooking oil. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, boxes of chicken, salt, garlic, onions, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru: Розия добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 53 года. Розия с юных лет была жизнерадостной и позитивной женщиной. Она всегда мечтала стать любимой женой и хорошей мамой. Однако она не сошлась с мужем и после нескольких лет семейной жизни, она развелась. Розия воспитывает одного сына. Она не вышла замуж во второй раз и посвятила всю свою жизнь своему сыну. Розия работает в государственном учреждении. Она честно выполняет свою работу и поэтому ее начальство довольно ее работой. Скоро ее сын жениться. Розия хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Розия давно мечтала, чтобы ее сын женился, и она сыграла пышную свадьбу. Однако она вместе с сыном живёт в доме, которое имеет плохое состояние. Она срочно должна отремонтировать свой дом, но она не имеет денег, чтобы купить строительные материалы как цемент, краски, обои и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Roziya is a conscientious and hardworking woman. She is 53 years old. From a young age, Roziya has been a cheerful and positive woman. She always dreamed of becoming a beloved wife and good mother. However, she did not get along with her husband and after several years of family life, she got divorced. Roziya is raising one son. She did not get remarried and has dedicated her whole life to her son. Roziya works in a state agency. She does her job honestly, which is why her boss is pleased with her work. Her son is getting married very soon. Roziya wants to repair her house. Roziya has long dreamed of her son getting married and giving him a spectacular wedding. However, she lives with her son at their house, which is in a state of disrepair. She urgently needs to repair her house, but she does not have the money to buy construction materials like cement, paint, wall-paper, etc. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, paint and wall-paper to repair her house.

loans.name: Fonofili

texts.en:
Fonofili is 44 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling chop suey, chicken curry, steamed rice and BBQ in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Fonifili has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, foil, a bag of rice, curry powder, garlic, onions, gas and foam plates. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fonofili will use her profits to improve her business and help her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, foil, a bag of rice, curry powder, garlic, onions, gas and foam plates

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 28 years old and married with one child. She owns and operates a business venture, Elei. She has two years of experience in this line of business. Rosalina needs a loan to buy a roll of materials, fabric,  colored paints, stencils, brushes and an 'elei' board design. She hopes to use her profits to provide for family daily needs. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a roll of materials, fabric,  colored paints, stencils, brushes and an 'elei' board design

loans.name: Faimeaalii

texts.en:
Faimeaalii is a 39-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages. tomatoes, eggplant, etc to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Faimeaalii has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, a shovel, a garden rake, chemicals, vegetable seeds and a garden hose.
 
She joined SBPD in 2013. With her profits, Faimeaalii hopes to assist her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a shovel, a garden rake, chemicals, vegetable seeds and a garden hose

loans.name: Apoiliu

texts.en:
Apoiliu is 38 years old and married with  no children.  She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumber, eggplant, etc. that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Apoiliu needs a loan to buy chemicals, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a file,  a bushknife and a garden hose for her garden. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Apoiliu will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a file,  a bushknife and a garden hose

loans.name: Rarotoga

texts.en:
Rarotoga is a 55-year-old married woman with two children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Rarotoga has requested a loan to buy a chain saw, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, taro root crops and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Rarotoga hopes to help improve her family's standard of living and meet their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a chain saw, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, taro root crops and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Iutita

texts.en:
Iutita is a 20-year-old married woman with three children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taros, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Iutita has requested a loan to buy chemicals,a backpack sprayer, barbed wire, bushknives and a rake. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Iutita hopes to provide for her family's everyday needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, barbed wire, bushknives and a rake.

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en:
Tumema is a 48-year-old married woman with children. She has a small plantation that grows taro, taamu (a large root vegetable) and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Tumema has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a digger and a weed sprayer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Tumema hopes to improve her housing.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a digger and a weed sprayer.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 54 years old and married with three children.

Leah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (general) store.

Leah has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Leah aspires to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (general) store.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Teresita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 30 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising chickens and pigs in the Philippines. Agnes is borrowing 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Agnes has been raising chickens for three years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Silvan

texts.en:
Silvan is a 39-year-old married father of three who resides with his family in Cogon, Ozamiz City. Silvan has a business selling a variety of fruits in the market, and he now needs additional capital to improve his offering to customers. He has requested a new loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit for this purpose.

The resulting additional profits will enable Silvan to save for the future education of his children. His plan is to eventually buy a motorcycle to use in the business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to resell

loans.name: Gnambossou-Gbeta Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Sidoine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 52 ans. Sidoine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Sidoine est mariée à un certain Marcel. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sidoine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Sidoine vend divers produits (sucre, lait, savons...) à son domicile depuis dix sept ans. Sidoine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Sidoine s’associe aux autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA is composed of two persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Sidoine (with her hand raised in the photo) is 52 years old. Sidoine did not attend school. She is married to a man named Marcel. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. The couple jointly ensure that the various household expenses are covered. To do so, Sidoine has been selling a variety of goods (sugar, milk, soaps, …) at her home for seven years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her business, Sidoine joined with the other member of the group GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA to request a fourth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to purchase various products (sugar, milk, soap,...)

loans.name: Norfely

texts.en:
Norfely is 54 years old, married and has four children.

Norfely works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from rice farming and pig fattening. 

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like bread, biscuits, shampoo, sardines and other groceries. Norfely has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Norfely aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, biscuits, shampoo, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 52 years old , married and has four children.

Susan is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Susan has been raising chickens for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

Susan requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her chickens.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her chickens.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is 26 years old and married with one kid.

Cherryl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

She has been running the variety store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Cherryl aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Ermelinda to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as body lotion, cigarettes, noodles, salt, eggs, milk, coffee, sugar, Fanta and Coca-Cola. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Ermelinda independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, cigarettes, noodles, salt, eggs, milk, coffee, sugar, Fanta and Coca-Cola.

loans.name: Reymoor

texts.en:
Reymoor, 32 years old and single, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a farm to earn a living, planting and harvesting rice to sell in the local community. In business for four years, Reymoor earns about 20,000PHP every month. To earn additional income, he provides motor transport services to his local community. 

Reymoor joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. The previous loans that he used for his farm were successfully repaid. He has requested a new one for 40,000 PHP to renew his licenses and motor registration and buy accessories for his vehicle to provide better service to his customers. 

Reymoor's dream is to buy a four-wheeled vehicle to use in his transportation business.

loans.use: to renew licenses and motor registration and buy accessories for his vehicle

loans.name: Gnambossou-Gbeta 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 1 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Marie Thérèse (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 49 ans. Marie Thérèse n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Marie Thérèse est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Paulin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie Thérèse vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Marie Thérèse et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour ce faire, Marie Thérèse vend du gari (farine de manioc), du maïs et du haricot à son domicile depuis dix sept ans. Marie Thérèse s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Marie Thérèse s’associe aux autres membres du groupe GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 1 pour solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group "GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 1" is composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Marie Thérèse (with her hand raised in the photo), is 49 years old. Marie Thérèse did not attend school. She is married to a retailer named Paulin. The couple have four children, all in school and in their care. Marie Thérèse lives with her husband and her children. She and her husband jointly ensure that the various household expenses are covered. To do so, she has been selling 'gari' (cassava flour), corn, and beans at her home for seven years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. With the goal of bolstering her business, Marie Thérèse joined with the other members of the group GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 1 to request a fourth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to purchase gari (cassava flour), corn, and beans

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is 55 years old, married and has five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nonita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 34 years.

Nonita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Nonita would like to save enough money to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 25 years old and married with two children.

Alona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening. 

Alona requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like sugar, soap, diapers, sardines and other groceries.

Alona has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan.

Alona aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, soap, diapers, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, a 49-year-old married mother of seven, has been earning a living by raising chickens in the Philippines for the past five years. She earns additional income from fishing.

As she works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business, Gina is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Flavien's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Le représentant du groupe, nommée Flavien (celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgé de 50 ans. Flavien a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Flavien est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Pauline. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Flavien vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. Flavien et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Flavien produit et commercialise de l'eau minérale communément appelée Pure Water depuis huit ans à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Flavien exerce la fonction d'aide comptable dans une structure de la place. Flavien s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Flavien s’associe aux autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: This group is composed of two persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Flavien (with his hand raised in the photo), is 50 years old. Flavien has a middle school education. He is married to a retailer name Pauline. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Flavien lives with his wife and his children. He and his wife jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. To meet family needs, he produces and markets mineral water, commonly called Pure Water, for eight years out of his home. On the side, he is an accountant's assistant in a local organization. He gets his supplies from a market in Benin. With the goal of bolstering his business, Flavien joined with the other member of his group to request an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
From the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Angel is 48, married, and has two children. He has been carrying passengers and baggage to   their destination for many years in order to earn a living. 

Angel's previous loans, since repaid, were used for his vehicle, resulting in a better income. He has now requested a new loan of 20,000 PHP to pay for vehicle tires and the renewal of his motor registration and licenses. 

While saving a portion of his income for any future family emergencies, Angel plans to buy a new motorcycle to add to his business.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle tires and the renewal of his motor registration and licenses

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 33 years old, married and has four children.

Jovelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Jovelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell. Jovelyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Jovelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 55 years old , married and has seven children.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been food vending for 14 years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugarcane.

Mary Grace requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. Mary Grace has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Mary Grace aspires to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Aumau

texts.en:
Aumau is a 42-year-old woman who is married, with three children. 

She has a small business, providing a tailoring service to the community. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Aumau needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, materials, thread, and oil. She will use her profits to support her children's education. 

Aumau joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, thread, and oil.

loans.name: Ma. Violeta

texts.en:
Ma. Violeta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Ma. Violeta has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from e-loading (prepaid mobile phone loads).

She is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

Ma. Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has an oyster culture business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Marlyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy raw materials for her oyster culture business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money, to expand her business, and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
Chy is 44 years old, married, and a mother of two children. Together, they live in Santuk district of Kampong Thom province. 

To earn a living, Chy began a hog-raising business in the backyard of her own home. When the pigs are full grown she sells them to local traders and butchers in the province, approximately earning a net income of KHR 8,000 per day. Aside from raising hogs, she decided to be involved in other agribusinesses that would help her to improve her income.

The house Chy lives in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some renovation. She has saved some money to start this construction and plans to increase her yields and income to add to her savings. 

Due to inadequate capital, she has requested a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy wood and planks for home improvement. By doing so, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place, without worrying about the rainy season. 

Chy thanks lenders for this constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy wood and planks for home improvement.

loans.name: Alefa

texts.en: Alefa is a 35-year-old woman who is married with 2 children. She runs a business selling tinned food, frozen food, soap, snacks, and others in her community. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Alefa has requested a loan to buy more inventory for her business. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, bags of sugar, bags of rice and a new freezer .

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 57 years old and widowed, with eight children. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for two years and she sells a variety of items, such as curls, biscuits, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A USD 1,000 loan is offered to Domingas to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2007 with her own work. 

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, like noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, and salt. She is generating a good income from selling.

Domingas has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Faaluluga

texts.en:
Faaluluga, a 29-year-old married mother of four, has been operating a small business selling fish in her community for two years. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital and is now requesting a loan to buy a canoe, fishing net, torch, swimming shoes, etc.

Faaluluga will use her profits for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a canoe, fishing net, torch, swimming shoes, etc

loans.name: Marydel

texts.en:
Marydel is a 54-year-old widow with a child, living in Maningcol, Ozamis City. 

In order to support her family, she entered into a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing business and she usually earns PHP 10,000 per month from this business. Her previous loan that was used for the business was successfully repaid. 

With the help of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), Marydel is able to buy more RTW products to sell. Recently, she borrowed another loan of PHP 60,000 to add to her capital, to be able to buy more bundles of RTW products to sell. She is always hopeful of earning more money from the investments she provides for the business. 

Marydel's future plan is to expand her business for better living conditions for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of RTW products to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es: Emamnuel, tiene la edad  de 27 años, está soltero,  vive con sus padres y su hermanos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra de frijol y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 27-year old single man. He lives with his parents and siblings, who are his biggest priority. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers and other products for his bean plantation, so that it has a good germination and quality. He also wants to pay labor and assistance once the plantation has had some progress, so that he can make sure he is doing a good job. 

He would like to make the most of the good weather and land conditions and put in practice his experience of years with basic grains. He would also like to buy products of the best quality so that his plantation can grow healthy and to have a considerable production in the short term. The income that he expects to generate will go to cover the well being of his family as well as tuition expenses, to meet some family goals, and to invest in more plantations. 

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans in the past with state banks, but FUDECOSUR provided him with better conditions and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to cultivate beans.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som’s priority in life is to uplift her family’s living conditions and provide her children opportunities for education. She is 57 years old and a widowed woman who lives in a peaceful village, where she has been involved in agribusinesses to generate a stable income for her family. She grows rice, vegetables, and cassavas and she also owns a grocery store for additional income.

She wants to improve her cassava plantation, which is why she is asking for additional capital to prepare her plantation and to buy cassava plants to grow. This loan will help her grow her cassavas and be able to maintain good growth of her cassava plantation. 

In the future, Som hopes to improve her family-owned businesses and generate a consistent income to satisfy the living needs of her family. She thanks lenders for this constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to prepare her plantation and to buy cassava plants to grow.

loans.name: Leam

texts.en:
As a responsible mother, Leam works hard on her family-owned agricultural land, growing rice and vegetables to sell for income. She is 36 years old and has four school-aged children. Her husband helps her manage their rice farming business in Kampong Thom province. Sometimes the family experiences financial difficulties, due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, but with their parents' help, they are able to supplement their needs. 

Leam aims to improve her rice farming business and make it a viable source of income. She has requested a loan of KHR 500,000 to buy chemical fertilizer for her rice crop. She believes that the loan will help her to maintain good growth of her rice crop, if she works hard and strives harder. 

In the future, Leam hopes to make her business grow and become profitable. She thanks lenders for this constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Panchita

texts.en:
This is Panchita. She previously accessed a PHP 30,000 loan that she used to buy additional stocks of phone accessories needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Panchita would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 8,000, to buy additional stocks of phone accessories needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Panchita dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her family is always in good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. This is where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of phone accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 that she will use as additional capital for the maintenance of her livestock raising business. Having the loan on hand will enable her to buy three additional pigs and enough sacks of hog feed for three to four months until the pigs are ready to sell. She has been doing this business for two years and generating approximately a net income of PHP 2,500 per pig. Earned income from her business was utilized in supporting her children's education. 

Brigida's husband works as a farmer. They have six children, two are already married, two are out of school and two remain studying. Her family lives happily in their simple village of Bantug Petiines. She is already 54 years old doing her best to keep generating income for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy three additional pigs and enough sacks of hog feed for three to four months until the pigs are ready to sell.

loans.name: Sieni

texts.en:
Sieni is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a small business selling snacks, coffee, and finger foods in her community. She has been doing this for three years.

Sieni is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, flour, chicken, and onion, as well as a pot and gas oven. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Sieni will help her family meet their everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, flour, chicken, and onion, as well as a pot and gas oven

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
This is Eddie, 46, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is a widow and he has children. He, together with his children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Eddie operates a vegetable growing farm. He grows vegetables and other fruits in their farm located in Cavite. It is in the high lands where it is suited to grow vegetables and other fruits. He sells his product to market and fruit stores that he regularly supplies and to the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help him continue operating his business, Eddie is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of his farm.
 
Eddie hopes to have more customers and dreams that his family will always be in good health. He meets up with co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for his business.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 35 years of age, a store owner and a farmer, too. Managing his businesses makes him a determined individual in providing for the basic needs of his family and dreaming of someday giving them a better lives. Thus, he always wants to further improve his farming and general store businesses, to continue reaching out for his dream of progress. 

For this reason, Ronald is asking for a loan, amounting to PHP 30,000, for the expansion of his store and to purchase more groceries to sell, like cold drinks, canned goods, and many more items. He knows that, with his strong determination and sufficient business funds, he will mark a great change (improvement) in his businesses.

loans.use: to expand his store and to purchase more groceries to sell, like cold drinks, canned goods, and many more items.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is 47 years old and married with 3 children. She has a vegetable garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, eggplant and pumpkins that she can sell in her community or at the market. To earn extra income, she also has a plantation and grows taro, bananas and yams. She has been doing this for many years. 

Lesina needs a loan to buy a second-hand vehicle to deliver her agricultural goods to the market and to buy barbed wire. She has been a member of SPBD since 2004. Lesina will use the profits from her sales to help upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a second hand vehicle and barbed wire.

loans.name: Asolelei

texts.en: Asolelei is 30 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling pancakes, rice and curry in her community and has been doing this for three years. Asolelei has requested a loan to buy sugar, flour, chicken, mutton flaps, curry powder, dripping oil and foam plates. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Asolelei will help her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, chicken, mutton flaps, curry powder, dripping oil and foam plates

loans.name: Faapo

texts.en: Faapo is a 38-year-old woman who is married with four children. She runs a business selling foods, goods, and products in her community. She has five years of experience with this business. Faapo has requested a loan to buy sugar, rice, flour, corn beef, noodles, chicken, cigarettes, mutton flaps, tin fish, snacks and crates of vailima beer. She plans to use her profits to provide financial support to her family and kids. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, corn beef, noodles, chicken, cigarettes, mutton flaps, tin fish, snacks and crates of vailima beer

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en:
Ulata is a 57-year-old woman who is married, with seven children. She has a taxi business. 

Ulata needs a loan to buy tires, a new battery, a taxi registration, seat covers, and vehicle paint. She will use her profit to support her family and children. 

Ulata joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy tires, a new battery, a taxi registration, seat covers, and vehicle paint.

loans.name: Khek

texts.en:
Khek is 58 years old and a single mother of two grown-up children. She is a noble farmer dedicated to raising pigs, which she buys and sells at commercial markets of the Kampong Thom province. Aside from raising hogs, she decided to do other things that would help her to improve her income like growing rice and selling dessert. Involved in three businesses at the same time, she seems to have a busy life to provide a better quality of life for her children, who also serve as her motivation in the family-owned businesses.

Khek wants to acquire a loan in the sum of 1,000 US dollars to buy a motorcycle for her son to commute to his workplace. Also she will use the remaining balance of the loan to buy a laptop for another child who is attending a university for a bachelor degree. This is her second loan cycle with HKL. She has made a good credit history with the repayment of her prior loan to HKL. She thanks lenders for their constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son to commute to his workplace.

loans.name: Helyn

texts.en:
Helyn, 32, is living in Sta. Ana with her husband and four children. She sells basic commodities in her home-based store such as canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and many more. Most of her customers prefer to buy in her store because the products she sells are a bit lower in price. She wakes up early every day to open for business operation and closes at around 8:00 in the evening. 

Helyn is requesting additional business capital of PHP 10,000 for the business to buy stocks of merchandise such as sugar, vinegar, rice, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and more. Helyn works hard every day to raise her children well and provide for their immediate needs. She is very determined and wants to give her family a better quality of life with the help of the business she maintains.

loans.use: to buy stocks of merchandise such as sugar, vinegar, rice, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and more.

loans.name: Trong

texts.en:
Trong was born in 1981. He lives in Dong Anh, Hanoi, Vietnam. He learns business administration at Tra Vinh University (http://www.tvu.edu.vn/). His course lasts four years and he will graduate in 2014. 

Trong’s family has seven members. His parents are retired. They have three sons. He is his parents’ youngest son and also the first person in his family to graduate from high school and have a higher education. His family’s income is about VND 15,000,000. The woman who sits next to him in this picture is his mother, who is also a member of SEDA’s credit program. 

Trong has a passion for his major because he wants to be a good manager. Trong plans to work in the capital of Hanoi or the province of Bac Ninh within the next five to ten years. He understands that continual learning gives him knowledge and opportunities to get a high-paying job. 

Trong wants to borrow VND 10,710,000 to pay for his education fees. Besides lacking studying tools, he has other difficulties, such as his living fees and transportation fees. 

Through this program, he wants to tell people that he appreciates the help of people, all around the world, who have contributed to this kind of program. This program supports a lot of his education in particular and that of the Vietnamese’s youth generation, in general.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees.

loans.name: Puth

texts.en:
Puth, 41, lives with her two children in Ponhea Lueu District of Kandal Province. After she got divorced, she rented a booth at a local market and started a business as a vendor selling Khmer noodles in fish curry sauce. With the income she generates, she is able to cover the cost of food, bills, and other expenses.

The house that she lives in has deteriorated over the years and needs renovation. Due to inadequate capital, she has requested a loan of 1,000 US dollars to buy materials needed for home improvement and pay for labor costs. The loan will allow her family to live in a comfortable and warm place without worrying about the effects of bad weather. 

She thanks the lenders for their constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for home improvement and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Haydee Teresa

texts.es: Haydee continua con el comercio de artesanías, principalmente con productos de plata como joyería y adornos. Ella está solicitando el préstamo para comprar joyas imcrementar el negocio. Haydee está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite crecer en su actividad. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Haydee continues to work with handicrafts, mainly producing silver products such as jewellery and decorations.  She is applying for a loan to buy jewellery to increase business.  Haydee is very grateful for this help from Kiva and for helping her to strengthen her business.  This loan will help her to increase her work.  Haydee is part of the "El Templo del Inca" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy jewellery and increase business.

loans.name: Rene Salvador

texts.es:
El señor rene salvador  vive en la cuidad de Managua  trabaja en un una institución del estado 
Casado viví en su casa de habitación con su esposa y sus hijos.
Don rene le pide a kiva le otorguen un crédito para gastos médico y compra de medicamento  que tiene que cubrir  ya que presenta problemas de salud en estos momentos.
Ala vez agradece el apoyo que le puedan dar en estos momento para cubrir estos gasto para mejorar su salud
texts.en:
Rene Salvador lives in the city of Managua and works for a state organisation.

He is married and lives with his wife and children.

Rene is applying for a Kiva loan to cover medical costs and buy medication that he needs.  He is currently having health problems.

Rene is grateful for this support to help cover costs to improve his health.

loans.use: to pay medical costs.

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Juana de la cruz vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como secretaria de una empresa estatal,  madre soltera con tres pequeños hijos en edad escolar por sus pequeños hijos es que ella hace  un mayor esfuerzo para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Doña Juana está solicitando un crédito a kiva para  compra de materiales de construcción como bloque, arena, cemento, hierro para construir una tapia  alrededor de su terreno esto para darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda .
texts.en:
Juana de la Cruz lives in the city of Managua and works as a secretary for a state company.  She is a single mother and has three young children who are in school.  Juana puts in a lot of effort so as to help her children get ahead.

Juana is applying for a Kiva loan in order to buy building materials such as blocks, sand, cement, and iron, in order to build a wall around her land.  This will make her home more secure.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia, 59, is responsible for generating income for her family. She patiently makes delicious longanisa to sell and usually earns PHP 500 a day. Income goes toward their daily household expenditures. According to her, she will do everything to uplift her family, out of poverty.

To make her dreams possible, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, allowing her to purchase pork, a main ingredient in making longanisa, and other flavorings. She hopes to obtain this loan in order to improve the quality of frozen food she makes, which leads her to obtaining better income.

loans.use: to purchase pork, a main ingredient in making longanisa, and other flavorings.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: Venus works hard to earn a living. She is 27 years old and full of hope. Venus operates a clothing business. With her determination to improve her way of life, she plans to buy a variety of clothes to satisfy customer demand and increase her income. Because of her insufficient capital, Venus requested a loan of PHP15,000 to buy pants, blouses, shorts, shirts and other dress items for her clothing business. She hopes that her loan requests will be approved so that she can keep her clothing business productive as a stable source of her income.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shorts, shirts and other dress items to sell

loans.name: María Gerardina

texts.es: María Gerardina, tiene la edad  de 46 años, está casada,  vive con su esposa  y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, semilla de frijol con buenas características para de adopción a las condiciones de clima y suelo de la zona y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo y así poder tener una buena cosecha. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: María Gerardina is 46 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and her children, who are her biggest priority.  María plans to use this loan to buy fertilisers and seeds for growing beans.  She will buy seeds that can adapt to the climate and to the local earth. María will also buy other products for her crops, so that they grow well.  Finally, María will use the loan to pay for labourers to apply all these products and to help with planting.  With all this María knows she will have done a good job and will therefore have a good harvest.  María wants to take advantage of the local climate and earth, which will be good for these crops.  She wants to put her many years of experience growing beans into practice.  María will buy the best products of the highest quality for her crops to develop healthy and well and to give a good harvest.  In the short term María would like to have a big yield of crops.  With the income that María hopes to earn from her harvest, she well pay to look after her family's well-being and their education, and will achieve some family goals.  She will also continue to invest in her crops.  This is María's first loan from "FUDECOSUR".  She has had no previous loans with state banks and "FUDECOSUR" is providing this loan under better conditions and with a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow beans.

loans.name: Janeth Tamara

texts.es:
Janeth de 26 años de edad,  es una persona que solo estudio hasta educación media, esta madre soltera, su esposo la dejo con una niña de 6 años.
 
 se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su  hija que va a la escuela y quien depende de las actividades que realiza ella.  se dedica al comercio de ropa,  oficio que aprendió de su madre ,para comercializarla  lo hace en el  lugar donde residen y en los municipios y cantones aledaños

El préstamo  que esta solicitando, es para comprar mas ropa,  para surtir el negocio; debido a que lo que invierte no es suficiente y de los ingresos que genere podrá darle el sustento a su familia

ella planea en un futuro,  comprar un terreno y hacer su casa, ya que actualmente alquila lo que le genera bastante gasto.
texts.en:
Janeth is 26 years old and only completed up to middle school.  She is a single mother after her husband left her with a six-year-old daughter.

Janeth gets up at 4.30am with her daughter, who depends on Janeth's work.  Janeth makes a living selling clothes, a trade that she learned from her mother.  Janeth sells her clothes where she lives and in the surrounding towns and cantons.

Janeth is applying for this loan in order to buy more clothes and to stock up her business as what Janeth had already invested was not enough.  Janeth's earnings will be enough to support her family.

In the future Janeth plans to buy a plot of land and build a house.  She is currently renting but this is a big expense.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Keu

texts.en:
Keu, age 63, is married and has seven grown-up children. She is involved in selling breakfast, like rice with pork, and rice porridge, from her home, located in Reussey Keo district, a suburb area of Phnom Penh. To help generate additional income to provide for the family, Keu’s husband raises poultry from their home and he sells the chickens to local traders when they are fully-grown.

Keu wants to improve her living conditions by having a loan in the amount of USD 700 (US dollars) to help her son-in-law, who is currently living with her, to start a business, making concrete ladders (used to form concrete blocks) to sell. This loan will enable him to buy enough materials, such as cement, sand, and construction steel.
