Keu hopes that, with the loan support and enough skill in this type of business, her son-in-law's business will gradually grow in the future, as the production demand in the market is rising. 

She thanks lenders for this constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to help her son-in-law to start a business, making concrete ladders (used to form concrete blocks) to sell.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1994. She lives in Bac Ninh province, Vietnam. Her major is Business English at Hanoi University of Business and Technology (http://hubt.edu.vn/vietnam/). Her course lasts three years and she will graduate in 2016. Ha’s family has five members and she is her parents’ oldest daughter. She is the first person in her family to graduate from high school and continue to higher education. Her mother is a tailor to earn a living. Her father is a commune officer. Her family’s income is about 7,000,000 VND (Viet Nam Dong) per month. 

Ha wants to have a stable job so that she can help her parents raise her younger siblings. That’s why she will try her best to complete this university course. She wants to borrow 18,300,000 VND to pay for her educational fees. Besides lacking educational fees, she has other difficulties, such as lack of money to buy a computer to support her studying. The man who is sitting next to her in this picture is her father. After graduating, she hopes she can find a high-paid job to provide for her family and improve her family’s living standard. 

Because of this, she wants to tell people that she appreciates the help of people all around the world who have contributed to this kind of program. This has supported the education of Ha individually and of the Vietnamese youth in general.

loans.use: to pay her educational fees.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She has owned and managed a store for eight years. She sells different home-use products in her local community. Virginia is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more variety of products, such as pails, containers, jugs, and other plasticware, to increase her income. She patiently continues her business, though it is a bit tiring, for the welfare of her children and the fulfillment of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy products like pails, containers, jugs and other plasticware

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 28 years old and married with three children.  With three children in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rowena has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Luaiva

texts.en: Luaiva is 25 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. Luaiva has requested a loan to buy flour, baking powder, sugar, oil and a frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Luaiva will expand her business to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking powder, sugar, oil and a frying pan.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak, age 48, is a hardworking mother of a single daughter. Since she is a widowed woman, she has been involved in growing vegetables and raising piglets in Kampong Thom province of Cambodia. She has been in these businesses for about three years. She earns a net profit of 12,000 KHR per day on average. To help her earn income, Prak’s daughter sells cosmetic products and provides hairdressing services to her customers.

With the loan she has requested from Kiva lenders, Prak plans to buy cosmetic products and other personal products for her daughter’s store. She hopes that, through the loan help, her daughter’s business will be sustainable and become a viable source of income in the future. She thanks lenders for their support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and other personal products for her daughter’s store.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en: Carlos is  fifty years old, living in the rural area of Buenavista with his family. He is in the farming business (seasonal agriculture). He has been in this business for the last thirteen years. He grows rice and corn that he harvests twice a year. He hopes to use the loan advanced to him to buy seeds and fertilizer for farm maintenance and to prepare farmlands for propagation. In the future, he hopes to continue to make improvements on the farm and somehow open up a small retail shop for his wife to manage to generate daily income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for farm maintenance and to prepare farmlands for propagation.

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en: Tumema is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community. She has been doing this for 2 years. Tumema has requested a loan to buy a new fishing net, a canoe, goggles and spears. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. Tumema will use her profit to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net, a canoe, goggles, spears, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 60 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school. 

Daisy is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Daisy has been farming bananas for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 41-year-old married woman, and a mother of three children. She has been running a business of selling clothing for the last two years. She purchases a variety of clothing from the main city, and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothing in her community. 

Shahmim has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothing for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She is currently in her third loan cycle, showing a good repayment history. 

Shamim hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and wants to grow her business. 

She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Raeesa

texts.en:
Raeesa is a 42-year-old hard-working married woman and a mother of five. She began a box making business in her house 7 years ago.  She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. 

Raessa is experienced in making different types of boxes. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the increasing demands of her customers. Raeesa has now requested to borrow PKR 35,000 to buy raw materials, including hardboard and cardboard paper of different colors, in bulk quantity to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is currently in her 7th loan cycle and has shown a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including hardboard and cardboard paper of different colors, in bulk quantity.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. Aida is married and has a butcher shop business in the Philippines.

Aida requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional meat like pork, beef and chicken to sell. Aida has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Aida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional meat like pork, beef and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish like tulingan, lapu-lapu, tilapia, etc. to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish like tulingan, lapu-lapu, tilapia, etc. to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 42 years old and married with four children.

Geraldine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to in order purchase more groceries to sell. Geraldine has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling used clothes.

Geraldine aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en: Mehnaz is 22 years old and the mother of one child. She has been running a business selling milk for many years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family. Her husband was the only breadwinner at that point in time. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. Mehnaz sells their milk in her local community. This all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. Mehnaz has applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is 26 years old. He lives with his wife and children. He has been working hard in the agricultural business sector for the last four years. This experience has given him the ability and knowledge to cope with unpredictable weather conditions. His principal plants are corn and rice. He sells his crops to bulk grain traders near his place of residence. The earnings he receives from his sales help with his family's expenses.

Joey is requesting a loan to enable him to buy farming supplies, such as animal manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc., that will help him with his planting so he can have better profits and continue helping with the household expenses without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as animal manure, seeds, fertilizer, etc., that will help him with his planting.

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru: Трудолюбивая и добродушная женщина работает упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера с целью того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и прокормить семью. Ее зовут Махфират. Она родилась в 1968 года. Она замужем и воспитывает прекрасных детей. Махфират более 8 лет работает в должности бригадира в государственном учреждении. Она должна соблюдать за чистоту улиц города. Махфират качественно выполняет свою работу и имеет хорошую репутацию среди своих коллег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 700 долларов США для ремонта дома. Ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Она должна купить краски, обои и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hardworking and kind woman works persistently from an early morning to a late evening with a goal to earn money and feed her family.  Her name is Mahfirat.  She was born in 1968.  She is married and raising beautiful children.  Mahfirat has been working as a supervisor in a government organization for over 8 years.  She has to watch over the cleanliness of the city streets.  Mahfirat does quality work and has a good reputation among her colleagues.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 700 US dollars to repair her house.  Her house is in a bad condition.  She has to purchase paint, wallpaper, etc.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy paint and wallpaper to repair her house

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is a married man with four school going children. He lives in his own house that has no electricity but has piped water.

Clement has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves and wheat flour for resale. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, tea leaves and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en: Angeles is 57 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 23,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as sugar, soap, soy sauce, eggs, shampoo and groceries. Angeles has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF prior to this one. She has been running her general store for four years and earns additional income by buying and selling fish. Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Serafín

texts.es: Serafín se ha dedicado a la producción de café desde que era un adolescente, primero comenzó al lado de su padre quien le enseñó todo lo necesario para llevar a cabo esta actividad y cuando se casó se independizó y comenzó a producir su propio café. Él es socio de la "Unión Regional" y es allí a donde entrega toda su producción. Para esta cosecha necesita un crédito que utilizará para comprar fertilizantes pues hace poco resembró parte de su finca.
texts.en: Serafín has worked as a coffee producer since he was a teenager. He started working alongside his father who taught him everything he needed to know, so when he got married and became independent he started to produce his own coffee. He is a member of Union Regional, which is where all his produce is delivered to. As he recently re-sewed part of his land, he needs a loan to buy fertilisers for this season's crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers.

loans.name: Jose Eli

texts.es: José, tiene 35 años de edad, está casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Protección, Santa Bárbara. Hace 15 años que se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz y frijol. El producto que saca lo vende en el mercado local donde obtiene los ingresos para su familia. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la finca de café, maíz y frijol, con el propósito de mejorar la producción y poder tener mejor condicion de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
José, age 35, is married and has three children.  He lives in the Protección municipality in Santa Bárbara.  He has been growing coffee, corn, and beans for 15 years.  He sells the product that he gets at the local market, where he gets income for his family.

The loan that he has requested is for 5,000 lempiras.  He will use it to buy supplies and fertilizers for his coffee, corn, and bean farm.  He will do this in order to improve the production and to be able to have better living conditions with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for maintenance of his coffee farm.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
José Alberto vive en  la cuidad de Managua  trabaja desde hace 5 años como guarda de seguridad en una universidad de Managua.
José le  solicita un crédito a kiva y ceprodel para invertirlo en la compra de materiales  de construcción  como cemento, arena para hacerle el repello en la parte interior de su vivienda ya que con las lluvias  se le humedecen las paredes  y esto le está perjudica a su  familia  por que la humedad en las paredes le  atrae enfermedades.
texts.en: José Alberto lives in the city of Managua. He has worked as a security guard at the University of Managua for the past 5 years. Jose Alberto is requesting this loan from Kiva and CEPRODEL to invest in the purchase of construction materials like cement and sand. He wants to plaster the walls in the interior part of his home. The walls have gotten moisture in them from the rains and this harms his family as the humidity in the walls can cause sicknesses.

loans.use: to buy construction material.

loans.name: Dania Marieta

texts.es: Dania  continúa con su actividad como contadora y en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para la implementación de su estudio cantable y comprará algunos útiles de escritorio como papeles,cuadernos, lapiceros, folderes para organizar mejor su oficina. Dania está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los inversionistas, por ayudarla a mejorar  su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Dania is continuing with her accounting business. On this occasion, Dania is applying for a loan to operate her accounting firm. She will buy some office supplies such as paper, notebooks, pens, and folders in order to better organize her office. 

Dania is very grateful for Kiva's help and for assisting her to improve her business, which allows her to provide her family with a better quality of life. She belongs to the "El Templo del Inca" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy some office supplies such as paper, notebooks, pens, and folders.

loans.name: Lioneren

texts.en: Lioneren is 45 years old, married and has one child who is in school. She works in agriculture, raising pigs in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising livestock for five years, and has borrowed and repaid four prior loans from NWTF. In the future, Lioneren would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Aguilar  vive en Managua casado con tres pequeños de los cuales están en edad escolar.
Trabaja para una empresa del estado en el área de fontanería.
José está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la construcción del área de su cocina ya que esta no presenta las condiciones necesarias.
Ala vez manifiesta su agradecimiento por esta oportunidad que le está dando kiva para mejorar su casa.
texts.en: José Aguilar lives in Managua. He is married and has three school aged children. He works in the plumbing section of a state enterprise. José is requesting a loan to invest it in the kitchen of his house which needs improvement. He is grateful for this opportunity offered him by Kiva to improve his house.

loans.use: to buy construction material.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha continua dedicándose con la atención de su restaurante, actividad que viene realizando hace algunos años y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su hijo.

Martha está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como carnes, verduras, menestras, arroz etc. para la producción de su restaurante. Martha está muy agradecida con la ayuda de los inversionistas, para fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor educación a su hijo. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Martha continues working at her restaurant.  She has done this job for several years and it allows her to get her son ahead.

She's requesting the loan to buy ingredients such as meats, vegetables, soups, rice, etc. to make meals in her restaurant.

Martha's very grateful for the lenders' help to strengthen her job, which allows her to give her son a better education.  She belongs to El Templo del Inca Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Baby Jean

texts.en: Baby Jean is 35 years old and has four children, all of whom attend school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She also earns additional income by buying and selling charcoal. She has been farming for the last 10 years, and has borrowed and repaid four prior loans from NWTF. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sarwari

texts.en: Sarwari is a 45-year-old energetic married woman who has successfully built her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation and Kiva.  She has become famous for manufacturing ‘waan,’ which is a thread-like material used to make charpoy (a bedstead common in Pakistan and made of woven webbing or hemp stretched across a wooden frame on four legs). She makes a good amount of income, which helps her family.  Sarwari is the mother of seven children, only three of them are in school due to their financial condition. She would like to improve her business so she has applied for a loan for Rs. 45,000 to buy another machine to make waan with fresh quality thread.  She is currently in her fourth loan cycle and is a very responsible borrower.  Sarwari hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in business.

loans.use: to buy another machine for making thread.

loans.name: Giraldo Eduardo

texts.es:
Giraldo continua con brindar servicio de odontología. Giraldo está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material odontológico como pastas y amalgamas, así como medicamentos de uso odontológico para su consultorio.
Giraldo está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica la cual le da los ingresos para mejorar en su atención y profesión, y porque esta ayuda le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Giraldo continues to work as a dentist. Giraldo is requesting this loan to buy dentistry materials like paste and amalgam as well as medicine for use in his dental practice. Giraldo is very grateful to Kiva for the financial assistance which give him the revenues to improve his care and dental practice. This helps him to offer better service to his patients. He belongs to the “El Templo del Inca” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy pastes and amalgams for medical use in his dental practice.

loans.name: Tepora

texts.en:
Tepora is a 47-year-old widow, with five children. She has a small business, providing a tailoring service to the community. She has many years with this business. 

Tepora needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, materials, thread, needles, scissors, and oil. She will use her profits to support her children's education. 

Tepora joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, thread, needles, scissors, and oil.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married mother of two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and she has two children who are in school.

Zenaida has a food market business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more vegetables, fruits, and spices to sell in her food stall.

Zenaida has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, fruits, and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is 24 years old, single and works hard to help her parents. She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles and spices. She has been in this line of work for two years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina se ha dedicado a la producción de café desdes que se casó pues su esposo es cafetalero. Por lo general ella se encarga de la administración del negocio y su esposo es quien realiza la mayoría de las actividades en el campo, aunque en época de cosecha ella lo ayuda a cortar café. Para esta cosecha necesita un crédito el cual utilizará para comprar fertilizantes, limpiar su finca y pagar a trabajadores que contrataran, pues es demasiado el trabajo que hay que realizar y ellos dos solos no podrían llevarlo a cabo.
texts.en: Rufina has worked growing coffee since she got married. Her husband is a coffee planter. In general she takes care of the administration of the business and her husband takes care of most of the field activity. During the harvest season she helps pick coffee. For this season Rufina needs a loan to buy fertilizer, clean the plantation and pay the workers they contract. There is a lot of work to be done and just the two of them cannot do it all.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, clean her crops and pay for labor to harvest the coffee.

loans.name: Porfirio Ivan

texts.es: Porfirio, tiene 36 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Protección, Santa Bárbara. Hace 18 años que se dedica a la agricultura de café, maíz y frijol. La agricultura ha sido siempre su fuente de ingresos. El préstamo que solicita es por 8,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la finca de café, y cultivo de maíz y frijol. esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar los cultivos y la cosecha. El objetivo es mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en: Porfirio, 36, is married with two children and lives in the municipality of Protección, Santa Bárbara.  He’s been growing coffee, corn and beans for 18 years.  Agriculture has always been his source of income.  He’s asking for an 8,000 Lempira loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for the coffee, corn and beans.  This investment will help to improve  the crops and harvests.  His goal is to improve living conditions at home.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Juan Roberto

texts.es: Juan Roberto es un productor de café orgánico y es socio de la "Unión Regional", asociación en donde entrega todo su producción año con año para que sea procesada y exportada, por lo que todo el café que produce es de la más alta calidad. Para este año solicita un crédito el cual utilizará para comprar fertilizantes y para pagar a cortadores de café que contratará. Además de producir café Jaun Roberto cuenta con un pequeño negocio de abarrotes el cual le ayuda a tener ingresos extras para él y su familia.
texts.en: Juan Roberto grows organic coffee and is a member of the “Unión Regional” [coffee cooperative], an association he delivers his entire production to year to year to be processed and exported because his coffee is of the highest quality.  For this year, he needs a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay laborers to pick coffee.  In addition to growing coffee, Juan Roberto also has a small grocery business that helps him earn extra income for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es: Oscar, tiene 44 años de edad, es soltero,  tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Villanueva, cortes junto con su hija. Oscar trabajó en una tienda en el área de ventas. Lleva 13 años de tener su propio negocio de taller de confeccion de mochilas de todo tipo y carteras, las que vende en el mercado local y a sus alrededores. Ha mantenido el negocio mediante la inversión de prestamos actualmente solicita el tercer ciclo que es por 15,000 Lempiras, el cual va invertir en la compra de telas, zippers e hilos para la confección de mochilas y carteras. El tiene como meta terminar de darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Oscar, 44, is single but has two children.  He lives with his daughter in the municipality of Villanueva, Cortes.  Oscar worked as a salesman in a store and for the last 13 years has had his own business manufacturing all types backpacks and purses that he sells in the local market and surrounding areas.  He’s stayed in business thanks to loans and is currently asking for his third one for 15,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy fabric, zippers and thread to make backpacks and purse.  His goal is to finish providing schooling for his children.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen de 55 años de edad, casada y del domicilio de Chinandega, tiene por actividad económica la venta de golosinas al por mayor, leche, cosméticos, cebollas, papas en grandes cantidades que entrega a otros comerciantes y otros, ella realiza sus compras en uno de los mercados de Managua, y realiza sus ventas a comerciantes de los países vecinos, sus clientes son fijos y eventuales a los cuales les vende al contado y al crédito el que recupera semanalmente, ella inicio este negocio desde hace varios años con fondos propios, maria solicita crédito para la compra de capital de trabajo como: cebollas, papas, detergentes, jabon, golosinas, cosmeticos entre otros, en el que comprara los productos que atraen a la demanda, uno de sus sueños es mejorar su negocio y tener mejores ingresos para lograr una estabilidad económica en su familia, ella está muy contenta y agradecida por la ayuda que los inversionistas Kivas le brindan a personas con escasos recursos para tener un medio digno de trabajo.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 55, is married living in Chinandega.  Her economic activity is selling snacks at wholesale, milk, cosmetics, onions and potatoes in large amounts to other merchants and others.  She buys at one of Managua’s markets and sells to merchants from neighboring countries.  Her customers are regular and drop-in she sells to for cash and on credit collecting weekly.  She started this business several years ago with funds of her own.

María is asking for credit to buy working capital like onions, potatoes, detergent, soap, snacks, cosmetic, etc.  She will buy items in high demand.  One of her dreams is to improve her business and earn higher income to attain economic stability for her family.  She’s very happy and grateful for the support Kiva lenders give people of scarce resources so they can have a way to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene la edad  de 64 años, está casado, vive solo. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos pollos para el engorde. La idea es aprovechar  las buenas condiciones del lugar donde viva para el desarrollo de la actividad además de poder vender los animales una vez gordos a los miembros de la comunidad y así no invertir en transporte y poderlos comercializar más frescos debido a la cercanía de los consumidores.  Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en el negocio.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Francisco, 64, is married; he lives alone.  He intends to use his loan to buy some chicks to fatten up.  The idea is to take advantage of the conditions of the place he lives in to develop this activity and to be able to sell the animals once they are fat to members of the community and save on transportation costs and also to sell them fresher because the consumers are more nearby.  He will be able to develop the activity more with this investment while also being able to save which will make it possible for him to have more animals and invest still more into the business.

This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR offered the best loan terms with a much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: Mirta Lilliam

texts.es: Mirta Lilliam, tiene la edad  de 60 años, está casada, vive sola. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras,  esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida  y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas personales.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mirta Lilliam, 60, is married living alone.  She intends to use her loan to buy fertilizer, fungicide and to pay labor costs for coffee crop chores and also to buy some seedlings for replanting.  The goal is to increase her acreage under cultivation and take advantage of the soil’s fertility and weather and other conditions that favor coffee growing.  She expects these improvements will result in higher profits to improve her living conditions and also be invest a bit more into her crops as well as to reach some personal goals.

This is her first FUDECOSUR loan.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR offered the best loan terms with a much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Juán Bautista

texts.es: Juán Bautista, tiene la edad  de 51 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras, esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área y a la vez poco a poco ir renovando la plantación, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista, 51, is married living with his children and wife who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer, fungicide and to pay labor costs to provide coffee crop maintenance as well as to buy some seedlings for replanting.  His goal is to increase the density of his planted area and gradually replace the plants while taking advantage of the fertility of the soil a weather and other conditions that favor coffee growing.  With this improvements to the crop he hopes to earn higher profits to improve his family’s living conditions and invest a bit more into his crops and reach some goals.


This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR offered the best loan terms with a much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Maikol Steven

texts.es: Maikol Steven, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero, vive con sus hermanos y padres  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos  de conservación de suelos  y así evitar la erosión por el agua de lluvia principalmente y trabajos de asistencia para el café para que la cosecha pueda tener un buen desarrollo y un maduración adecuada, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras, esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área y a la vez  ir renovando la plantación, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Maikol Steven, 18, is single living with his siblings and parents who are his greatest priority.   He intends to use his loan to buy fertilizer, fungicide and to pay labor costs to do soil conservation chores to prevent erosion caused mainly by rainfall and also to do coffee crop maintenance so that it will grow well and mature properly.  He  will also buy some seedlings to do some replanting aimed at increasing plant density and gradually renew the plants while taking advantage of the fertility of the soil and weather and other conditions favorable to coffee growing.  He hopes these improvements will help him earn higher profits to improve his family’s quality of life and also to invest a bit more into his crops and reach a few goals.

This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR offered the best loan terms with a much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Blanca Iris

texts.es: Blanca, tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace 5 años que tiene un negocio de una pulpería donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de la canasta básica como ser refrescos, manteca, azúcar, arroz, pan, huevos, jabón, condimentos, pasta de  tomate, golosinas, etc. El prestamo que ha solicitado es el tercer ciclo con ODEF y es por 10,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar más productos alimenticios como ser refrescos, manteca, azúcar, pan, churros, leche y otros, para vender y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias. Su meta es crecer con su negocio de manera que pueda lograr tener una abarrotería.
texts.en: Blanca, 32, is a single mother of two children and lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  She’s had a small grocery business for five years where she sells basic staples like soft-drinks, shortening, sugar, rice, bread, eggs, soap, condiments, tomato paste, sweets, etc.  The loan she’s requested is her third with ODEF and is for 10,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy food items like soft-drinks, shortening, sugar, bread, shacks, milk and others to sell and earn higher profits.  Her goal is for the business to grow until it becomes a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr:
Madame Maguette, âgée de 32 ans, s’active dans le commerce depuis 2 ans maintenant. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainée un garçon, est âgé de 13 ans. Maguette vend des chaussures, de l’encens et des draps de lit. Elle fait de l’ambulant  et travaille de 9h à midi et de 15h au soir. Pour les dépenses de la famille, elle appuie son époux en s’occupant de l’éducation des enfants et en participant à la dépense quotidienne. Maguette a l’habitude de travailler avec ses propres moyens, elle a démarré avec un capital personnel tiré de son épargne. La preuve c’est la première fois qu’elle vient solliciter un crédit à l’IMCEC afin d’honorer des commandes en cette période de préparatifs de fête.
Pour Maguette, s’occuper  de ses enfants est un investissement  à long terme : si elle prend le soin de régler leurs moindres besoins c’est pour qu’un jour, elle voie ses efforts être récompensés un jour.
texts.en:
Maguette is 32 years old and has been in business for 2 years. She is married and the mother of 4 children, the oldest of whom is a 13-year-old boy. Maguette sells shoes, incense, and bed sheets. She sells door to door from 9am to noon, and from 3pm until the evening.

For Maguette's family expenses, she supports her husband by taking care of their children's education and helping out with daily expenses. She is used to working with her own funds; she began her business with personal business capital from her own personal savings. The proof of this is that this is the first time she is requesting a loan from UIMCEC in order to be able to fulfill orders during the current season of festival preparations.

For Maguette, taking care of her children is a long-term investment: by taking care of their basic needs each day, she sees her efforts rewarded in the days to come.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, bed sheets, and incense to resell

loans.name: Chian

texts.en:
Chian is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 from lenders that she will use to purchase the small fish and salt in volume that she will use to make fish paste/sauce. Part of the loan, if there is any left, she intends to use to buy a piglet. She hopes that her loan request will be approved in order to obtain higher income for her family.

She is 27 and is engaged in fish paste/sauce-making as a source of income. She earns about PHP 300-PHP 400 each day doing this business. This is minimal for her two children, which is why she also wants to create a small piggery business for an additional source of earnings.

loans.use: to purchase small fish and salt in volume, which she will use to make fish paste/sauce. Part of the loan, if there is any left, is intended to be used to buy a piglet.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. He has 11 children, and has been doing this work for 4 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'when his cows are well, milk production will be high.' His biggest challenge is 'diseases and pests.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'rose.'

David was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'flexible payment term.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'how to invest in asset financing.'

His highest monthly expenses are family expenses. When asked: 'How will this loan benefit his family', David replied: 'help in take care of the basic needs.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. David owns the following: 'cow, poultry, and bicycle,' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net and running water,' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, or DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 44 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Florencia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Florencia has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Annahstacia

texts.en:
Annahstacia has a retail shop that she has been running for 13 years now. She is 37 years old, single mother of one child, and supports four people. 

This is her first loan term, and she plans to use this loan amount to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, drinking water, margarine, and salt. She anticipates to make more profits, and she will use it to educate her child.

She hopes to grow her business by adding more stocks to her retail shop, and to have a family that is independent.

loans.use: to add stocks of sugar, rice, drinking water, and salt.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Connie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending and tailoring. Connie is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat, such as wood, paints, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Connie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, such as wood, paints, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 39 years old, married and blessed with four children. She has a green grocery business that has been running for four years now. She gets a monthly income of 7,000 Kenya Shillings. 

This is her first loan term and she will use the loan amount to buy more stock of cabbages, tomatoes and fruits. This will enable her to have enough stock as well as generate more profits which she will use to expand her business and also provide for the needs of her family. 

In the future, Lydia hopes and dreams of having a successful business, providing for her family's needs and having a happy family.

loans.use: To buy  cabbages, tomatoes and fruits

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a general store business in the Philippines for 10 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Having repaid her previous loan, Elsie is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks such as sugar, eggs, oil and other groceries to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, and dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as sugar, eggs, oil and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Sheedan

texts.en:
Sheedan is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small scrap business in her community for the past three years. She buys the various goods like plastic bottles, iron, or steel material from the market, separates them based on their quality, and then sells them to the people of her community and in local markets. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of 11 children; one of her sons is shown in the picture also. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

Sheedan has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of scrap material such as plastic bottles, iron, copper, etc., from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of scrap material such as plastic bottles, iron, copper, etc.

loans.name: Kondoa Group

texts.en:
Hidaya, who is in born late 1960s, is married with two sons and two daughters. Hidaya's children are in school. Since 1983, Hidaya has been running a restaurant business where she sells breakfast and lunch foods. She is doing great in her family and business as well. Hidaya starts working from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
 
This will be her 10th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy new business chairs, tables, and more food cooking supplies. Hidaya is also managed to increase the food services in her restaurant, such as selling meat-soup in the morning.

She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. Hidaya has used her profit to build a house, and managed to put electricity, build other rooms at the back of her house for renting, and buy home fridge, TV, and blender for juice making. Hidaya will use this loan to restock more food cooking supplies. She dreams to own a retail shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Kondoa, which consists of 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more food cooking supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 38 años, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de 20, 14 y 13 años con quienes vive en casa de sus padres. El trabajo de Margarita consiste en el alquiler de taxi. Tiene un vehículo que compró hace muchos años. A diario acude a su casa un conductor quien se encarga de hacer circular su vehículo por las principales calles de la ciudad, por dicho alquiler recibe un monto económico todos los días que le ayuda a cubrir algunas necesidades en su hogar. Ésta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años, el taxi que pone al servicio público pudo comprarlo después de tanto esfuerzo y lucha constante en su anterior trabajo que era la costura y que por razones de salud tuvo que dejar de realizar. Actualmente ha visto la posibilidad de incursionar en el negocio de lavandería ya que considera que es una labor muy rentable debido a que en la zona en la que vive hay personas que tienen trabajos de mucha presión que no les da tiempo para lavar sus prendas por lo que solicitan este servicio y para ello espera comprarse una lavadora en corto tiempo. Por el momento, le agrada alquilar su taxi porque eso le permite dedicar su tiempo libre al cuidado de sus hijos y realizar eventualmente otros trabajos sus ingresos económicos también mejoran, esto le permite mejorar su nivel de vida, ahora se siente tranquila por todo lo que está consiguiendo y espera en un futuro consolidar una empresa formal en ambos trabajos que emprende. Este es el crédito número 06 con Kiva, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000 soles, cambiará un par de llanta de su taxi y algunos repuestos que necesita para su adecuado funcionamiento, asimismo invertirá en la compra de su lavadora para dedicarse también a este negocio.
texts.en: Margarita, 38, is a single mother with three children aged 20, 14, and 13 who all live together with her parents. Margarita's work is renting out a taxicab. She has a vehicle she bought many years ago. Each day, a driver arrives at her house and is responsible for a route through the main streets of the city. She receives a small amount from renting her car everyday that helps to cover some needs in her home. She has carried out this activity for 8 years, since she was able to purchase a taxi in the public service after much effort and a constant struggle in her previous job. Her previous job was sewing which she had to stop performing because of health reasons. Currently, she sees the possibility of entering the laundry business because she believes it is a very profitable job. In the area where she lives, there are people who have high-pressure jobs who do not have time to do their laundry and have requested this service. She is waiting to buy a washing machine in the near future. For the moment, she likes to rent her taxi because it allows her to spend her free time caring for her children and perform other jobs to eventually improve her family's income and improve their standard of living. Now she feels at peace regarding all that she is pursuing and hopes in the future to consolidate a formal company in both jobs that she undertakes. This is her 6th loan with Kiva and she is very happy to know she has financial support that allows her to continue with her work. With the amount requested of 2,000 soles, she will change a few tires in her cab and buy some parts it needs for proper functioning as well as invest in the purchase of a washer to engage in this business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts for her taxi and to purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 52 years old and married with five children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, chips, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Estrella has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and earns an income from buy-and-sell rice.

Estrella aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, chips, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Fede

texts.en:
Fede is 38 years old and married with one child. Fede works very hard to provide for them.

Fede runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks, such as canned goods, hair conditioner, soft-drinks, milk, sugar, etc. to sell in her general store.

Fede has been in this business for 10 years, and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, hair conditioners, soft-drinks, milk, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Fede would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, such as canned goods, hair conditioners, soft-drinks, milk, sugar, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Isack

texts.en:
27-year-old Isack, who is married and blessed with one child, has an auto spare parts shop. He has been running this business for the last 10 years, and gets a monthly income of Kenya Shillings 10,000.

This is his first loan term, and he plans to use the loan to purchase more lubricant oil, car bolts, and wheels. He plans to open another auto spare parts shop with the anticipated profits. 

His dreams are to be a stable businessman and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy lubricant oil, car bolt, and wheels.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is 39 years old and a single mother of 3 children. She runs a hotel (restaurant) business and has been in this business for 4 years now, making a monthly income is 9,000 Kenya shillings. 

This is her 2nd loan term and she intends to use the loan to buy stock of food for use in her hotel (restaurant) business. These include rice, cooking oil, milk, cereals and flour. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children and buy her own plot of land. 

Purity's hopes for the future are to buy her own plot of land and build her own home.

loans.use: to buy stock of food for use in her hotel (restaurant) business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married with two children, and she is 39 years old. She operates a stationary shop, and has been in this business for 9 years. 

This is her 4th loan term, and she intends to use the loan to buy printing and photocopying papers, as well as binding materials. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. 

In future, Juliana hopes to have a stable business so that she can be able to provide her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy printing and photocopying papers, as well as binding materials.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a retail businessman who deals with household goods and farm equipment. These include boxes, clay cookers, frying pans, poultry feeding troughs, among other items. He is 40 years old and married. He has three children, ages between 5 and 20 years old. 

He has been running his retail business for 15 years, and it has been profitable. He plans to use the loan to increase his stock of goods, such as cooking pans, kitchen utensils, as well as water cans. He also plans to use part of the amount to pay school fees for his children. 

Francis will use the anticipated profits to pay his house rent and children's school fees. This is his 3rd loan term, and he paid all his previous loans successfully. 

Francis' dreams and hopes for the future are to provide the best education for his children and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of goods to sell, such as cooking pans, kitchen utensils, and water cans, and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Emelly

texts.en:
Emelly manages a rice retailing business. She has been operating the business for more than two years. She is 27 years old, married, and has five children. Having a big family is quite hard for Emelly, but she is doing her best together with her husband to support their daily needs, especially in preparing for the education of their children. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy sacks of rice to resell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she can have improvement in the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely, 59, has been making fish sauce for almost seven years. She is an expert “bagoong maker” (fish sauce), so she has delicious fish sauce in their town.  She is earning about PHP 300 to PHP 500 as a daily income from doing it, but it is not sufficient due to the larger amount of family household expenditures.

She wants to add to her capital in order to increase her earnings. For this reason, she is asking for the amount of PHP 10,000 from the lenders to buy more fishes and salt, as they are the main ingredients in her manufacturing business. She hopes that her loan request will be approved to create improvement in her profit.

loans.use: to buy more fishes and salt, as main ingredients in her manufacturing business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Vilma has been farming rice for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette has a business selling cereals in Tala town. She also runs a maize mill business and has been in the business for six years. She is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children.

This will be her second loan and she plans to buy more stocks of cereals. These include maize for her maize mill business as well as beans for selling. Annette anticipates making more income which she will use to provide for the needs of her family as well as repay her loan.

In the future, Annette hopes to open another maize mill business.

loans.use: To buy more cereals.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 38 years, married and blessed with two children, ages 8 and 5 years old. She sells clothes at Tala market and the business has been profitable. 

She will be using the loan to buy more clothes for selling. These include skirts, blouses, shirts and t-shirts. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to increase the stock.

Having paid her previous loans successfully, this will be her third loan. She hopes to operate a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert is single and resides in Poblacion, Lopez Jaena. He helps support his family by raising pigs for sale. He joined GDMPC and borrowed 6,000 PHP to purchase more piglets to raise. He helps his family by sometimes working on their farm which is their main source of income. He plans to own a piggery to improve his business and earn an income for his own future.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is 29 years old and married with two children. With both children currently in school, Iris works very hard to provide for them.

Iris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Iris has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, sugar, canned goods, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Iris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 53 year old married woman doing a business of animals purchase and sale for the past 12 years. She has 1 calf and 4 heifers currently. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. She purchases small animals; takes care of them and then sells them in market when they mature. Her husband is a farmer and he also helped her to sell the milk in the same locality. She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. She has three children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food and clothing. Anwar has requested a loan of Rs. 20, 000 to purchase one more calf and feed for the cattle. It’s her 2nd year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with this support. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more calf and feed for the cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hanah

texts.en:
Hanah lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. She has 3 children and has been doing this work for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'poultry keeping.' Her biggest challenge is 'disease.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'mrembo.'

Hanah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'because it finances farmers.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'importance of using the loans in the required projects.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Hanah replied, 'help to educate the children.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Hanah owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine'.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 23 years old, married to David and has one child who is 3 years old.

She has a retail shop in Naivasha which she has operated for the past four years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd  to enable her to buy sugar, flour and cooking fat, among other items. With her anticipated profit, she plans to expand her business.

In the near future, she hopes to see her business grow and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, cooking fat, among other items for her store.

loans.name: Elsielyn

texts.en: Elsielyn, 42 years of age, is married, and they are blessed with four children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost two years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 500 a day. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to receive a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a renown farmer from Olkalou; he is married to Nancy who runs a green grocery and they have two children aged 18 and 15 years old.

Joseph has been into farming activities for the past six years and to enable him to be more productive he has applied for his sixth loan of Kshs. 50,000 from Kadet Ltd to be used in buying fertilizer for his crops and hiring laborers to work on his farm.

His hope and dream for his business is to benefit from Kadet Ltd.

loans.use: to expand his farming activities

loans.name: Waweru

texts.en:
Waweru, 59 years old and married to Elizebeth, has been operating a retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru for four years. Now requesting his second loan from Kadet to enable him buy maize flour, rice, sugar, etc., he plans to purchase more stock for his shop with the resulting new profits.

Waweru hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet in the future to enable him to expand his retail shop into wholesale.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is separated, having two children with her. To make a living, she manages their own coconut farm. Lately, the farm needs fertilizer to have a better, abundant harvest. She joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services. Marina borrowed a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase an organic fertilizer in order to have higher income in return. She plans to cultivate the farm this year to improve her income. In the future, she wants to see her children successful.

loans.use: to purchase an organic fertilizer

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 43 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Genara is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Genara has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOYOPATA DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de carpinteria, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de emoliente.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Moyopata de San Sebastian” communal bank, located in the San Jeronimo district of Cusco province and department.

Hilda, a member, is married, 42 years of age, and has 1 son. She works at her business of raising and selling farm animals, especially guinea pigs and hens. Hilda  raises and fattens them, then sells them at different fairs. By means of this small business she advances her child. Her dream is to have a store where she might sell her guinea pigs and chickens. 

Hilda is requesting a loan to purchase more guinea pigs and hens plus the feed they need. Her picture has been added to the group photo since she was unable to attend the meeting due to work obligations.

The other members are dedicated to businesses such as selling chicha [a traditional home brew], carpentry, a grocery store, and a stand selling emollients. 

Hilda is grateful to all those who by this means, form a part of her dream. She is fully committed to complying with her established schedule of payments.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and hens, plus feed for both.

loans.name: Mirlith

texts.es: Mirlith, de 38 años, es madre soltera, vive en una casa propia a lado de siete personas entre alguno de sus hermanos y sus hijos, trabaja duro todos los días para mejorar su ingresos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Mirlith, consiste en la venta de cosméticos, vende todo tipo de artículos mediante el sistema de venta por catálogo o exhibición, tiene una vitrina en su casa en donde llegan a sus clientes en busca de perfumes, talcos, cremas, desodorantes o algún accesorio de utilidad. Lleva en ésta actividad desde hace 05 años, trabaja sola y gana muy bien. Alterna esta actividad eventualmente con la venta de gaseosas dependiendo de la temporada. Por lo pronto, continúa trabajando en la venta de cosméticos y le gusta lo que hace, asegura sus ganancias con los clientes que ya ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles, comprará principalmente cosméticos como talcos, cremas, perfumes y otros accesorios.
texts.en:
Mirlith, 38, is a single mother. She lives in her own home with 7 people amongst whom are her siblings and children. 

She works hard every day to improve her income and to be able to have a better quality of life. Mirlith's job is selling cosmetics, she sells all kinds of items using a catalogue or display system, she has a window at home where her customers come looking for perfumes, talcs, deodorants or other accessories. 

She has been working in this trade for 5 years, working alone and earning well. She alternates this trade with the sale of fizzy drinks depending on the season. For now, she is continuing to work in cosmetics and she likes what she does, ensuring her earning with customers that she has earned over the passing of time.  

This is her sixth Kiva loan, thanks to whom she has been offered the opportunity to access finance that offers her the security to continue with her work. On the offer hand she is committed to fulfilling her repayments in a punctual manner. With the requested amount of 1500 PEN she will primarily buy  cosmetics like talc, lotions, perfumes and other accessories.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like talcs, lotions, perfumes and other accessories.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marites is 33 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Marites has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Marites has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gerlie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Gerlie has been farming rice for 7 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her rice farming and dried coconut meat business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Angel Salomon

texts.es:
Angel tiene 21 años y para poder salir adelante y solventar sus gastos de manutención trabaja como empleado de seguridad en una pequeña empresa en su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Angel agradece el apoyo que le han brindado los prestamistas kiva ya que podrá comprar una moto para poder movilizarse a su trabajo ya que gasta mucho dinero en pasajes por lo que su trabajo se encuentra muy lejos de su vivienda, de esta manera poder ahorrar y seguir trabajando para seguir sacando adelante a su esposa y sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Angel is 21 years old and in order to get ahead and to cover living expenses such as employment security in a small company in his city, he works around 12 hours a day. He believes that his job is going well because he is responsible.

Angel is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders have offered him because he will be able to buy a motorcycle to be able to get around with his work as he spends too much money in transportation fees; his work is located far from his house. This way he can save and continue working to continue moving his wife and 2 children ahead.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 59 years old, from Nyahururu. She is married to Charles who is a businessman and, together, they are blessed with two children who are now adults, 25 and 23 years old.

Cecilia owns a general store where she sells cereals, like beans, maize, greengrams, wheat, and other items, like cooking fat, sugar, flour, and rice. To be able to add more stocks of these items, Cecilia has applied for a loan of KES 60,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), which is her third one.

From her general store, she makes a monthly income of KES 30,000 and she hopes to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to start another business, by buying a dairy cow.

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to be financially stable and to be able to buy a pickup truck for transporting her cereals to other markets.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cereals, cooking fat, sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is a hard-working man who lives in a rural area with his family. He is a father and a good husband to his smart wife. He is the main breadwinner to his family. He has been busy with farming for more than five years now. He grows rice and corn. 

Joselito wants to develop his farming and to maximize his profit. For this, he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Idris

texts.ru: Идрис родился в 1990 года. Он является студентом 3 курса Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он учится по специальности Менеджмента. Идрис учится в университете отлично и справляется с домашними делами после занятий успешно. Идрис не женат, и живет с родителями. Ее родители простые рабочие и не в состоянии в этом году оплатить за его учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Idris was born in 1990. He is a third-year student at the Technical University of Tajikistan, majoring in management. Idris is an excellent student and keeps up with chores at home after his studies. He is not married and lives with his parents, who are simple labourers and do not have the means to pay his tuition this year. He is requesting a loan to cover his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Gulniso

texts.ru: Гулнисо женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями. Она единственная кормилица в семье. Гулнисо одинокая женщина. Ее муж бросил ее и женился на другой женщине. После развода ей была очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами. Она была ранена душевно. Гулнисо благодаря своему знанию и тем ресурсам, которых выложили ей ее родители, смогла преодолеть трудность и поставить себя на ноги. Сегодня она работает в государственном учреждении и ежемесячно получает зарплату. Она постепенно улучшает условию проживания. Гулнисо хочет купить мебель для своего дома, но не имеет денег. Она использует свою зарплату для покупки продуктов питания и одежды. Гулнисо запрашивает займ на сумму 1300 долларов США для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulniso is a woman with a beautiful spirit and beautiful thoughts. She is the only breadwinner in her family. Gulniso is a lonely woman, as her husband left her and married another woman. After the divorce she had a very difficult time managing the family's expenses as she was heartbroken. Thanks to her skills and the resources her parents left her, Gulniso was able to overcome difficulty and get back on her feet. Today she works in a government establishment, earns a monthly salary and is gradually improving her quality of life. Gulniso wants to buy furniture for her house but does not have the money as she uses her salary to buy groceries and clothing. She is requesting a loan for $1,300 USD to purchase furniture. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 49 years old and married with four children.

Zenaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell like snack foods, juice, milk, bath soap, shampoo, etc., in her general store.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Zenaida aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell like snack foods, juice, milk, bath soap, shampoo, etc., in her general store

loans.name: Gretchen

texts.en:
Gretchen is 25 years old and married, with two children.

Gretchen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, shampoo, soft drinks, chips, and groceries.

Gretchen has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Gretchen aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like eggs, shampoo, soft drinks, chips, and groceries.

loans.name: José De Jesús

texts.es: Desde hace algunos años José De Jesús se dedica a la producción de café pues es el principal cultivo que hay en la comunidad en donde vive.
