This is her sixth loan with Kiva, and so she is thankful to those who make it possible to access this funding as she will feel safer going ahead with her work, and she on her end agrees to make her payments on time.

With the amount requested of 1800 soles, she will buy upholstery supplies, including sponges, special needles, thread, canvas, plywood, glue and other items that are needed to do the work.

loans.use: to buy thread, sponges, canvas, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Ermenda

texts.en:
Ermenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, eggs, etc. for her general store business.

Ermenda has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from buying and selling coconuts.

Ermenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a very hardworking lady from Nyahururu. She is 38 years old, married to John, who is a farmer, and has six children aged 18, 15, 13, 10, 8 and 4 years old, who are all in school.

She is a tailor, a business she has been running for the last four years. To enable her to buy more clothing material and thread to use in making clothes for her customers, she has applied for her second loan of KES 15,000 from Kadet Ltd.

From her business she makes a monthly income of KES 10,000 and she plans to pay school fees for her children with the anticipated profits from her expanded business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are that her family will be financially stable and remain in good health and prosperity.

loans.use: To buy clothing material and thread to use to make clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Shavleg

texts.en: Shavleg is a 33-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, three children and mother-in-law in a small village of Terjola district. His mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. His children go to the local school. The only source of income for the family is a small vineyard. Shavleg produces wine and sells locally, but this is not enough for 6 member family. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category and gets pension from government. Shavleg decided to purchase a cow and start producing dairy products. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1000 gel for purchasing a cow. As the cow is purchased, his wife will milk it every day and will produce cheese to sell. They will sell cheese as well as use it to feed the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling young coconuts. Lydia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net and other materials.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a very hardworking lady from Nyahururu. She is 23 years old and single, but has one child aged four years old.

She is in the clothing sales industry, a business she has been running for the last seven months. To enable her to stock her business with more clothes, she has applied for her first loan of Kshs. 20,000 (Kenyan shillings) from KADET Ltd.

Her monthly income right now is Kshs. 10,000. She intends to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her son.

Gladys has hopes and dreams of owning a very big and successful boutique in the future and being financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
"Aisha is 41 years old and lives in the town of Nateete A in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past 12 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more different types of clothes to sell, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and take care of his family members. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to own another shop in town. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more different types of clothes to sell,

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 60 years old married to Margaret and they are supporting three children who are in school.

He has been in the dairy farming business in Ndunyu Njeru for 45 years and has applied for fifth loan from Kadet Ltd, to enable him purchase a dairy cow. With anticipated profits, he plans to expand his dairy farming.

He hopes to apply for bigger loans from Kadet ltd to enable him expand his dairy farming business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with four children residing in Oroquieta City. Fe owns and operates a retail store where she sells soft drinks and many items to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years. 

Fe joined GDMPC, and her previous loan that was used in her business was successfully repaid. She requested a new loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase dried fish, rice and corn grits for sale.  

In the future, Fe wants to build a house and wants to see her children successful.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, rice and corn grits for sale.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Carmen works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Carmen is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, egg, etc for her general store business.

Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, egg, etc

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg, age 23, is a very kind and hard-working, single man. He lives with his parents and retired grandfather in the village of Zovreti. Oleg and his parents are jobless at the moment. The only source for them is retirement pension of Oleg’s grandfather which is approximately $75 per month. 
For the reason, the existing funds are too small so Oleg decided to start up his own business. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, and the majority of the inhabitants are self-employed to make a living. To be able to start up his business, he is requesting a $600 loan. His loan request was approved, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions, to country vulnerable poor people who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the amount he is asking for, Oleg will co-found a metal and plastics workshop with his relative who has all the needed equipments for manufacturing. Oleg will purchase materials for making doors and windows. The business partners will manufacture and sell them at a good price, because demand is high in the region.  Oleg used to work as a hired worker in that kind of workshop and he has proper experience in this field. This loan will be a great help for Oleg, to generate revenue and give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase materials for setting up a metal and plastics workshop, to manufacture windows and doors

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 6 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts to sell, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her 2 children. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio tiene 55 años, esta casado y tiene 1 hijo de 18 años que vive con el en su casa hecha de material noble. Desde muy niño creció junto a sus padres aprendiendo así a trabajar la tierra para beneficio de su familia junto a sus hermanos. Cuando cumplió 20 años se casó y empezó a asumir una gran responsabilidad familiar junto a su esposa recibiendo por parte de sus padres un terreno de 4 hectáreas para el cultivo de los productos más rentables de su zona y que le fue útil para adquirir con el paso de los años las 2 hectáreas más de terreno que posee.Tiene conocimientos en el cultivo cacao, café, achiote, piña y cítricos.
Hace 5 años optó por convertirse en un comprador de los productos mas rentables en su localidad inducido por su hermano quien también desempeña este negocio. Fue así que habilitó un ambiente amplio de su vivienda para el adecuado almacenamiento de los sacos con los diversos granos de cacao ,café, achiote y palillo logrando venderlos  a los grandes empresarios de la ciudad obteniendo buenos ingresos y facilitando a los agricultores la obtención inmediata de dinero por sus productos en su misma comunidad. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y espera contar con la confianza necesaria para tener un apoyo financiero. En está ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar los productos tales como cacao, café, palillo, entre otros a los agricultores de su zona.
texts.en:
Braulio is 55 years old. He is married and has a son who is 18 years old, who lives with him in his house made of worthy material.

From an early age he and his brothers learned from his parents to work the land for the benefit of the family. 

When he was 20 years old he married and he and his wife assumed a great family responsibility, receiving from his parents 4 hectares of land to grow the most profitable products of the area, and it was helpful to acquire as time went by, 2 more hectares to the land he owned. He is knowledgeable in the growing of cocoa, coffee, achiote, pineapple, and citrus.

Five years ago he decided to become a buyer of the most profitable products in his area motivated by his brother who also works in this business. This is why he fitted out a suitable area at home in order to adequately store the various bags of grains of cocoa, coffee, achiote, and turmeric, selling them to large businesses in the city obtaining good income and helping the farmers to be paid immediately for their products in their own community.

This is his first Kiva loan and he is hoping that you have confidence in him in order to provide the necessary help. He is asking for 1,000 soles in order to buy products such as cocoa, coffee, turmeric, and more items, as do other farmers in his area.

loans.use: yo buy products such as coffee, cocoa, turmeric, and other items

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married mother of 11 children, Aida works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from food vending. Aida is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mainza

texts.en:
Mainza, 29, is a farmer and father of one child in Kabwe District, Zambia.  He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his farm.

For the past 5 years, Mainza has been growing tomatoes, cabbage, and fresh greens that he sells to local markets.  Having learned about improved vegetable farming through NGO and government training programs, he has been irrigating his garden by hand, drawing water from a nearby pond with buckets.  It’s a tiring task, and limits Mainza’s ability to expand his production.

Water pumps can be a major boost for many small farmers such as Mainza.  They allow for farmers to continue growing high value crops, even in the dry season, while also expanding the size of their fields.  Unfortunately the upfront costs of such a water pump can be quite prohibitive.  Once he secures a Kiva loan, Mainza will get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the pump to his farm, and provide training on how to properly maintain and use the equipment.

With a water pump, Mainza plans to significantly increase his production, especially cabbage as the market for the produce is quite lucrative.  He hopes to use the new profits to pay for school fees and to better support his family.  It is for this reason Mainza is asking Kiva lenders to assist him with a loan so that he may obtain a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is 51 years old and is a farmer from Kabwe District, Zambia.  He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he can purchase a water pump that will help him irrigate and expand his small farm.

For the past 2 years, Mathias has been growing tomatoes, fresh greens and a local eggplant called ‘Impwa’ to sell at local markets.  Having realized the market that exists for fresh vegetables, he shifted away from growing only rain-fed maize (corn) to also focus on his vegetable production.  His small garden has been an excellent additional source of year round income, but he has been having to use buckets to irrigate his crops, a tiring and time-consuming task. 

Water pumps can be a major boost for many small farmers such as Mathias.  They allow for farmers to continue growing high value crops, even in the dry season, while also expanding the size of their fields.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be quite prohibitive.  Once he secures a Kiva loan, Mathias will get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the pump to his farm and provide training on how to properly maintain and use the equipment.

Mathias hopes that with a water pump he can really begin to focus on his vegetable production.  He plans to use the new profits from increased vegetable sales to support his children’s schooling, and to increase his savings for the future.  It is for this reason Mathias is asking Kiva lenders to assist him with the loan so that he may obtain a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, 55 years old, lives with his wife and four children in a small village in the Terjola district. Zurab has a vineyard and produces wine to sell. 

Zurab has decided to broaden his agricultural activities through the purchase of a cow. The Start Up program, a joint initiative between Kive and Credo, will enable him to borrow 1500 Gel for the purchase. His wife will milk the cow every day and sell dairy products. This will increase their family income, and they will also use dairy products to feed their children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 57 years old, and is from the farming region of Chibombo District, Zambia.  She is asking for a Kiva loan so that she can purchase a water pump to irrigate and expand her farm.

Monicah has been growing onion and a local eggplant called ‘Impwa’ to sell to buyers in Zambia’s capital city, Lusaka.  Using buckets to draw water from a nearby well, she has managed to maintain healthy crops.  She plans to get a water pump that will help her realize her goals of further expanding her farm.

Water pumps can be a major boost for small farmers such as Monicah, who often struggle to irrigate their crops with buckets.  A water pump allows for farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate.  Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once she secures a loan, Monicah will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to her farm as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

Monicah plans to use the pump to help her increase her sales.  On top of growing more onion and impwa, she hopes to begin growing butternut squash and fresh maize.  It is for this reason Monicah is asking Kiva lenders to assist her with the loan so that she can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Irma Marleny

texts.es:
Doña Irma es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos los cuales viven en familia todos juntos tres de ellos estudian en diferentes grados de primaria y el mayor en secundaria. Ella curso hasta el 6 grado de la primaria y es agricultora desde su infancia ya que sus padres son agricultores por generaciones y ella no es la excepción. Solo ellos como familia se integran en las diferentes actividades a realizar en sus cultivos de café como limpieza, recolección del grano al final de la temporada, aplicación de abono, fertilizantes, etc. Dicha actividad ha sido ingreso para su familia (padres) y siguen siéndolo en la actualidad para la de ella. Sus clientes son las diferentes bodegas, pulperías e intermediarios que llegan a la zona en busca del producto.
Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos y abonos para dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café ya que casi se acerca la temporada de corte y el objetivo es aprovecharla al máximo ya que por medio de esto ella podrá tener una mejor cosecha y mejores ganancias para re-invertir y salir de su compromiso. 
Sus planes son cultivar una variedad de producto con el tiempo que sea más atractivo para sus clientes y poder algún día exportarlo a otros países, esto mejorara las ganancias para su familia y podrá cumplir con los sueños de sus hijos y seguir apoyándolos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Irma, 35, is married and the mother of four children, who all live together as a family.  Three of them are in different grades in elementary school and the oldest is in secondary school.  Irma only studied up to sixth grade.  She has been a farmer since she was a baby; her parents have been farmers for generations, and she's no exception.

As a family they perform the different tasks on their coffee crops, such as weeding, harvesting the fruit at the end of the season, applying soil amendments and fertilizer, and so on.  This work has been her parents' income and they continue doing it currently for Irma's family.  Irma's customers are various stores and the intermediaries who come to the area looking for products.

Currently Irma's requesting help to buy agricultural inputs and soil amendments as technical assistance for her coffee crop because the cutting season is almost here.  Her goal is to take the greatest advantage of it so she'll have a better harvest and better profits to reinvest and satisfy her commitment.

Her plans for the future are to grow a variety of products so she's more attractive to her customers and to be able to export her crop abroad someday.  This will improve her profits for her family and she'll be able to fulfill her children's dreams and continue supporting them in their studies.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a 63-year-old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, ta'amu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. 

Luisa has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a spade and a weed-sprayer for her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Luisa hopes to pay her grandchildren's school fees and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, a spade and a weedsprayer.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 51 years old and married with eleven children. Four of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Rita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soap, sugar and other goods. 

In the future, Rita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga, age 26, is from Senaki district. She is married with a toddler son. Inga is an internally displaced person and gets a small social assistance from the local government. Inga’s husband is a soldier and the family lives in the military settlement. Inga’s mother-in-law lives with the family as well. Inga is a hard-working young woman with a great desire to get ahead. The soldier salary is not enough for saving and improving their standard of living. 

Inga has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices and start a clothing sales business among her community members. Since there are not many clothing stores in her district, Inga's business will have high demand. She will be very nice to her customers and will be able to get more profit. This start up loan is a good chance for Inga to earn stable income and improve her living conditions in future.

loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 31-year-old man from Migori, which is found in Kenya. He supports four people in his family and is married to Jackline, who is a farmer. They have two children who are three and five years old respectively.

He sells shoes within his market, a business he has been doing for the last eight years, and gets a monthly income of KES 90,000. He has requested a loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to add more stock to increase its value. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

His dream is to have a better life.

loans.use: to increase his stock and add more value.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old married father of two children who has been selling perfumes, toys, and accessories in his shop since a year and a half ago. He is his family’s sole breadwinner, which is why he has to work hard and put so much effort to keep on improving his business.
 
Ahmad needs to expand his business, but his lack of cash stops him from doing what he plans. Thus, for this reason, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy newly released items such as beauty cosmetics and accessories to diversify his products and attract new customers.

As for the future, Ahmad is working hard to keep on expanding his business to make sure it will continue to provide him with a suitable income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Juana De La Concepcion

texts.es: Juana de la concepción mayor de edad madre soltera originaria del municipio de Chinandega, con dos hijas una aún bajo su responsabilidad por su discapacidad el cual acude a una escuela para niños con capacidades diferentes, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar con su hija dándole toda su atención y disfrutar con ella de las deliciosas comidas que realiza al igual que escuchan música viendo una respuesta positiva para su hija, desafortunadamente por falta de recursos económicos y por la pobreza en la que vivía no logro terminar sus estudios y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, gracias a sus esfuerzos y ganas de superación logra salir adelante junto con sus hijas, Juana tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, los cuales vende productos de consumo para el hogar como: arroz,  frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, detergentes, ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, prendas , pan, huevos, café, frutas, entre otros, Juana desde muy temprano abre su negocio y cierra lago tarde asi le brinda mejor atención a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es lograr terminar de construir su casa ampliándola para así tener los dos negocios separados. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en su pulpería como en la mercadería en general y que en ambos negocios su demanda ha crecido. Juana agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos..-
texts.en: Juana de la Concepción a single older mother originally from Chinandega, with two daughters with one of them still under her care as she is disabled and attends a school for children with disabilities. She describes herself as being a hard-working and responsible woman with the desire to be successful. In her free time she likes to spend time with her daughter, giving her all her attention and enjoy with her delicious meals that she makes, or, they listen to music as her daughter responds positively to it. Unfortunately because of the lack of economic resources and the poverty in which she lives she was not able to finish her schooling as it was necessary to work at a young age to help with the household expenses. Thanks to her efforts and desire to succeed she has been able to support her daughters with the small grocery store located in her home, from which she sells consumer goods for the home such as: rice, beans, sugar, candy, detergent, clothing, shoes, cosmetics, clothing, bread, eggs, coffee, fruit, and other items. Juan opens her business very early and closes late, thus providing the best service to her customers. One of her dreams is being able to continue building her house, expanding it in order to have two separate businesses. The objective of this loan is to invest in her store, buying general merchandise as the demand has increased. Juana is very thankful for the support that Kiva investors offer to people of few economic resources.

loans.use: to buy consumer goods such as rice, detergent, clothing for children and adults, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 41 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Lina has been pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.

Lina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 52-year-old butchery owner. He is married to Jullie and together they are blessed with two children. Samuel has been selling beef meat for the past three years with a monthly income of KSH 10,000, which he uses to sustain his family. 

Samuel is applying for his third loan from KADET. He will use the loan to buy more cows for slaughter. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more cows for slaughter.

loans.name: Fetalaiga

texts.en:
Fetalaga is a 66-year-old widow woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 10 years.

She has requested a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, a weed sprayer, a spade and a wheelbarrow for her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Fetalaiga hopes to use her profit for her grandchildren's school fees and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, chemicals, a weed sprayer, a spade and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Faamanatu

texts.en:
Faamantu is 47 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business of selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Faamantu has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, a frying pan and one gallon of oil. 

She joined SPBD in 2012. Faamanatu hopes to use her profit to support her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, a frying pan and one gallon of oil.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 38 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been pig fattening for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Myrna is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling and farming vegetables. Angelita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to dry for her dried fish making business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to dry

loans.name: Meyling Del Carmen

texts.es: Meylin tiene 29 años de edad casada madre de una hija en edad escolar, su esposo trabaja como conductor de Autobuses y apoya  su esposa con los gastos del Hogar, la actidad comercial de meylin es la venta de Productos de Belleza como Perfumes, Cosmeticos, Cremas para el cuerpo etc. el credito lo solicita para incrementar un poco mas sus producto ya que ella desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y poder cumplir uno de sus  mayores sueños ya q ue con la ganancia que genere ira terminando de construir su casa.
texts.en: Meylin is 29 years old, married, and mother of a school age daughter. Her husband works as a commercial bus drive and supports his wife with the household expenses. Meylin sells beauty products such as perfumes, cosmetics, body creams, etc. The loan she sells will be used to increase her product selection as she wishes to improve her living conditions and be able to accomplish one of her greatest dreams as with the earning she will finsh building her home.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma Leticia es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación con 38 años de edad madre de 2 hijos los cuales viven con ella y su compañero de hogar. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo y no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron dicha actividad hace un tiempo y que hasta hoy en día es medio de ingreso para sus padres, para ella y sus hijos. Las diferentes actividades en sus cultivos son elaboradas por la familia ya que juntos son apoyo mutuo en la agricultura como unión familiar. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en el mercado local en pequeña escala con los diferentes vendedores de la zona. 
Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos agrícolas que mediante la aplicación mejoraran sus cultivos de maíz ya que por medio de esto ella podrá asegurar sus cosechas y el producto para poder venderlo a un buen precio en el mercado local.
Sus planes y metas a futuro son de ampliar sus cultivos comprando más tierra en la que ella pueda trabajar ya que de ellos dependen sus 2 pequeños y sus sueño es verlos realizados y estudiados a nivel universitario evitando que no pasen por lo mismo que ella paso en su juventud.
texts.en:
Norma Leticia is a hard-working woman, entrepreneurial, with many desires to succeed. She is 38 years old, mother of 2 children who live with her and her partner. She has a primary school education and couldn't continue her education because of her parent's lack of economic resources.  It was her parents that taught her how to farm a long time ago and still today that is her parent's source of income, as well as hers. The different farming activities are done by the family as they support each other farming, as a family. Her product is bought and sold in the local market on a small scale with different vendors in the area.
Today she seeks help to buy agricultural products that through their application will improve her corn crops and thus she will be able to ensure her harvests and have product to sell at a good price on the local market. 
Her plans and goals for the future are to expand her crops buying more land in which she can work as her two children depend on her and she wants to see their dreams come true and be able to study at the university level so that they don't have the same thing happen to them in their youth as happened to her.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products for her corn crops.

loans.name: Charlse

texts.en:
Charlse is 37 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Charlse has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Charlse has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts to sell, and will help Charlse to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger business. 

Charlse is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charlse who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.


"

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6  personas   responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE MICAELA BASTIDA ” uno de ellos es  Luis  de 33  años soltero  y sin   hijos, Luis   se dedica ya hace 13  años a la venta de pollo   en un pequeño mercado  (alquilado)  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante, Luis   ha logrado mejorar su economía  y mejorar su calidad de vida , y  así Seguir mejorando su negocio  , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más pollos y seguir con su posterior venta  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo, Luis es el único caballero que se observa en la foto,  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en: The group consists of 6 responsible people with distinct businesses. These are the members of the communal group “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE MICAELA BASTIDA”, one of them is 33 year old Luis. Luis is single and does not have children. Luis has been selling chickens in a small rented space in the market every day with the goal of getting ahead. Luis has been able to improve his economic situation and quality of life, and in this way continuously improve his business. With the loan he receives he will invest in buying more chickens and continue with his selling and thus be able to have more income. Luis says good-bye with a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo, and he is the only gentleman in the photo. He is grateful for the loan that makes his progress possible.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Naisula

texts.en:
Naisula is a 36-year-old industrious married lady and a mother of four children between 12 and 18 years of age. She crafts and sells ornaments in Narok town, Kenya. She learnt about KADET from some other women in the market who are already being financed by KADET Ltd.

She has been advanced her first loan of Ksh 30,000 (Kenyan shillings), which she will use to buy beads for crafting the colourful ornaments. 

Naisula plans to diversify into animal rearing with the proceeds. She will also assist in the paying of school fees for the children who are now in college.

Her dream is to uplift the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase beads for making necklaces and other ornaments.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 35-year-old married man. He has two children aged 2 and 4 years. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a cereals stall where he sells maize and beans. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a market area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a shortage of goods. He will use the 25,000 KES loan to add stock of maize and beans. His business goal is to be well developed within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be famous in business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add stock of maize and beans

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is a 29-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, his parents and an infant son in a small village of the Terjola district. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and a plot of agricultural land where maize is grown. They produce cheese products and sell it along with the harvested maize locally. 

Gela decided to build a greenhouse and requested a loan. The Start Up loan program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2,000 GEL for purchasing building materials to build a greenhouse. When the greenhouse is built he will sow cucumbers and tomatoes there to sell. This will increase the income of their family. With increased income he will expand the business in the future and improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Zarifjon

texts.ru: Зарифчону 18 лет. Он умный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Зарифчон является студентом 2 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Таджикистана Политики и Бизнеса. Зарифчон учится по специальности Бизнес менеджмента. Он учится успешно и читает много книг. Зарифчон в свободное время от учебы помогает родителям по выращиванию картошки, а также по скотоводству. Зарифчон должен оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью он запрашивает займ на сумму 550 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zarifjon is 18 years old. He is an intelligent and hardworking young man. He is currently in his second year of studies at the Tajikistan State University of Business and Politics where he specializes in the field of business management.  He is an excellent student and reads a lot.  When he is not studying, Zarifjon helps his parents who cultivate potatoes and are also involved in animal husbandry.  Zarifjon needs to pay his university tuition and for this reason he is seeking a loan of 500 USD.  He is awaiting your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to pay for his education.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sofia works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a buy-and-sell ready to wear. Sofia is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy materials, such as cloths, needles, and other materials, for her tailoring business.

Sofia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cloths, needles, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Elmer Andamir

texts.es:
Elmer, necesita invertir en la siembra de maíz y frijol, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas (abono, insecticida y herbicidas). Con la ayuda que se le brindo antes adquirió lo necesario para preparar su cosecha, tuvo mejores ganancias y su producción no represento ninguna dificultad.
Está satisfecho por seguir contribuyendo con el apoyo que le brinda a su familia, les ofrece mejor alimentación y sigue dándoles la oportunidad de superación a sus hijos sin ningún inconveniente; todos están saludables.
texts.en: Elmer needs to invest in planting corn and beans, so he is seeking a loan to buy farming supplies (fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide). With the help he has received previously he purchased what he needed in order to prepare his harvest, he had greater income and his production didn't encounter any problems. He is satisfied to continue contributing with the help he provides to his family, offering them better food and continuing to give his children opportunities to succeed without any barriers; they are all in good health.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide).

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Rosibel, tiene 44 años, está acompañada,  vive con su compañero de vida y con sus tres hijos en casa propia; hace cinco años por iniciativa propia instalo una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, la atiende todos los días desde muy temprano sin ningún problema, ya que la ubico en su casa de habitación.
Solicita capital para comprar aceite arroz, bebidas,  jabón, etc., para tener un negocio más surtido, generar más ingresos, ganar clientes nuevos y satisfacer las necesidades de los que ya tiene.
Rosibel desea ampliar su negocio para mejorar su economía, lo que le permitirá cubrir muchas de las necesidades que su familia tiene y sobre todo les podrá dar a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 44 years old, lives with her partner and three children in their own home. Five years ago she opened a store that sells basic need items. She works every day starting early in the morning without any problem, as the store is located in her home.
She seeks capital to buy oil, rice, beverages, soap, etc. in order to better stock her store, generate more income, gain more customers, and satisfy the needs of her current customers. 
Rosibel wishes to expand her business in order to improve her economic situation, which would permit her to pay for other necessities that her family has and above all be able to provide her children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beverages, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 25-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 9 months and 6 years old. She operates a farm where she grows maize and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of facilities for irrigating vegetables.

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy equipment for irrigation, e.g., sprinklers, pipes, etc. Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and have a good living.

loans.use: to buy equipment for irrigation, e.g., sprinklers, pipes, etc.

loans.name: Dono

texts.ru: Доно родилась в 1964 года. Она вместе с семьей живет на севере Таджикистана. Доно родилась и выросла в сельской местности. Она с детства помогала родителям по выращиванию сельхоз культур и скотоводства. После замужества она начала собственный бизнес скотоводством. Доно уже более 20 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Доно воспитывает 2 детей. Она является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж работает учителем в средней школе. Доно хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. Она скоро должна провести свадебное торжество своего сына и поэтому нуждается больше денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dono was born in 1964.  She lives in northern Tajikistan with her family.  She was born and raised in the countryside.  As a child, she used to help her parents who were involved in crop farming and animal husbandry.  After she got married, she started her own animal husbandry business, which she has been running for more than 20 years.

Dono raises two children.  Her husband works as a high school teacher, but Dono is the family's main breadwinner.  She wants to increase her working capital and, ultimately, her income.  She will soon have to hold a wedding celebration for her son, so she needs to have more money.  She is requesting a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy some livestock.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Genalyn earns additional income by farming rice.

Genalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  (NWTF). She dreams of saving enough money so she can send her children to school in the future. Genalyn is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 33 years old, a tailor and a single mother to three children. She has been a tailor for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 9,300 which she uses to provide for her children. 

Ann is applying for her second loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to buy sewing materials and a new sewing machine. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will expand her shop. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and build a home for them.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en: Fortunee is 32 years old. She deals with timber and has been selling timber for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more timbers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more timbers for sale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is married with three children and resides in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City with her family. Her husband works as a security guard while she manages their farm to make a living. She grows and harvests coconut and sells it in bulk to cover the costs of their daily expenses. She joined GDMPC and borrowed 15,000 PHP to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings to make a new vegetable garden. This amount will help her to achieve her plan to earn extra income. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Vekona

texts.en: Vekona, age 69, is from the Chkhorotsku district. She lives with her husband and a grown son. Vekona and her spouse get a small retirement pension and that is the only source for the family. She is a well-educated lady with a strong belief that she’s still able to generate good income for her family members. She is an excellent mother and wife. Vekona is sad that the existing family income is not enough for covering food and daily expenses; that is why she decided to start her own business and purchase apparel and linens for resale. She will hire the stall at the local fair market and sell the items with a price mark-up. The profit will be reinvested in the same business and Vekona will increase the sales volume. She believes in your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothing and linen to sell from her stall

loans.name: Tounsidazanga 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme AISSATA est la représentante  du groupe TOUNSIDAZANGA II. Elle se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 09personnes  en charge.
Mme est restauratrice depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les  marchés  de son quartier. Ses clients sont les amis et voisins.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac d’haricot, 02sacs de riz et une rangée de bois de chauffe pour sa cuisine.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne aider à la scolarité de ses enfants et ouvrir d’autres restaurants.
texts.en:
AISSATA is the representative of the TOUNSIDAZANGA II group.  She is doing well.  She is married and the mother of seven children.  Her oldest child is 30 years old and her youngest is 14.  Three of her children are in school.  AISSATA supports nine people.

AISSATA has been running a small restaurant for ten years.  She buys her supplies at local markets.  Her customers are friends and neighbors.

AISSATA wants to buy one bag of beans, two bags of rice and some firewood for her kitchen.  She wants to save her profits.  Her ambition is to be able to contribute to her children's schooling costs and to open other restaurants.

loans.use: to buy one bag of beans, two bags of rice and some firewood for her kitchen.

loans.name: Olga Yanira

texts.es:
Olga, está decidida a tomar un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza (tintes, labiales, cremas para el cabello, mascarillas, etc.),  para seguir  brindando un servicio de calidad en su sala de belleza. Los benéficos que le dio la inversión que hizo antes fueron un negocio con productos nuevos que ofrecer a sus clientes y la generación de ganancias que le permitieron pagar la deuda.
Brinda mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, siguen siendo el mismo número de integrantes, todos están muy saludables y siguen trabajando cada día para mantener el negocio activo.
texts.en:
Olga has decided to take out a new loan in order to invest in the purchase of beauty products (hair dyes, lipsticks, hair conditioner, face masks, etc.), in order to continue providing a high-quality service in her beauty salon. The benefits of the investment before were a business with new producers to offer to her customers and the generation of profits that allowed her to pay off the debt. 

She provides better life conditions for her family; it continues to have the same number of members. They all are very healthy and continue to work every day in order to maintain the active business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products (hair dyes, lipsticks, hair conditioner, face masks, etc.)

loans.name: Tranh

texts.en:
Tranh was born in 1993. He lives in Bac Ninh. He has an Electronics and Telecommunications major at Le Qui Don Technical University (http://vi.wikipedia.org/wiki/H%E1%BB%8Dc_vi%E1%BB%87n_K%E1%BB%B9_thu%E1%BA%ADt_Qu%C3%A2n_s%E1%BB%B1). His course lasts 50 months, and he will be graduating in 2016. His education’s fee is subsidized by his parents.

Tranh’s family has five members. His mother is a farmer. His father is a construction worker. The woman who is sitting next to him in this picture is his mother. He is the third person in his family who graduated from high school and has a higher education. His family’s income is about 10,000,000 dong (VND) per month.

Tranh has a passion for his major. He usually finds interesting ideas from his major. He also understands that learning helps him have qualifications to get a high-paid job and bring in income for his family. He wants to borrow 15,300,000 VND to pay for a computer to support his studying. If he couldn’t access this loan, his studying would be interrupted. He appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind program. This has been a lot of support for the education of students in Vietnam. He also hopes this program can be expanded to help more students.

loans.use: to pay for a computer to support his studying.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel resides in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City with her family. Her husband worked as an OFW while she raises pigs as an aid to her husband's income. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase feed and piglets to raise. She plans to use her profit for the construction of a livestock shelter for the expansion of her business. Her dream is to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 45, is married and has two children aged 17 and 20 years. For the past two years she has run a stall where she sells spinach, tomatoes and other vegetables. Her business is located in a favorable place and most of her customers are local residents.

This will be Lucy’s first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the 20,000 KES to buy stocks of spinach, tomatoes and other vegetables.

Lucy’s five-year plan is to have a stable and fully realized business and that it will continue to be profitable.

loans.use: to buy stocks of spinach, tomatoes and other vegetables.

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee is fifty years old. She is married with eight children aged between nine and 29 years. For the past eleven years she has owned and run a bar.

Consolee is applying for a 300,000 RWF loan through Urwego to buy more crates of sodas and beer for her bar. The extra profits from her business will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy more crates of sodas and beer for her bar.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 30 years old and married with four children. She earns an income mainly through the sale of crops and livestock as well as a monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land, Annet grows bananas, maize, beans and cassava. She also has goats and chickens. After serving as a CKW for the last two years, Annet looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. 

As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to serve farmers of her village with agricultural information and enhance crop and animal production. Annet will invest the added income she will earn as a CKW in her farm to buy different breeds of animals and crops. Her dream is to establish model crop and animal projects that will change the face of agricultural production in her village.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una mujer de 48 años; madre soltera de 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Catalina se dedica a la agricultura hace mas de 30 años en una parcela de 1 ½ hectárea que adquirió desde muy joven ayudada por el  padre de sus hijos con la finalidad de usarlo como principal fuente de ingreso cultivando los productos mas comerciales de su zona tales como el cacao, cítricos, cafe ; entre otros. Cuando se inició logró desempeñarlo con mucha dedicación y responsabilidad ya que fue un oficio que sus padres le inculcaron desde muy niña. Uno de sus principales inconvenientes al iniciarse en esta labor es que ya era madre de su primer hijo y tenía que realizar las respectivas tareas agrícolas con su bebe en espaldas. Su trabajo consiste en brindarle el mejor de los cuidados y mantenimiento a sus plantaciones ya que es requisito indispensable para la obtención de una cosecha con valor comercial haciendo rentable esta actividad. Para una buena obtención de sus cosechas suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico. Le agrada mucho participar en la cosecha donde es necesario contratar a trabajadores del lugar para aminorar la carga laboral y haciendo de esta tarea un trabajo colectivo y entretenido. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En está ocasion desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas de manera natural.
texts.en:
Catalina is a 48-year-old woman and a single mother of 4 children with whom she lives in her own house. Catalina has worked in agriculture for more than 30 years on a plot of 1.5 hectares that she acquired when she was very young. She was helped by the father of her children with the objective of using it as the principle source of income, cultivating the most commercial products in her region like cocoa, citrus fruits, and coffee, among others. 

When she started she achieved performing the work with much dedication and responsibility, since it was a profession that her parents instilled in her since she was a child. One of her principle problems when she started this work was that she was already the mother of her first son, and she had to do the agricultural work with her baby on her back. Her work consists of dedicating the best of care and maintenance to her fields since it is an indispensable requirement for obtaining a harvest with commercial value, making this activity profitable.

In order to obtain a good harvest she usually fertilizes her land with organic fertilizer. She really likes to participate in the harvesting where it is necessary to contract local workers in order to reduce the workload, and making this task a collective and enjoyable task.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels thankful for the financial support that she is receiving to move forward. Additionally she is committed to making her payments in a punctual manner. On this occasion she wishes to have 1,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) for the purchase of organic fertilizer in order to improve the quality of her crops in a natural way.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Alona works hard to support her family. She sells fish as well as buying and selling corn in the Philippines.

Alona has taken out and successfully repaid ten loans through NWTF in the past. She is now borrowing 28,000 PHP to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Alona hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money so she will be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, está casada, tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo en casa propia, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos (maíz y frijoles) para contribuir en los gastos de la casa. Tiene diez años practicando está actividad económica de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 p.m., de lunes a sábado. 
Solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas (abono, semilla, herbicidas, etc.), de esta forma tendrá todo lo necesario para la cosecha.
Lucha por cumplir el sueño de ampliar el área de cultivo, generar ganancias con las que cumplirá con el compromiso de la deuda que adquirió, tener una vida sin carencias junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
María, is married, 53 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. 

To help contribute to the household income, she grows basic crops such as corn and beans. She has ten years of experience with this work, from 6am to 12pm, Monday through Saturday. 

She is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies (fertilizer, seeds, herbicides etc). This way she will have everything for the harvest. 

She is fighting to fulfill her dream of expanding her cultivating area, generate more income to pay off debt and have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (fertilizer, seeds, herbicides etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic staples (beans, corn, rice, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Santos Alfredo

texts.es: Don Santos ha trabajado duro todo su vida para lograr cumplir sus metas propuestas, su esposa e hijos le apoyan en todo tanto economicamente como emocional. su prioridad en estos momentos es terminar de construir su casa. con este credito retocara la parte delantera levantando la pared y construir bien un corredor. los materiales a utilizar son. Bloquez, Cemento, Arena, Piedrin, etc. el labora como docente para un centro educativo en Managua y su esposa tiene una pequeña pulperia donde vende Golosinas refrescos, etc. Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado estos años.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos has worked hard his entire life to reach his goals. His wife and children support him economically as well as emotionally. 

His priority right now is to finish building his house. 

With this loan he will redo the back part lifting the wall and building a hallway. He will use blocks, cement, sand, stone etc. 

He works as a teacher at a school in Managua and his wife has a small grocery store where she sells candy, sodas etc. 

He appreciates the help Kiva and Afodenic have given him throughout the years.

loans.use: to buy construction material.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 29 years and married to Faith, a farmer. He is a father of three children who are 13, 6 and 2, respectively. He earns a living from the sale of tomatoes, which he has been doing for the last four years in Narok market. He learned about Kadet from some women in the market who are already being financed by Kadet Ltd.

He has acquired his first loan of KES 10,000, which he will use to acquire more fresh tomatoes for resale in bulk. Jacob will use the increased proceeds to pay school fees for his children.

Jacob's hope is to expand his stall to a large grocery stall.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Martin Raul

texts.es:
Martin con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro inicio  su negocio de venta de computadoras y servicio de soporte técnico de computadoras, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede salir adelante.

Martin agradece el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería como piezas de computadora con lo cual podrá atender mejor a sus clientes, así podrá seguir mejorando su negocio y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Martín, with a lot of effort and savings, started his business selling computers and providing technical support.  He works around nine hours a day and is able to get ahead with what he earns from his job.

Martín's grateful for the support of the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy merchandise such as computer parts to be able to better serve his customers.  This way he'll continue improving his business and striving to achieve his big dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to buy computer parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for a tailoring shop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana continua con su actividad comercial, que es elaboracion de Camiones de Madera para comercializarlos al por mayor. con este nuevo credito ella compra Materiales como Madera, Pegamento, Pintura, Clavos para poder construir mas Camiones ya que esta temporada sus ventas se eleban un poco ya que la mayoria de personas aprovechan para regalarles a sus hijos. su esposo la apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que es comerciante por cuanta propia. ella espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Kiva y Afodenic para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Juana continues with her job making wooden trucks to sell wholesale.  With this new loan she'll buy materials such as wood, glue, paint, and nails so she can build more trucks.

The majority of people take advantage of this time of year to buy gifts for their children, so her sales go up a little.  Her husband, an independent merchant, helps her with the household expenses.

Juana hopes to continue having the support of Kiva and AFODENIC so she can get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, and glue

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 28 años, está casada con Yoban y tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años respectivamente que viven con ella en su casa hecha de madera. Edith se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 10 años junto a su esposo en beneficio de su familia. Desde sus inicios siempre recibió el apoyo de sus padres quienes la estiman por ser muy trabajadora y responsable, es por ello que al tener su primer hijo recibió como herencia adelantada un terreno de media hectárea con plantaciones de cacao que le sirvió para percibir sus primeras ganancias en beneficio de su joven familia. Actualmente cuenta con 3 hectáreas de terreno que dedica a la agricultura y tiene una variedad de productos tales como el cacao orgánico, piña, café y cítricos. Su labor principal junto a su pareja consiste en tratar de mantener óptimas sus plantaciones ya que es el requisito indispensable para obtener una cosecha rentable. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo que poseen plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Edith is 28 years old and is married to Yoban.  They have two children (ages 12 and 8) who live with them in their wood house.  Edith has worked in farming with her husband for more than 10 years so as to support her family.  From the beginning, her parents have supported her and they find her to be very hardworking and responsible.  For this reason, when she had her first child they gave her (as an inheritance in advance) a half hectare of land along with the cocoa trees planted on the land.  This helped her obtain her first profits in the business and support her young family.

She now has 3 hectares of land that she uses for farming and she has a variety of crops such as organic cocoa, pineapple, coffee, and citrus.  When working with her husband, they spend most of their time maintaining their fields.  This is essential in order to obtain a good harvest.  This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support so she can get ahead.  In addition, she promises to make all of her payments on time.

At this time, she is asking for 1,000 sols to buy organic fertilizer so she can fertilize her cocoa fields.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jorge Alexánder

texts.es: Don jorge es un padre de familia. El con su esfuerzo ha logrado tener un pequeño taller mecánico para arreglar automóviles, con lo cual ha dado de sustento a su familia. Sin embargo en el pueblo no existe ningun otro lugar para arreglar automoviles, por lo que le urge comprar materiales para hacer mas grande el taller y así poder atender las necesidades del pueblo, él solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para poder comprar estos materiales y poder seguir dando el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a father of a family. With his efforts, he has achieved having a small mechanics shop for automobile repairs, with which he has given support to his family.

However, in the town there is not another place for automobile repairs, which is why it is urgent for him to purchase materials for making the shop bigger, and in that way being able to attend to the needs of the town. He is requesting a loan of a million colones (Costa Rican currency) in order to be able to purcahse these materials and be able to continue giving support to his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the improvement of a mechanics shop.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sabrina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice.  Sabrina  is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, and eggs for her general store business.

Sabrina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee, soft drinks, and eggs

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is 24 years old, single, and lives in the Chkhorotsku district with his uncle, aunt, grandmother and two underage cousins. The family covers food and daily expenses with the retirement pension of Omar's grandmother. Omar is a very enthusiastic young man and wishes to be financially independent. He decided to start his own business with the help of a loan. Omar requested a loan from MFO Credo and the application was approved within the framework of a startup program that enables inexperienced borrowers to begin new businesses. Omar owns a commercial space, and with the loan received, he will purchase essential equipment such as a vacuum cleaner, hoses and power washers. He will provide services to local community members and hopes to generate income. The new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family and give Omar financial stability. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a vacuum cleaner, hoses and power washers for his car wash

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 29-year-old married father of two children who has been selling clothes for fifteen years. He is a hard worker who puts much effort into improving his business to remain able to meet his family’s and customers’ needs. His business is mobile, since he moves his merchandise from one market to another. 

Khaled needs to improve his business through increasing his merchandise with a newly released autumn and winter collection which he’ll buy at very competitive prices.

For this reason, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, and will work hard to keep on developing his business to keep his customers pleased. In the future, Khaled is hoping to open a wholesale and retail clothes selling shop to settle down in one official place.

loans.use: To buy a collection of newly released autumn and winter clothes

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
La Señora Maria de estado civil casada. de 30 años de edad, no asistio a la escuela. Tiene 5 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando. Se dedica a bordar guipiles típicos. Inició este negocio trabajando para un vecino y hasta la fecha lleva 15 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar tela para bordar guipiles típicos. En el futuro desea tener una tienda grande de ropa típica.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la artesanía y al comercio.
texts.en:
Maria is married, is 30 years old, and has 5 children (two of which are currently in school).  She herself wasn't able to go to school.  She works making guipils (traditional Guatemalan skirts).  She started this business with her neighbor and has been doing it for 15 years.

She has organized a communal bank and is asking for a loan so she can buy fabric to make guipils.  In the future, she wants to have a large traditional clothing store.

The other group members work in sales and also in handicrafts.

loans.use: buy fabric to make guipils (traditional Guatemalan skirts).

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Felix tiene 42 años, está casado con Vilma y tiene 3 hijos que son su principal motivo de vida. Vive junto a su familia en su casa propia hecha de madera. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a la agricultura en su terreno de 2 hectáreas el cual compró con ayuda de sus padres . Fue así que guiado de la experiencia en el campo que ganó junto a sus padres desde muy niño empezó junto a su esposa a cultivar los terrenos que poseían logrando en poco mas de un año vender sus primeras cosechas que fueron en aquel entonces almendras secas de cacao. Su labor principal consiste en brindarle un cuidado y mantenimiento adecuado a las distintas plantaciones siendo el cacao orgánico el producto con más presencia a nivel del área que cultiva. Se siente muy contento con el trabajo que realiza ya que le permite estar siempre con su familia quienes le apoyan constantemente en distintas tareas. Al finalizar cada campaña productiva llevas sus productos hasta los centros de venta con mayor facilidad gracias a un vehículo que adquirió años atrás con el fruto de su trabajo. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de cajas de madera para almacenar sus piñas.
texts.en:
Felix is 42 years old, is married to Vilma, and has 3 children who are his main purpose in life.  He lives with his family in their own house made of wood.  He has been a farmer for 30 years and farms 2 hectares of land which he bought with the help of his parents.  Having received experience in farming from his parents starting when he was very young, he started farming along with his wife.  After more than a year, they were able to sell their first harvest, which was dry cocoa beans at that time.

When working, he spends most of his time maintaining his fields.  Cocoa is the crop that he has the most of.  He enjoys the work that he does, since it allows him to always be with his family (who always support him by doing various farming jobs).  After every harvest, he is able to easily deliver his crops to be sold thanks to a vehicle that he was able to buy some years ago with the money that he earned from farming.

This is his first Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support that he receives to press onward.  In addition, he promises to make all his payments on time.  At this time, he would like to have 1,000 sols so he can buy wooden boxes to store his pineapples.

loans.use: buy wooden boxes to store his pineapples.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 48 years old and married to Elizabeth. Together they are blessed with four children, who are in school. He is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has operated for 25 years. He has applied for a fifth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), after paying his previous loans on time, to enable him to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay for labour. With the anticipated profits, he plans to expand his farming to a large scale and also start a business. He hopes to apply for a bigger loan from KADET to boost his business and also buy dairy cows in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 26 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha de madera y a quienes trata de brindarles una buena calidad de vida. Flor se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy empeñosa ya que tiene la doble responsabilidad familiar de mantener a su familia ya que a pesar de ser joven ha logrado hasta el momento gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo sobrellevar varios obstáculos de su vida cotidiana. Al cumplir 17 años y teniendo ya en brazos a su primer hijo recibió todo el apoyo de sus padres porque desde muy niña fue una gran ayuda  al igual que sus hermanos. Es así que para mantenerse económicamente continuaba apoyando a sus padres de manera abnegada y en recompensa a su buen desempeño sus progenitores le cedieron una hectárea de terreno esperando así independizarse y consolidarse económicamente a largo plazo. Al tener bajo su responsabilidad un terreno considerable para trabajar viene instalando plantaciones de cacao orgánico ya que lo considera un producto muy rentable y que permite recuperar el dinero necesario para su producción de manera inmediata . Comenta que le agrada mucho el trabajo en el campo ya que los terrenos de su localidad poseen terrenos muy fértiles que facilitan la obtención de productos con una calidad muy comercial. Suele en muchas ocasiones usar abono orgánico para mejorar sus cosechas. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En estña oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Flor is 26 years old. She is the single mother of three children who live together with her in her wooden home. She works to provide them with a good quality of life. Flor may be characterized as a dedicated woman who carries the double duty of caring for her family. Though she is young she has been able to do so up to now thanks to her hard work and effort put into overcoming obstacles of daily life. Holding her first child in her arms at seventeen, she received all the help that her parents could provide because ever since she was a young girl she helped them and her siblings out as well.

In order to sustain herself economically in this way, she continued devotedly assisting her parents. As compensation for her dedication, her parents gave her a hectare of land in hopes of making her economically independent and strong in the long run. As she now has a considerable amount of land to work and maintain, she is sowing organic cacao, which she considers to be a highly profitable product that allows her to immediately recuperate the necessary funds to continue production. She notes that she is very grateful to work her field as the land in her area is very fertile, which allows for a higher quality commercial product. She frequently uses organic fertilizer to improve her harvests. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial assistance that she receives to keep her pushing ahead. Furthermore, she promises to make punctual payments. In this cycle she is looking for 1,000 nuevos soles in order to purchase organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Kithinji

texts.en:
Kithinji is a 57-year-old dairy farmer who is married to Mary, a farmer. Their marriage is blessed with two children. Kithinji has been practicing dairy farming for the past seven years with a monthly income of KSH 30,000, which he uses to meet the needs of his family. He also runs a retail shop to supplement his income. 

Kithinji is applying for his third loan from KADET. He will use the loan to buy two dairy cows. 

With the anticipated profit, he will pay school fees for his children. 

Kithinji hopes and dreams that he will be a profit-making and successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia tiene 30 años, está casada con Jhonatan quien también es padre de sus 3 hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha de material noble.
