Posee un terreno de 2 hectáreas que compró con ayuda de su esposo esperando así brindarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida a través del cultivo y venta de productos rentables de su zona como el cacao café, achiote, frutas; entre otros. Se inició en esta labor hace mas de 10 años inducida por sus padres ya que fueron ellos que le inculcaron el oficio de la agricultura al igual que sus hermanos. Realiza su actividad agrícola todos los días obviando en muchas oportunidades los domingos y feriados ya que  es un oficio que requiere de mucha dedicación y responsabilidad. Cuenta con el firme apoyo de su esposo y en ocasiones con el de trabajadores del lugar para tareas colectivas como el retiro de maleza y cosecha de sus productos. Trata siempre de mantener en buen estado sus plantaciones ya que esto beneficia la obtención de frutos con una buena calidad comercial logrando también fertilizarlos con abono orgánico.
Uno de sus principales objetivos es ampliar su producción de cacao orgánico ya que es un producto que presenta un pequeño incremento en su valor comercial y es considerador como el mas fácil de fertilizar a comparación de otros productos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera putnual. 
Desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo de piña y cacao orgánico.
texts.en:
Cynthia is thirty years old and is married to Jhonatan, who is the father of her three children.  They all live together in their own home made of good materials.  She has two hectares of land that she bought with the help of her husband, hoping to thereby be able to offer their children a better quality of life through farming and selling products that are profitable in the area, like cocoa, coffee, annatto tree seeds, fruits, and other items.  

She began this work more than ten years ago with the support of her parents; they taught her and her siblings about agriculture.  She works every day, usually missing out on a lot of activities on Sundays and festival days since farming is a business that requires a lot of dedication and responsibility.  She has the firm support of her husband and also sometimes of the workers in the area for collective jobs, like weeding and harvesting.  She always tries to keep her lands properly maintained, since this ultimately results in high quality commercial fruits.  She also gets these results from fertilizing her crops with organic fertilizer.

One of her main goals is to grow her production of organic cocoa, a product that presents an increase in commercial value and that is considered to be one of the most easy to fertilize.  

This is her first loan with Kiva, and Cynthia feels thankful for the financial support that she receives in order to continue moving forward.  She promises to pay her installments on time.

Cynthia is requesting 1,000 soles to purchase organic fertilizer for her pineapple and organic cocoa crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ermadita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ermadita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Ermadita is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, toothpaste, canned goods, chips, bread, etc., for her general store business.

Ermadita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, toothpaste, canned goods, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Meri

texts.es:
Doña Rosa es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora de 43 años de edad, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 8 hijos los cuales 4 se fueron a vivir a España reciente mente y los otros 4 viven con ella de los cuales 2 están en el colegio colaborando con las diferentes actividades como ser: limpieza, corte, abono, Fumigación, etc. al salir de sus actividades estudiantiles. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria completo cursado hasta el 6 grado y no pudo seguir estudiando por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron el cultivo de café actividad practicada por su familia desde hace mucho tiempo y generaciones y hoy en día en compañía de su esposo. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio gracias al esfuerzo y empeño puesto restringiéndose de muchas cosas para no alquilar y trabajar lo propio.
Hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar abono, fertilizantes y otros insumos que ayuden a prevenir que sus cultivos se infecten con la roya y otras plagas que deterioran la calidad del producto  de esa manera ella podrá dar un mayor y más seguro mantenimiento a sus cultivos.
Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación dando variedad a sus clientes y a todos aquellos que consumen su producto para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar para fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos y sus nietos y que sean ellos los que sigan trabajando la tierra de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Rosa is an entrepreneurial woman and a fighter. She is 43 years old and married with eight children, of which four recently moved to Spain. The other four children live with her. Two of them are in high school and help her with various activities such as cleaning, cutting, fertilizing, fumigating, etc., after completing their academic activities.

Rosa completed her primary education through sixth grade, when she had to stop studying due to the lack of economic support from her parents. Her parents taught her how to cultivate coffee, an activity practiced by her family for many generations, which she continues today with her husband. The land which they cultivate is their own property, thanks to their effort and commitment to restrict themselves from many things to avoid renting.

Presently, she is seeking help to buy compost, fertilizers and other inputs that help prevent crop diseases such as rust and other pests which deteriorate the quality of the product. In this way she will be able to give better and more secure maintenance of her crops.

Her future plan is to have a large plantation offering variety to her customers and all those who consume her products, to generate more income which will strengthen the inheritance left to her children and grandchildren, who will continue to work the land from generation to generation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for the cultivation of coffee

loans.name: Goya

texts.es: Goya es una mujer de 30 años, esta casada con Jhak quien es padre de su pequeño hijo de 10 años. Posee una vivienda hecha de madera en un terreno que sus padres le cedieron. Hace 11 años se inició en las labores agrícolas tales como la producción de cacao, café, achiote y palillo junto a su pareja a manera de buscar un sustento estable para su joven familia. Fue así que usando los ahorros que acumuló con Jhak adquirió un terreno de una hectárea y media,logrando obtener desde entonces sus primeros ingresos por la venta de sus productos. Posee actualmente diversas plantaciones de cacao orgánico, café y cítricos que tienen buena demanda en su localidad. Su labor cotidiana consiste en brindarle un buen mantenimiento a sus diversos cultivos con ayuda de sus esposo ya que la viene apoyando de manera abnegada y contando en mas de una ocasión con el apoyo de trabajadores para tareas colectivas como la cosecha y otros comunes de esta labor. Suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico. Le agrada mucho ir a la capital de su localidad para vender sus productos ya que conoce a los compradores que le otorgan buenos precios por sus productos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Goya is a 30-year-old woman, married to Jhak who is the father of their young 10-year-old son. She has a home made of wood on land that her parents gave her. 

Eleven years ago she began agricultural work such as the production of cocoa, coffee, achiote [a Peruvian herb] and turmeric together with her husband in order to provide stable sustenance for her young family. Using the savings she accumulated with Jhak, she acquired a 1.5-hectare terrain, succeeding in earning her first income through the sale of her products. Currently she has several plantations of organic cocoa, coffee, and citrus fruits, which are in high demand where she lives. 

Her daily labor consists of providing good care for her diverse crops with the help of her husband, who supports her selflessly, and with the occasional support of workers for collective activities such as the harvest. She usually fertilizes her crop lands with organic fertilizer. It pleases her greatly to go to the capital to sell her products, since she knows all of the buyers who give her good prices for her products. 

This is her first loan from Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving to get ahead. In addition she promises to pay her quotas punctually. At this moment she would like 1,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Katty

texts.es: Katty tiene 18, es soltera y aún sin hijos vive en casa de sus padres. Es una joven muy empeñosa y trabajadora que aprendió a laborar en el rubro agrícola desde muy niña apoyando a sus padres en las distintas tareas. Al no tener una ocupación estable, optó por proyectarse en el rubro de la agricultura ya que es un oficio que también vienen dedicándolo sus ancestros logrando así mantenerse económicamente con  el paso de los años. Todas las mañanas acompaña a sus padres hasta sus terrenos donde su familia se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico por ser uno de los productos más rentables de su zona y porque las condiciones del suelo y clima favorecen a la obtención de este producto con una buena calidad comercial ya que acostumbra realizar tareas de mantenimiento adecuadas como el retiro constante de maleza y corte de tallos defectuosos. Al ser muy responsable con su trabajo tiene muchos objetivos a largo plazo y considera que esta en una edad adecuada para cumplir grandes objetivos a largo plazo. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para adquirir un pequeño terreno en donde planea poner plantaciones de cacao orgánico.
texts.en:
Katty is 18 years old, unmarried with no children, and lives with her parents. She is a very diligent and hardworking young woman who learned to do agricultural work from a very young age, supporting her parents in distinct activities. Since she does not have a stable occupation, she opted to commit herself to the field of agriculture since it is the trade of her ancestors which allowed them to support themselves economically through the years.

Every morning she accompanies her parents to their fields where the family works on the production of organic cacao, since it is one of the most profitable products of the region. The soil and climate conditions are conducive to a good commercial quality, and she is accustomed to carrying out maintenance work such as the constant removal of weeds and the pruning of defective stems.

She is very responsible with her work and has many long-term objectives, and considers herself of an appropriate age to achieve grand goals. This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. Additionally she promises to make her payments punctually. At this moment she would like 1,000 nuevos soles to acquire a small plot of land where she plans to plant her own organic cacao.

loans.use: to buy a small plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to expand her chicken coop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 38-year-old beautician. She is married to Patrick, and together they are blessed with two children. Julia has been running a salon business and also sells cereals to increase her income. She has done this for the past 10 years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to meet her needs and those of her family. 

Julia is applying for her first loan term with KADET. She will use the loan to boost her cereal shop with more stock such as sacks of beans, maize and animal feeds. 

With the anticipated profit she will educate her children and expand both her businesses.

Her hopes and dreams are to be successful and offer her family a good life.

loans.use: to boost her cereal shop with more stock such as sacks of beans, maize and animal feeds.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 32-year-old single woman. She has two children with ages 7 years and 12 years. She operates a clothes stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are both ladies and men. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to have a large business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be great. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 34 years old. She is a mother of four children. She sells different foodstuffs in the business that she has been running for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 72 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Crispina is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Crispina has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a young gentleman, aged 28. He has operated a motorcycle transport business in Narok town for the last three years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). He learned about KADET from other riders who are already being financed by KADET LTD.

Peter has been advanced a second loan of 30,000 KES after successfully paying off his previous asset loan. He will use the funds to furnish his house. He will use the business proceeds to repay the loan and cater for his basic needs.

Peter hopes to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to furnish his house.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 58 years old, married and has three children. 

Editha is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Editha requested a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Editha has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 39 years old. She is a mother of four children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. She would like to get the loan to buy more fish for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, a fertile area located at the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She has two children and has been doing this work for 10 years. Her primary income sources are crops; she is employed and besides farming, she has a personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Making profits." Her biggest challenge is: "Insufficient water." An animal on the farm has been given the name of Kairu.

Dorcas was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "They give out their loans at a low interest rate." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Co-guaranteeing among members."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Dorcas replied, "Help raise school fees."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Dorcas owns the following: "cow, pig, poultry," but does not own "pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, electricity, TV, DVD," but does not have "solar power, running water, sewing machine."

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 40 years old and married to Joyce. They have two children who are in school.

He has a boutique business in Naivasha which he has operated for seven years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to purchase stock of clothes for sale. With the anticipated profit, he plans to pay school fees and buy more stock for his business.

In the near future, he hopes to own the biggest boutique in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Yolanda has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 32 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past five years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her stationery shop, which sells exercise books and pens, and does printing and photocopying. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stationery items to sell, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and take care of her child and herself. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to be a lead provider of all essential stationery items in town. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery items to sell

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ian works hard to support his family. He has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.  Ian is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials such as fishing nets, bamboo and wood for the fishing business.

Ian has been sustaining his business activities through his past 19 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save enough money so he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials such as fishing nets, bamboo and wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stocks of ingredients for preparing food such as maize, beans, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 19-year-old single man, who has worked in repairing motorcycles for three years. He was only sixteen years old when he started working to help his parents in their living. 

In August 2008, he started his own business, which was considered as an important step forward towards developing his socioeconomic situation.

Kassem is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy motorcycle spare parts that he needs a lot in his business development.

He will work hard to keep expanding and developing his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts that he needs in his business development.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 50 years old and married with five children.

Marlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like can goods, egg, spices, soap, coffee, etc.

Marlyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Marlyn aspires to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like can goods, egg, spices, soap and coffee.

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Bich was born in 1994. She lives in Dong Anh, Hanoi. She studies nursing in Ha Dong Medical College. Her course lasts 36 months and she will graduate in 2015. Her family has five members. She is the first person in her family to study at university. 

Her mother is a worker and her father is a freelance worker. Bich's mother is standing next to her in this picture. Her family’s income is 10,000,000VND per month. 

Bich is aware that studying will give her opportunities to find a good job and gain more money. She chooses this job because she wants to help people, especially patients. She wants to borrow 10,710,000 VND to pay for her education fee. If she could not access to this loan, she could not study the pharmacy subject or English. Besides lacking the education fee she also has difficulty in paying for learning equipment. 

Bich appreciates the people in this program and she will try her best to study and work hard for the best future. She wants to contribute her little ability to cure the world.

loans.use: to pay for her education fee.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a mother of two children, aged between seven and eight. 

She sells animals and has been in the business for the past three years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more goats to raise and sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a large piece of land for rearing animals, especially goats.

loans.use: To buy more animals such as goats for sale.

loans.name: Sonkoi

texts.en:
Sonkoi is a 30-year-old industrious single gentleman. He is a livestock trader in Narok county, Kenya, and has been running his business for the past three years. He makes a monthly income of KES 7500. 

He learnt about Kadet from other traders in the market who are financed by Kadet Ltd.

He has borrowed his first loan of KES 20000 from Kadet, which he intends to purchase more livestock to fatten and resell for a profit. 

The anticipated profit will be used to purchase a motorcycle for a transport business. His future dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 31 years old and married with two children.

Monaliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of  PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, etc.

Monaliza has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Monaliza aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 52 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga, in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 30 years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his retail shop, in which he sells electrical items. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more electric items to sell, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his electrical shop. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more electric items to sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 28-year-old shopkeeper, who is married to Catherine and their marriage is blessed with two children. Christopher has been running his retail shop for the past six month with a monthly income of Ksh 10,000 which he uses to meet the needs of his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET. He will use the loan to expand his shop and buy more stock such as flour, sugar, oil, etc. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will pay school fees for his child.  

Christopher hopes and dreams that he will start a spare part business in the future.

loans.use: to expand his shop and buy more stock such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Pukas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PUKAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Teresa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de vajillas, venta de frescos, servicio de albañil, tienda de barrio, venta de artículos varios, venta de productos lácteos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Teresa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promoción de la institución que se hizo en zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de colchas; este negocio lo aprendió de su hermana, cuando viajaba a Oruro, posteriormente cuando tuvo su primer hijo decide implementar su propio negocio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de colchas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Pukas village bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana regional center. The group has eight members and is led by a board and its president, María Teresa. The members have a variety of businesses, including selling china, selling soft drinks, masonry, a neighborhood shop, selling miscellaneous items, and selling dairy products.

The loan will benefit the businesses of the group members, including María Teresa. She says she joined Pro Mujer two years ago because of an ad she saw in the area. At the moment she has a business selling bedspreads. She learned the business from her sister when she used to travel to Oruro; later, when she had her first child, she decided to start her own business. 
 
She will use this loan to increase her working capital and buy more bedspreads, which she purchases in the markets in the city of Oruro and then sells in her own shop. This work provides her with the resources to support her household, since she is unmarried and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the information provided about health and finances.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 36-year-old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be committed. Joseph operates a grocery store where he sells bananas and tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good market and his primary customers are the general public. Joseph describes his biggest business challenge to be the increasing costs of foodstuffs. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stocks of bananas and tomatoes. His business goal is to open a wholesale shop within 5 years. Joseph hopes that in the future, he will be self reliant. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stocks of bananas and tomatoes

loans.name: Tuan

texts.en:
Tuan was born in 1994. He lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh, Vietnam. He is studying a business administration major at University of Kinh Bac (http://www.daihockinhbac.edu.vn/). His course lasts 40 months and he will graduate in 2016. 
Tuan’s family has four members. His parents are retired. They have two sons. Tuan is his parents’ oldest son and also the first person in his family who has graduated high school and has a higher education. His family’s income is about 10,000,000 VND. His mother Tho, who sits next to him in this picture, is also a member of SEDA’s credit program. Tuan has a passion for his major because he wants to be a good manager. He understands that higher learning gives him knowledge and opportunities to get a high-paid job. He wants to borrow 15,300,000 VND to pay for his educational fees. Besides lacking in studying tools, Tuan has other difficulties, such as his living fees and transportation fees. Through this program, he wants to tell people that he appreciates the help of people all around the world whose have contributed to this kind of program. This has been very supportive both to the education of himself as an individual and of the Vietnamese youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which grows a lot of 'miraa', which can be chewed like tobacco. Eunice has 1 child and has been doing her work for 15 years. Her primary income sources are crops and milk. Besides farming she has a personal business as an extra source of income.

Eunice stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'high returns from farm output.' Her biggest challenge is 'insufficient cash.' Animals on the farm have been given the name of 'Njiru.'

Eunice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'it offers better services than other micro finances.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'savings are used as collateral.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'how will this loan benefit her family', Eunice replied 'improved living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Eunice owns the following: 'cow, pig' but does not own 'poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, sewing machine, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water'.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Naisianta

texts.en:
Naisianta is 45 years old, married and supports a family of seven members, with her children aged between 3 and 24 years. She learnt about Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) from other farmers in her area who have already been financed by KADET Ltd. She is a mixed farmer and has been in the business for the last five years. Her monthly income is 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Naisianta is currently servicing her fifth loan from KADET of 60,000 KES, which will facilitate in preparing the land and purchasing planting seedlings. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. Her future dream is to improve the living standards of her family

loans.use: to prepare the land and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Alex has been working hard to manage his clinic, where he sells drugs to sick people. 

To help expand his business, Alex has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drugs for the clinic and other medical equipment. This loan will help Alex to generate greater profits and take his children to better schools. Alex hopes that in the future he will be able to start another business. 

Alex is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs such as Alex who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs for the clinic and other medical equipment.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha was born in 1994. He lives in the Bac Ninh province of Vietnam. He studies ship control at Maritime College No 1. His course lasts 30 months and he will graduate in 2015. His education fees are subsidized by his parents. Ha plans to find a part-time job to have more money to pay for his education fees. 

Ha’s family has five members. He is the first person in his family that has a higher education. His mother sells fruits in the market. His father is a helper in ships. His mother is with him in the posted photo. His family’s income is about 20,000,000 VND per month. Ha understands that learning helps him have qualifications to get a high-paid job and earn an income for his family, so he wants to complete his education. 

He wants to borrow 15,300,000 VND to pay for his education fees. If he isn't able to access this loan, he will not be able to complete his studies.  He appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. He also hopes this program could be expanded more to help additional students.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is 34 years old and married to John. They have two children who are in school.

Lydiah has a business selling charcoal in Naivasha. She has operated this business for three years and has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to purchase stock of charcoal for sale. With the anticipated profits, she plans to pay the school fees for her children and buy more stock for her business.

Lydiah hopes to become the top charcoal dealer in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 53-year-old shopkeeper. He is married to Magdalene and together they are blessed with three children. Geoffrey has been running his general store for the past year with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

Geoffrey is applying for his first loan term with KADET. Geoffrey will use the loan to buy more stock for his general shop such as cooking fat, oil, cosmetics, utensils etc. With the anticipated profit from the business he will renovate his shop and pay school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to invest into wholesale and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his general shop such as cooking fat, oil, cosmetics and utensils.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 37 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Fe has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 53 years old and has six children. Juanita is married and has one child who is still in school.

Juanita is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her cattle.

Juanita has been raising cattle for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Juanita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Paulita is 51 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Paulita has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. Paulita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Paulita has been in this business for a year. In the future, Paulita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 30 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells agriculture equipment. 

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more ploughs, hoes and axes to sell, and will help Ronald to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children in better schools. Ronald hopes that in the future he will be able to construct a residential house of his own. 

Ronald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ronald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more ploughs, hoes and axes to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 29-year-old married man. He has one child who is three years old. He describes himself as creative. He operates a barber shop where he shaves hair. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a urban area and his primary customers are common citizens. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a hair-cutting machine and chairs for use in the barber shop. His business goal is to own a car within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will achieve his goals. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a hair-cutting machine and chairs.

loans.name: Juannette

texts.en:
Juannette is 30 years old. She is married with two children and her husband works as a civil servant. 

For the past three years, she has sold construction materials. With the loan, she would like to buy more construction supplies to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more contruction materials to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, located at the slopes of Mt.Kenya. She has three children and has been doing this work for 20 years. Her primary income sources are milk, crops, personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Selling farm output.' Her biggest challenge is 'Poor markets.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Kanini.'

Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'it offers low interest rates.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Savings are used as collateral.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Mary replied 'Help raise school fees.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mary owns the following: 'cow, pig, poultry' but does not own 'pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine'.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Kipngetich

texts.en:
Kipngetich is a single gentleman aged 39 years. He has operated a motorcycle transport business in Bomet town and its outskirts for the last year. He earns approximately KES 10,000 in a month. He learnt about Kadet from a loan officer who was carrying out a markerting compaign in the area.

He has acquired his first loan of KES 20,000 which will facilitate the repair and replacement of the broken parts of the motorcycle. This will ensure that the business runs smoothly. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan as well as to cater for his basic needs.

He hopes to acquire a new motorcycle one he has saved enough for it.

loans.use: to repair his broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Pedro Daniel

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 21 años y para poder salir adelante trabaja como operario en una pequeña empresa en su ciudad, con lo cual puede sacar adelante a su familia en especial a su pequeño de 7 meses; Pedro cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Pedro está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias  a la ayudad que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una bodega y darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Pedro is 21 years old, and in order to get ahead, he works as a machine operator for a small company from his city. This is how he supports his family, especially his son, who is 7 months old. Pedro believes that he does well in his job because he is responsible.

Pedro appreciates the help that Kiva lenders have given him. He will buy construction materials to make some home improvements and improve his family’s quality of life. He will continue fighting to make his dream come true: “To own a store and see his son become a professional.”

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Laura Del Rosario

texts.es:
Laura cliente de 39 años de edad, quien nació en la ciudad de Latacunga, perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi,  una de las provincias más reconocidas por su gente trabajadora del país Ecuador. Ella actualmente está  divorciada de su esposo y tiene dos hijos Alexander de dieciséis  y Kevin de nueve años, quienes viven con su madre en una casa que le dejo su ex esposo. El obstáculo más grande que ha tenido que atravesar fue la separación de su esposo, ya que era él quien solventaba todos los gastos del hogar, y al separarse Laura tuvo que salir a buscar trabajo y aunque al principio fue muy difícil por sus hijos pequeños no le era fácil encargarlos con algún familiar, razón por la cual Laura pidió apoyo a una de sus hermanas para solicitarle trabajo el mismo que consistía en cuidar de sus animales (pollos). 
Laura ha sido un apoyo incondicional para sus hijos ya que su padre no se ocupa de ellos desde ya hace mucho tiempo atrás, hoy en día Laura se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, para los cuales cuenta con galpones pequeños; esta actividad la aprendió de su hermana de quien recibe ayuda de este negocio desde ya hace algún tiempo atrás. Además de la crianza de aves también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, la actividad más difícil de este negocio es sin duda alguna la falta de transporte para el traslado de los pollos, ya que  gasta mucho en transporte.
Su sueño y anhelo es poder dar a sus hijos una buena educación y un mejor estilo de vida, para que a futuro no les pueda faltar nada.  Necesita el crédito para la compra de más balanceado (alimento para los pollos)ya que al tener un pedido muy grande tiene un faltante de alimento , Laura y sus hijos quieren  extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Laura is 39 years old and was born in the city of Latacunga, in the province of Cotopaxi, which is known in Ecuador for its hardworking people. She is divorced and has two children (Alexander, 16, and Kevin, 9) that live with her in a house her ex-husband left her. The biggest challenge she has had to face was the divorce, since her husband was who covered the home expenses. She then had to look for a job, which was difficult at the beginning because it was difficult to find someone to take care of her children. Laura started working with one of her sisters, raising chickens.

Laura has given her children unconditional support, since their father has not supported them for a long time. Laura works today raising and selling chickens, which she keeps in small pens. She learned this activity from her sister, who has been helping her for a while now. Besides poultry, she also sells beauty products on a catalog. The most difficult part for her is to find transport for her chickens; she spends a lot of money in transport.

Her dream and wish is to give her children a good education and a better quality of life, so that they can have everything they need in the future. She needs this loan to buy animal feed in order to fulfill her orders. Laura and her children would like to extend their sincere appreciation and want to congratulate Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making her professional and personal growth a reality.

loans.use: to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is 20 years old. He lives in Mafraq, in Jordan, with his seven siblings and his parents. Abdullah is studying for a Bachelor of Nursing degree and is in his second year. He is planning to continue his studies and to work in his field of study after graduation, in order to start helping his family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay his fees for the upcoming semester. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay his university fees to continue his nursing studies during the upcoming semester.

loans.name: Percy

texts.en: Percy is 37 years, married, and has two children. Percy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her store. Percy has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the store for two years and earns additional income from raising pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her general store. Percy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 21-year-old single man who began working as a butcher five years ago. In December 2012, he established his own business, to improve his living. He provides his customers with very good quality of meat at special prices. He is taking out a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy cows, which will help to increase his business capital. As for the future, Ali wishes to develop his business and to keep it capable of responding to the increasing demand from his customers.

loans.use: to buy cows, which will help to increase his business capital.

loans.name: Waad

texts.en: Waad is 19 years old. She lives in a rented house in Zarqa, in Jordan, with her three siblings and her parents. Waad is studying for her diploma at the university and is in her second year of taking courses. She is planning to continue her study and to work in her chosen field after graduation, in order to start helping her family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping them to pay her fees for the upcoming semester. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay her university fees  for the upcoming semester.

loans.name: Cesar Oswaldo

texts.es:
César es oriundo de la ciudad de Latacunga del barrio Santán, vive en casa de familiares ya que hace algún tiempo se separó de su esposa, el mayor obstáculo que ha tenido en su vida ha sido sin lugar a duda esta triste separación, desde ese momento todo le ha sido un poco más complicado ya que su esposa era su apoyo económico, pese a todo esto César ha tenido que luchar y salir adelante solo, ahora cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, a César le gusta mucho hacer deporte ya que esto le ayuda a mantenerse sano y por un momento olvida su dolor, César se dedica desde hace algunos años a la crianza  y venta de pollos, y además para solventar sus gastos y cumplir con las obligaciones con sus hijos es maestro pintor de casas, habilidad que la aprendió desde muy pequeño ya que su padre y tíos practicaban esta actividad. 
Trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana cuidando de sus aves para luego salir a la ciudad a trabajar pintando casas, a pesar de lo duro que es el cuidado de las aves y el tiempo que le lleva el trabajo, César se da el tiempo necesario para compartir con sus hijos por lo menos un fin de semana. 
César tiene un sueño muy grande e importante en su vida y es el de tener su casa propia para poder compartir con sus hijos, necesita el crédito para construir un galpón para sus pollos  ya que por el momento no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para la actividad, con este galpón podrá incrementar más pollos y por ende tener mayor utilidad, es por esto que César agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida familiar y personal.
texts.en:
César was born in the city of Latacunga in the Santán community. He lives with his relatives as he separated from his wife a while ago. Without a doubt, this sad separation has been the biggest hurdle he has had to overcome in his life. From that moment on, everything has been a bit more difficult for him since his wife supported him financially.  In spite of everything, César has had to fight to keep going on alone, but now he has the support of his family. César likes to play sport a lot, as this helps to keep him healthy and to momentarily forget his pain. 

César has been raising and selling chickens for years. As well as that, in order to pay his bills and fulfill his financial obligations to his children, he is also an expert house painter, having learnt this skill when he was young from his father and uncles, who also used to be painters.

César works from very early in the morning caring for his birds and later goes into the city to work painting houses. Even though it is difficult to care for the birds as well as spending time working, César makes sure he has enough time for his children, at least on weekends.

César has a very big and important life dream, and that is to have his own house which he can share with his children. He needs this loan to build a shed for his chickens as they only have very basic lodgings at the moment. With this shed César will be able to increase the amount of chickens he keeps, which will be more beneficial for him. César gives thanks to Fundación Alternativa in Equador  and to Kiva for making the improvement of his family and personal life possible.

loans.use: to build a shed where he can raise chickens

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 34 años, es soltera y tiene una hija de 15 años que vive junto a ella en su casa hecha de material noble. Tras varios años de trabajo en el campo logró reunir dinero para cumplir uno de sus objetivos que consistía en poner su propia tienda de productos comestibles. Es un negocio que optó iniciar ya que lo considera rentable gracias a los clientes que visitan su establecimiento para la compra de distintos productos tales como arroz, azúcar, cereales, conservas; entre otros. Desempeña este negocio principalmente en horas de la mañana y de muy madrugada ya que es en donde varios clientes suyos que son agricultores preparan sus alimentos para el día, es por ello que debe también de mantener su negocio bien abastecido y también al por mayor porque logra obtenerlos a un buen precio. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasion desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor como sacos de arroz, azúcar, huevos frescos y paquetes de gaseosa.
texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old, she is single and lives with her 15-year-old daughter in a house made of solid materials.

After several years of working in the field, she managed to raise money to reach one of her goals, which was to set up her own grocery store. She chose this business because she considers it to be profitable thanks to the customers who come to her store to buy various products such as rice, sugar, cereals, canned food, and more. She opens her store mainly very early in the morning, because many of her customers work in the field and obtain their food for the day in her store. Therefore, she needs to keep her business well stocked and to buy wholesale in order to offer them a good price.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the financial help she receives to get ahead. Also, she promises to pay her dues on time. This time she would like to borrow 1,000 nuevos soles to buy wholesale merchandise such as bags of rice, sugar, fresh eggs, and soft drink cases.

loans.use: to buy food products such as rice, sugar, fresh eggs, and soft drink cases.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto tiene 35 años, es padre soltero de su pequeña hija de 12 años de edad que vive con él en su casa hecha de material noble. Hace más de años 16 años se inició en el rubro agrícola inducido por sus padres ya que no contaba con un oficio estable para el futuro sustento de su familia. Fue así que sus progenitores le cedieron una parcela de 5 cuadras con plantaciones de cacao y  empezó inmediatamente a trabajarlos brindándole el mantenimiento adecuado. Hasta el momento viene siendo su principal fuente de ingreso y le permite mantener económicamente a su única hija. Para obtener una producción con calidad óptima suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico. Al término de la campaña productiva prefiere personalmente llevar sus productos hasta la capital de su localidad donde los vende al precio vigente logrando así recuperar de manera inmediata el dinero que suele invertir. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para la compra  de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 35 years old and single father of a young 12-year-old daughter who lives with him in their house which is made of solid materials.

More than 16 years ago he began to work in agriculture prompted by his parents, because he did not have a stable job to support his family in the future. Therefore his parents gave him a small plot of 8 acres with cocoa trees and he started to work and provide the necessary care for his crop at once. So far this has been his main source of income and allows him to financially support his only child. 

In order to obtain a crop of the best quality, he uses organic fertilizer on his farmland. After the harvest he likes to bring his goods himself to the capital of his community where he sells them at the current price. By this he can immediately recover the money he invests.

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is thankful for the financial help he receives in order to get ahead. Also, he promises to pay his dues on time. He would like to use this opportunity to borrow 500 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
Rosmeri es una joven de 21 años, está casada con Denys y tiene una hija de dos añitos con quien vive en su casa propia. Al comprometerse inició su vida familiar y con la llegada de su pequeña hija optó por iniciarse junto a su pareja en el rubro de la agricultura logrando así mantenerse económicamente a través de la producción y venta de almendras de cacao por ser uno de los productos más rentables de su zona.
Es propietaria de 1 hectárea y media de terreno repleto con plantaciones de cacao, café y árboles frutales.
Tiene el constante apoyo de su esposo y también de los trabajadores que contrata para tareas complicadas tales como el retiro de maleza y cosecha. Al poseer una parcela algo distante del pueblo donde reside debe de dirigirse desde muy temprano para lograr culminar sus distintas tareas agrícolas en el transcurso del día y retornar antes del atardecer. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Rosmeri is a young 21 year old woman who lives in her own home with her husband Denys and her two year old daughter. When she got engaged Rosmeri began her family, and after the arrival of her young daughter she decided to work alongside her partner in the field of agriculture. In doing so she has been able to keep going financially thanks to the harvest and sale of cacao almonds, one of the most profitable products in the area. Her property is 1.5 hectares and brimming with cacao, coffee and fruit tree plantations. 

Rosmeri has the continual support of her husband as well as the workers she hires for the difficult jobs, such as pulling out weeds and harvesting crops. Having a plot of land far away from the town where she lives means she has to make a start very early in the morning to attend to all of her agricultural tasks during the day before coming home by sunset. 

This is Romeri’s first loan with Kiva. She is grateful for the financial support she will receive so that she can keep going. She also promises to make her repayments on time. Rosmeri would like 1000 nuevos soles to purchase organic fertilizer to provide nutrients for her seedlings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertiliser

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives and works outside of Kwale town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the national average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

John is married and has four children. His wife works selling washing machines, and John engages in projects on their land. He has been farming for six years and is currently growing cashew nuts. He is excited to start beekeeping because it is an opportunity to earn from natural forests around his farm.

This is John’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to help pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives and works close to Kimilili, near Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia, one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Moses is married and has thirteen children. Both he and his wife do some work around the farm and are currently growing maize, bananas, cassava, trees, sugarcane, and potatoes. Moses is excited to start beekeeping because “honey production is easy to manage. I love honey and am happy I will finally be able to participate in its production.”

This is Moses’ first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives “to educate my children as well as help orphans around my home.” When asked about his hopes for the future, Moses said “I am disabled and this project will enable me to seek medication and live a more fulfilling life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives near Cherengani, an area close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

James is married, and has four children. His wife is also a farmer and they have been farming together for the last 12 years. They cultivate maize and beans, and rear livestock.

In past years his farming activities have been adversely affected due to the 2007/2008 post election violence that had characterized this region, as James belongs to a different ethnic group than many of the area’s inhabitants. He believes that bee keeping will go a long way in providing the necessary funds to rectify this. He is very grateful to KIVA and Honey Care Africa for this initiative. James’ hope for the future is that all will be well with the new government and the new constitution and that he will be able improve his farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson lives and works on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Samson is married and has eleven children and many grandchildren. He has been farming for sixty-two years and is currently growing a fruit orchard, vegetables, maize, beans and horticultural products. He is excited to start beekeeping because keeping bees has always been a dream of his, and now he will have honey which he can sell. 

This is Samson’s first loan with Kiva and Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives as “a safety kit for my old age.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Kenan

texts.en:
Kenan lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Kenan is single and is currently working on some projects on his land. He is a relatively new farmer with two years of experience, and is currently growing maize, beans and bananas. He likes beekeeping because it is an income-generating activity that does not require much labor. 

This is Kenan’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to invest in his farm. Kenan’s hope for the future is to “further my education and live a fulfilling life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander lives on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Alexander is married, and has seven children. He has been farming for 40 years, and is currently growing maize, livestock, vegetables, and bananas, and he has a small factory for animal feed. Alexander is excited to start beekeeping because “honey is good as food...I use it instead of sugar. The involvement is minimal.”

This is Alexander’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to further invest in beekeeping. Alexander’s dream for the future is “to compete nationally in agriculture overall. [I] have been awarded in our county for having the best farm as well as the best dairy animal and don't see why my effort in mixed farming can't be emulated country wide. I want my farm to be a training model for others.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon lives in a small town outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensure that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Solomon is married and has four children. Both he and his wife have been farming for five years, and are currently growing vegetables, bananas, maize, flowers, and a tree nursery for saplings. Solomon likes beekeeping because it is easy to manage compared to other farm activities, and leaves him enough time to take care of his other projects. 

This is Solomon’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his hives to “buy a dairy cow and educate my children.” His dream for the future is “to see my children doing better than myself.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William lives in a small village outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

William is married, and he has five children. Both he and his wife are farmers.  They are are currently growing maize, bananas, and vegetables as well as tending to an orchard. 

William thinks that beekeeping is a great business: “It is not involving. You can get money from honey by just improving the environment by planting trees.”

This is William’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income from his beehives to pay for his children’s education. William’s hope for the future is “to live comfortable and never lack anything for my family's well being.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis lives and works on a farm outside of Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and, at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Phyllis is a single mother of four children. She has been farming for 10 years, and she is currently growing maize and bananas as well as rearing livestock. She is excited to start beekeeping because “it is easy. Anybody with passion about bee keeping can do it with ease. Bee keeping is also new to this area and [I] am sure as pioneers we shall benefit enormously.” 

This is Phyllis’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to invest in her farm. When asked about her hopes for the future, Phyllis said she wants to “enjoy the fruit of my labour in good health by consuming good food like honey and live a fulfilling life.”

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary material for honey production.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives on a farm outside of Kitale town.  Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya.  It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border.  Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway.  The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping.  Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage. 

Peter is married, and has two children.  His wife works as a business lady, while he farms their land.  He has been farming for six years, and is currently growing vegetables, maize, bananas, animal fodder and tends to livestock.  He is excited to start beekeeping because it is a new project for the region, and “as pioneers, we shall enjoy the benefits that will come with it.”

This is Peter’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to add to the savings he has stockpiled for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in a small village close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region. 

Nancy is married, and has five children. Her husband is a police officer, while Nancy farms and acts as the Treasurer of her local Self Help Group. Nancy is currently growing maize, bananas, and vegetables as well as livestock.

She is grateful to KIVA and Honey Care Africa helping the group achieve their objective of bee keeping. She wants the project to succeed and she will put a lot of her hours to see that this happen.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in a small village close to Kitale town. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting blue gum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.  

Margaret is married, and she and her husband have been farming for a period of 9 years. They cultivate maize, beans, potatoes and vegetables as well as rearing livestock such as cows, goats and poultry.

Margaret is very excited about this project. As a member of her local Self Help Group, she and other members have always wanted to do bee keeping but financing it was a problem. She is grateful to Kiva for this opportunity. 

This is Margaret’s first loan, and she plans to retain all earnings form the hives to add more hives to her farm.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Magodi, a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

John is married, and has two children. Both him and his wife farm their land, and they are currently growing passion fruit. John is excited to start beekeeping because it will be a good opportunity for him to earn income from his land. 

This is John’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay his children’s school fees. John’s hope for the future is to save up enough money to start growing grafted oranges.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Hendry

texts.en:
Hendry lives and works outside of Sagalato, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Hendry is married, and has six children. Both he and his wife have been farming for sixteen years, and are currently tending to an orange orchard on their land. Hendry is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as it will afford him a good source of income from his land. 

This is Hendry’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Hendry’s hope for the future is to “educate my children all the way to university.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives close to Kwale town, in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives.

Peter is married, and has two children. His wife works as a real estate manager, while he engages with projects on their land. He has been farming for eight years, and is currently growing cashew nuts. He likes beekeeping because “bees indicate [a] healthy environment,” and hopes to expand his apiary in the future. 

This is Peter’s first loan, and he plans to use the income generated by his beehives to build a farmhouse on his land.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives and works in Mwambalazi in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Samuel is married and has eight children. His wife works as a businesswoman, and Samuel farms their land. He has been farming for thirty years and is currently growing oranges, passion fruit, and sesame plants (known locally as simsim). He likes bees because they will pollinate his crops and create honey for his family to eat. 

This is Samuel’s first loan with Kiva's partner Honey Care Africa.  He plans to use the income from his hives to expand his orange orchard and increase his number of passion fruit stands.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick lives and works in Magodi, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. 

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Erick is married and has four children. His wife operates a small grocery shop and Erick plans to use some of the income generated by his beehives to help stock and expand the shop. He likes beekeeping because it allows him to “utilize natural forest around.”

This is Erick’s first loan with Honey Care, and his hope for the future is to save up enough money to expand his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives and works close to Kinondo in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Robert is married and has one child. His wife works as a grocer, while Robert engages in projects on their land. He has been farming for five years, and is currently growing bananas. He is excited to become a beekeeper because it will be “an opportunity to learn about bees,” which he finds to be interesting creatures. 

This is Robert’s first loan with Kiva, and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to help build a family house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.
